properties.description: Internal Phaser Type value.
properties.name: type

properties.description: The const physics body type of this object.
properties.name: physicsType

properties.description: The area of the emitter. Particles can be randomly generated from anywhere within this rectangle.
properties.name: area

properties.description: The minimum possible velocity of a particle.
properties.name: minParticleSpeed

properties.description: The maximum possible velocity of a particle.
properties.name: maxParticleSpeed

properties.description: The minimum possible scale of a particle. This is applied to the X and Y axis. If you need to control each axis see minParticleScaleX.
properties.name: minParticleScale

properties.description: The maximum possible scale of a particle. This is applied to the X and Y axis. If you need to control each axis see maxParticleScaleX.
properties.name: maxParticleScale

properties.description: An array of the calculated scale easing data applied to particles with scaleRates > 0.
properties.name: scaleData

properties.description: The minimum possible angular velocity of a particle.
properties.name: minRotation

properties.description: The maximum possible angular velocity of a particle.
properties.name: maxRotation

properties.description: The minimum possible alpha value of a particle.
properties.name: minParticleAlpha

properties.description: The maximum possible alpha value of a particle.
properties.name: maxParticleAlpha

properties.description: An array of the calculated alpha easing data applied to particles with alphaRates > 0.
properties.name: alphaData

properties.description: Sets the `body.gravity.y` of each particle sprite to this value on launch.
properties.name: gravity

properties.description: For emitting your own particle class types. They must extend Phaser.Particle.
properties.name: particleClass

properties.description: The X and Y drag component of particles launched from the emitter.
properties.name: particleDrag

properties.description: The angular drag component of particles launched from the emitter if they are rotating.
properties.name: angularDrag

properties.description: How often a particle is emitted in ms (if emitter is started with Explode === false).
properties.name: frequency

properties.description: How long each particle lives once it is emitted in ms. Default is 2 seconds. Set lifespan to 'zero' for particles to live forever.
properties.name: lifespan

properties.description: How much each particle should bounce on each axis. 1 = full bounce, 0 = no bounce.
properties.name: bounce

properties.description: Determines whether the emitter is currently emitting particles. It is totally safe to directly toggle this.
properties.name: on

properties.description: When a particle is created its anchor will be set to match this Point object (defaults to x/y: 0.5 to aid in rotation)
properties.name: particleAnchor

properties.description: The blendMode as set on the particle when emitted from the Emitter. Defaults to NORMAL. Needs browser capable of supporting canvas blend-modes (most not available in WebGL)
properties.name: blendMode

name: emitX
description:
The point the particles are emitted from.
Emitter.x and Emitter.y control the containers location, which updates all current particles
Emitter.emitX and Emitter.emitY control the emission location relative to the x/y position.

name: emitY
description:
The point the particles are emitted from.
Emitter.x and Emitter.y control the containers location, which updates all current particles
Emitter.emitX and Emitter.emitY control the emission location relative to the x/y position.

properties.description: When a new Particle is emitted this controls if it will automatically scale in size. Use Emitter.setScale to configure.
properties.name: autoScale

properties.description: When a new Particle is emitted this controls if it will automatically change alpha. Use Emitter.setAlpha to configure.
properties.name: autoAlpha

properties.description: If this is `true` then when the Particle is emitted it will be bought to the top of the Emitters display list.
properties.name: particleBringToTop

properties.description: If this is `true` then when the Particle is emitted it will be sent to the back of the Emitters display list.
properties.name: particleSendToBack

properties.description: Gets or sets the width of the Emitter. This is the region in which a particle can be emitted.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Gets or sets the height of the Emitter. This is the region in which a particle can be emitted.
properties.name: height

properties.description: Gets or sets the x position of the Emitter.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Gets or sets the y position of the Emitter.
properties.name: y

properties.description: Gets the left position of the Emitter.
properties.name: left

properties.description: Gets the right position of the Emitter.
properties.name: right

properties.description: Gets the top position of the Emitter.
properties.name: top

properties.description: Gets the bottom position of the Emitter.
properties.name: bottom

properties.description: A reference to the currently running game.
properties.name: game

properties.description: The key of the Video in the Cache, if stored there. Will be `null` if this Video is using the webcam instead.
properties.name: key

properties.description: The width of the video in pixels.
properties.name: width

properties.description: The height of the video in pixels.
properties.name: height

properties.description: The const type of this object.
properties.name: type

properties.description: If true this video will never send its image data to the GPU when its dirty flag is true. This only applies in WebGL.
properties.name: disableTextureUpload

properties.description: true if this video is currently locked awaiting a touch event. This happens on some mobile devices, such as iOS.
properties.name: touchLocked

properties.description: This signal is dispatched when the Video starts to play. It sends 3 parameters: a reference to the Video object, if the video is set to loop or not and the playback rate.
properties.name: onPlay

properties.description: This signal is dispatched if the Video source is changed. It sends 3 parameters: a reference to the Video object and the new width and height of the new video source.
properties.name: onChangeSource

properties.description: This signal is dispatched when the Video completes playback, i.e. enters an 'ended' state. Videos set to loop will never dispatch this signal.
properties.name: onComplete

properties.description: This signal is dispatched if the user allows access to their webcam.
properties.name: onAccess

properties.description: This signal is dispatched if an error occurs either getting permission to use the webcam (for a Video Stream) or when trying to play back a video file.
properties.name: onError

name: onTimeout
description:
This signal is dispatched if when asking for permission to use the webcam no response is given within a the Video.timeout limit.
This may be because the user has picked `Not now` in the permissions window, or there is a delay in establishing the LocalMediaStream.

properties.description: The amount of ms allowed to elapsed before the Video.onTimeout signal is dispatched while waiting for webcam access.
properties.name: timeout

properties.description: The HTML Video Element that is added to the document.
properties.name: video

properties.description: The Video Stream data. Only set if this Video is streaming from the webcam via `startMediaStream`.
properties.name: videoStream

properties.description: Is there a streaming video source? I.e. from a webcam.
properties.name: isStreaming

name: retryLimit
description:
When starting playback of a video Phaser will monitor its readyState using a setTimeout call.
The setTimeout happens once every `Video.retryInterval` ms. It will carry on monitoring the video
state in this manner until the `retryLimit` is reached and then abort.

properties.description: The current retry attempt.
properties.name: retry

properties.description: The number of ms between each retry at monitoring the status of a downloading video.
properties.name: retryInterval

properties.description: The PIXI.Texture.
properties.name: texture

properties.description: The Frame this video uses for rendering.
properties.name: textureFrame

name: snapshot
description:
A snapshot grabbed from the video. This is initially black. Populate it by calling Video.grab().
When called the BitmapData is updated with a grab taken from the current video playing or active video stream.
If Phaser has been compiled without BitmapData support this property will always be `null`.

properties.description: Gets or sets the muted state of the Video.
properties.name: mute

name: paused
description:
Gets or sets the paused state of the Video.
If the video is still touch locked (such as on iOS devices) this call has no effect.

properties.description: Gets or sets the volume of the Video, a value between 0 and 1. The value given is clamped to the range 0 to 1.
properties.name: volume

properties.description: Gets or sets the playback rate of the Video. This is the speed at which the video is playing.
properties.name: playbackRate

name: loop
description:
Gets or sets if the Video is set to loop.
Please note that at present some browsers (i.e. Chrome) do not support *seamless* video looping.
If the video isn't yet set this will always return false.

properties.description: True if the video is currently playing (and not paused or ended), otherwise false.
properties.name: playing

name: total
description: Total number of existing children in the group.

name: length
description: Total number of children in this group, regardless of exists/alive status.

name: angle
description:
The angle of rotation of the group container, in degrees.

This adjusts the group itself by modifying its local rotation transform.

This has no impact on the rotation/angle properties of the children, but it will update their worldTransform
and on-screen orientation and position.

name: x
description:
The x coordinate of the group container.

You can adjust the group container itself by modifying its coordinates.
This will have no impact on the x/y coordinates of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

name: y
description:
The y coordinate of the group container.

You can adjust the group container itself by modifying its coordinates.
This will have no impact on the x/y coordinates of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

name: rotation
description:
The angle of rotation of the group container, in radians.

This will adjust the group container itself by modifying its rotation.
This will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

name: visible
description: The visible state of the group. Non-visible Groups and all of their children are not rendered.

description: The alpha value of the group container.

name: chanceRoll
description:
Generate a random bool result based on the chance value.

Returns true or false based on the chance value (default 50%). For example if you wanted a player to have a 30% chance
of getting a bonus, call chanceRoll(30) - true means the chance passed, false means it failed.

params.description: The chance of receiving the value. A number between 0 and 100 (effectively 0% to 100%).
params.name: chance

returns.description: True if the roll passed, or false otherwise.

name: randomChoice
description: Choose between one of two values randomly.

returns.description: The randomly selected choice

name: circumference
description: The circumference of the circle.

returns.description: The circumference of the circle.

name: random
description: Returns a uniformly distributed random point from anywhere within this Circle.

params.description:
A Phaser.Point, or any object with public x/y properties, that the values will be set in.
    If no object is provided a new Phaser.Point object will be created. In high performance areas avoid this by re-using an existing object.
params.name: out

returns.description: An object containing the random point in its `x` and `y` properties.

name: getBounds
description: Returns the framing rectangle of the circle as a Phaser.Rectangle object.

returns.description: The bounds of the Circle.

name: setTo
description: Sets the members of Circle to the specified values.

params.description: The x coordinate of the center of the circle.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate of the center of the circle.
params.name: y

params.description: The diameter of the circle.
params.name: diameter

returns.description: This circle object.

name: copyFrom
description: Copies the x, y and diameter properties from any given object to this Circle.

params.description: The object to copy from.
params.name: source

returns.description: This Circle object.

name: copyTo
description: Copies the x, y and diameter properties from this Circle to any given object.

params.description: The object to copy to.
params.name: dest

returns.description: This dest object.

name: distance
description:
Returns the distance from the center of the Circle object to the given object
(can be Circle, Point or anything with x/y properties)

params.description: The target object. Must have visible x and y properties that represent the center of the object.
params.name: dest

params.description: Round the distance to the nearest integer.
params.name: round

returns.description: The distance between this Point object and the destination Point object.

name: clone
description: Returns a new Circle object with the same values for the x, y, width, and height properties as this Circle object.

params.description: Optional Circle object. If given the values will be set into the object, otherwise a brand new Circle object will be created and returned.
params.name: output

returns.description: The cloned Circle object.

name: contains
description: Return true if the given x/y coordinates are within this Circle object.

params.description: The X value of the coordinate to test.
params.name: x

params.description: The Y value of the coordinate to test.
params.name: y

returns.description: True if the coordinates are within this circle, otherwise false.

name: circumferencePoint
description: Returns a Point object containing the coordinates of a point on the circumference of the Circle based on the given angle.

params.description: The angle in radians (unless asDegrees is true) to return the point from.
params.name: angle

params.description: Is the given angle in radians (false) or degrees (true)?
params.name: asDegrees

params.description: An optional Point object to put the result in to. If none specified a new Point object will be created.
params.name: out

returns.description: The Point object holding the result.

name: offset
description: Adjusts the location of the Circle object, as determined by its center coordinate, by the specified amounts.

params.description: Moves the x value of the Circle object by this amount.
params.name: dx

params.description: Moves the y value of the Circle object by this amount.
params.name: dy

returns.description: This Circle object.

description:
Sets this Polygon to the given points.

The points can be set from a variety of formats:

- An array of Point objects: `[new Phaser.Point(x1, y1), ...]`
- An array of objects with public x/y properties: `[obj1, obj2, ...]`
- An array of paired numbers that represent point coordinates: `[x1,y1, x2,y2, ...]`
- As separate Point arguments: `setTo(new Phaser.Point(x1, y1), ...)`
- As separate objects with public x/y properties arguments: `setTo(obj1, obj2, ...)`
- As separate arguments representing point coordinates: `setTo(x1,y1, x2,y2, ...)`

`setTo` may also be called without any arguments to remove all points.
