params.description: The object you want the camera to track. Set to null to not follow anything.
params.name: target

params.description: Leverage one of the existing "deadzone" presets. If you use a custom deadzone, ignore this parameter and manually specify the deadzone after calling follow().
params.name: style

name: unfollow
description: Sets the Camera follow target to null, stopping it from following an object if it's doing so.

name: focusOn
description: Move the camera focus on a display object instantly.

params.description: The display object to focus the camera on. Must have visible x/y properties.
params.name: displayObject

name: focusOnXY
description: Move the camera focus on a location instantly.

params.description: X position.
params.name: x

params.description: Y position.
params.name: y

name: update
description: Update focusing and scrolling.

name: setBoundsToWorld
description: Update the Camera bounds to match the game world.

name: checkBounds
description: Method called to ensure the camera doesn't venture outside of the game world.

name: setPosition
description:
A helper function to set both the X and Y properties of the camera at once
without having to use game.camera.x and game.camera.y.

params.description: X position.
params.name: x

params.description: Y position.
params.name: y

name: setSize
description: Sets the size of the view rectangle given the width and height in parameters.

params.description: The desired width.
params.name: width

params.description: The desired height.
params.name: height

name: reset
description: Resets the camera back to 0,0 and un-follows any object it may have been tracking.

name: texture
description:
Generates a new PIXI.Texture from the given data, which can be applied to a Sprite.

This allows you to create game graphics quickly and easily, with no external files but that use actual proper images
rather than Phaser.Graphics objects, which are expensive to render and limited in scope.

Each element of the array is a string holding the pixel color values, as mapped to one of the Phaser.Create PALETTE consts.

For example:

`var data = [
  ' 333 ',
  ' 777 ',
  'E333E',
  ' 333 ',
  ' 3 3 '
];`

`game.create.texture('bob', data);`

The above will create a new texture called `bob`, which will look like a little man wearing a hat. You can then use it
for sprites the same way you use any other texture: `game.add.sprite(0, 0, 'bob');`

params.description: The key used to store this texture in the Phaser Cache.
params.name: key

params.description: An array of pixel data.
params.name: data

params.description: The width of each pixel.
params.name: pixelWidth

params.description: The height of each pixel.
params.name: pixelHeight

params.description: The palette to use when rendering the texture. One of the Phaser.Create.PALETTE consts.
params.name: palette

returns.description: The newly generated texture.

name: grid
description: Creates a grid texture based on the given dimensions.

params.description: The key used to store this texture in the Phaser Cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The width of the grid in pixels.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the grid in pixels.
params.name: height

params.description: The width of the grid cells in pixels.
params.name: cellWidth

params.description: The height of the grid cells in pixels.
params.name: cellHeight

params.description: The color to draw the grid lines in. Should be a Canvas supported color string like `#ff5500` or `rgba(200,50,3,0.5)`.
params.name: color

returns.description: The newly generated texture.

name: init
description:
init is the very first function called when your State starts up. It's called before preload, create or anything else.
If you need to route the game away to another State you could do so here, or if you need to prepare a set of variables
or objects before the preloading starts.

name: preload
description:
preload is called first. Normally you'd use this to load your game assets (or those needed for the current State)
You shouldn't create any objects in this method that require assets that you're also loading in this method, as
they won't yet be available.

name: loadUpdate
description: loadUpdate is called during the Loader process. This only happens if you've set one or more assets to load in the preload method.

name: loadRender
description:
loadRender is called during the Loader process. This only happens if you've set one or more assets to load in the preload method.
The difference between loadRender and render is that any objects you render in this method you must be sure their assets exist.

name: create
description:
create is called once preload has completed, this includes the loading of any assets from the Loader.
If you don't have a preload method then create is the first method called in your State.

name: update
description:
The update method is left empty for your own use.
It is called during the core game loop AFTER debug, physics, plugins and the Stage have had their preUpdate methods called.
If is called BEFORE Stage, Tweens, Sounds, Input, Physics, Particles and Plugins have had their postUpdate methods called.

name: preRender
description: The preRender method is called after all Game Objects have been updated, but before any rendering takes place.

name: render
description:
Nearly all display objects in Phaser render automatically, you don't need to tell them to render.
However the render method is called AFTER the game renderer and plugins have rendered, so you're able to do any
final post-processing style effects here. Note that this happens before plugins postRender takes place.

name: resize
description: If your game is set to Scalemode RESIZE then each time the browser resizes it will call this function, passing in the new width and height.

name: paused
description: This method will be called if the core game loop is paused.

name: resumed
description: This method will be called when the core game loop resumes from a paused state.

name: pauseUpdate
description: pauseUpdate is called while the game is paused instead of preUpdate, update and postUpdate.

name: shutdown
description: This method will be called when the State is shutdown (i.e. you switch to another state from this one).

name: add
description:
Adds a new State into the StateManager. You must give each State a unique key by which you'll identify it.
The State can be either a Phaser.State object (or an object that extends it), a plain JavaScript object or a function.
If a function is given a new state object will be created by calling it.

params.description: A unique key you use to reference this state, i.e. "MainMenu", "Level1".
params.name: key

params.description: The state you want to switch to.
params.name: state

params.description: If true the State will be started immediately after adding it.
params.name: autoStart

name: remove
description: Delete the given state.

params.description: A unique key you use to reference this state, i.e. "MainMenu", "Level1".
params.name: key

name: start
description: Start the given State. If a State is already running then State.shutDown will be called (if it exists) before switching to the new State.

params.description: The key of the state you want to start.
params.name: key

params.description: Clear everything in the world? This clears the World display list fully (but not the Stage, so if you've added your own objects to the Stage they will need managing directly)
params.name: clearWorld

params.description: Clear the Game.Cache? This purges out all loaded assets. The default is false and you must have clearWorld=true if you want to clearCache as well.
params.name: clearCache

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the State.init function (if it has one).
params.name: parameter

name: restart
description: Restarts the current State. State.shutDown will be called (if it exists) before the State is restarted.

params.description: Clear everything in the world? This clears the World display list fully (but not the Stage, so if you've added your own objects to the Stage they will need managing directly)
params.name: clearWorld

params.description: Clear the Game.Cache? This purges out all loaded assets. The default is false and you must have clearWorld=true if you want to clearCache as well.
params.name: clearCache

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the State.init function if it has one.
params.name: parameter

name: preUpdate
description: preUpdate is called right at the start of the game loop. It is responsible for changing to a new state that was requested previously.

name: clearCurrentState
description:
This method clears the current State, calling its shutdown callback. The process also removes any active tweens,
resets the camera, resets input, clears physics, removes timers and if set clears the world and cache too.

name: checkState
description: Checks if a given phaser state is valid. A State is considered valid if it has at least one of the core functions: preload, create, update or render.

params.description: The key of the state you want to check.
params.name: key

returns.description: true if the State has the required functions, otherwise false.

name: link
description: Links game properties to the State given by the key.

params.description: State key.
params.name: key

name: unlink
description: Nulls all State level Phaser properties, including a reference to Game.

params.description: State key.
params.name: key

name: getCurrentState
description: Gets the current State.

returns.description: Phaser.State

params.description: The time elapsed since the last update.
params.name: elapsedTime

name: destroy
description:
Removes all StateManager callback references to the State object, nulls the game reference and clears the States object.
You don't recover from this without rebuilding the Phaser instance again.

name: has
description: Check if a specific listener is attached.

params.description: Signal handler function.
params.name: listener

params.description: Context on which listener will be executed (object that should represent the `this` variable inside listener function).
params.name: context

returns.description: If Signal has the specified listener.

name: add
description:
Add an event listener for this signal.

An event listener is a callback with a related context and priority.

You can optionally provide extra arguments which will be passed to the callback after any internal parameters.

For example: `Phaser.Key.onDown` when dispatched will send the Phaser.Key object that caused the signal as the first parameter.
Any arguments you've specified after `priority` will be sent as well:

`fireButton.onDown.add(shoot, this, 0, 'lazer', 100);`

When onDown dispatches it will call the `shoot` callback passing it: `Phaser.Key, 'lazer', 100`.

Where the first parameter is the one that Key.onDown dispatches internally and 'lazer',
and the value 100 were the custom arguments given in the call to 'add'.

params.description: The function to call when this Signal is dispatched.
params.name: listener

params.description: The context under which the listener will be executed (i.e. the object that should represent the `this` variable).
params.name: listenerContext

params.description: The priority level of the event listener. Listeners with higher priority will be executed before listeners with lower priority. Listeners with same priority level will be executed at the same order as they were added (default = 0)
params.name: priority

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback (listener) function. They will be appended after any arguments usually dispatched.
params.name: args

returns.description: An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.

name: addOnce
description:
Add a one-time listener - the listener is automatically removed after the first execution.

If there is as {@link Phaser.Signal#memorize memorized} event then it will be dispatched and
the listener will be removed immediately.

params.description: The function to call when this Signal is dispatched.
params.name: listener

params.description: The context under which the listener will be executed (i.e. the object that should represent the `this` variable).
params.name: listenerContext

params.description: The priority level of the event listener. Listeners with higher priority will be executed before listeners with lower priority. Listeners with same priority level will be executed at the same order as they were added (default = 0)
params.name: priority

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback (listener) function. They will be appended after any arguments usually dispatched.
params.name: args

returns.description: An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.

name: remove
description: Remove a single event listener.

params.description: Handler function that should be removed.
params.name: listener

params.description: Execution context (since you can add the same handler multiple times if executing in a different context).
params.name: context

returns.description: Listener handler function.

name: removeAll
description: Remove all event listeners.

params.description: If specified only listeners for the given context will be removed.
params.name: context

name: getNumListeners
description: Gets the total number of listeners attached to this Signal.

returns.description: Number of listeners attached to the Signal.

name: halt
description:
Stop propagation of the event, blocking the dispatch to next listener on the queue.

This should be called only during event dispatch as calling it before/after dispatch won't affect another broadcast.
See {@link #active} to enable/disable the signal entirely.

name: dispatch
description:
Dispatch / broadcast the event to all listeners.

To create an instance-bound dispatch for this Signal, use {@link #boundDispatch}.

params.description: Parameters that should be passed to each handler.
params.name: params

name: forget
description: Forget the currently {@link Phaser.Signal#memorize memorized} event, if any.

name: dispose
description:
Dispose the signal - no more events can be dispatched.

This removes all event listeners and clears references to external objects.
Calling methods on a disposed objects results in undefined behavior.

name: toString
description: A string representation of the object.

returns.description: String representation of the object.

name: execute
description:
Call listener passing arbitrary parameters.
If binding was added using `Signal.addOnce()` it will be automatically removed from signal dispatch queue, this method is used internally for the signal dispatch.

params.description: Array of parameters that should be passed to the listener.
params.name: paramsArr

returns.description: Value returned by the listener.

name: detach
description:
Detach binding from signal.
alias to: @see mySignal.remove(myBinding.getListener());

returns.description: Handler function bound to the signal or `null` if binding was previously detached.
True if binding is still bound to the signal and has a listener.
If SignalBinding will only be executed once.
Handler function bound to the signal.
Signal that listener is currently bound to.
String representation of the object.

name: init
description: Should be over-ridden.

name: setResolution
description: Set the resolution uniforms on the filter.

params.description: The width of the display.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the display.
params.name: height

name: update
description: Updates the filter.

params.description: A Pointer object to use for the filter. The coordinates are mapped to the mouse uniform.
params.name: pointer

name: destroy
description: Clear down this Filter and null out references

name: preUpdate
description:
Pre-update is called at the very start of the update cycle, before any other subsystems have been updated (including Physics).
It is only called if active is set to true.

name: update
description:
Update is called after all the core subsystems (Input, Tweens, Sound, etc) and the State have updated, but before the render.
It is only called if active is set to true.

name: render
description:
Render is called right after the Game Renderer completes, but before the State.render.
It is only called if visible is set to true.

name: postRender
description:
Post-render is called after the Game Renderer and State.render have run.
It is only called if visible is set to true.

name: destroy
description: Clear down this Plugin and null out references

name: add
description:
Add a new Plugin into the PluginManager.
The Plugin must have 2 properties: game and parent. Plugin.game is set to the game reference the PluginManager uses, and parent is set to the PluginManager.

params.description: The Plugin to add into the PluginManager. This can be a function or an existing object.
params.name: plugin

params.description: Additional arguments that will be passed to the Plugin.init method.
params.name: parameter

returns.description: The Plugin that was added to the manager.

name: remove
description: Remove a Plugin from the PluginManager. It calls Plugin.destroy on the plugin before removing it from the manager.

params.description: The plugin to be removed.
params.name: plugin

name: removeAll
description: Remove all Plugins from the PluginManager. It calls Plugin.destroy on every plugin before removing it from the manager.

name: preUpdate
description:
Pre-update is called at the very start of the update cycle, before any other subsystems have been updated (including Physics).
It only calls plugins who have active=true.

name: update
description:
Update is called after all the core subsystems (Input, Tweens, Sound, etc) and the State have updated, but before the render.
It only calls plugins who have active=true.

name: postUpdate
description:
PostUpdate is the last thing to be called before the world render.
In particular, it is called after the world postUpdate, which means the camera has been adjusted.
It only calls plugins who have active=true.

name: render
description:
Render is called right after the Game Renderer completes, but before the State.render.
It only calls plugins who have visible=true.

name: postRender
description:
Post-render is called after the Game Renderer and State.render have run.
It only calls plugins who have visible=true.

name: destroy
description: Clear down this PluginManager, calls destroy on every plugin and nulls out references.

name: parseConfig
description: Parses a Game configuration object.

params.description: The configuration object to parse.
params.name: config

name: preUpdate
description:
This is called automatically after the plugins preUpdate and before the State.update.
Most objects have preUpdate methods and it's where initial movement and positioning is done.

name: update
description: This is called automatically after the State.update, but before particles or plugins update.

name: postUpdate
description:
This is called automatically before the renderer runs and after the plugins have updated.
In postUpdate this is where all the final physics calculatations and object positioning happens.
The objects are processed in the order of the display list.
The only exception to this is if the camera is following an object, in which case that is updated first.

name: updateTransform
description:
Updates the transforms for all objects on the display list.
This overrides the Pixi default as we don't need the interactionManager, but do need the game property check.

name: checkVisibility
description:
Starts a page visibility event listener running, or window.onpagehide/onpageshow if not supported by the browser.
Also listens for window.onblur and window.onfocus.

name: visibilityChange
description: This method is called when the document visibility is changed.

params.description: Its type will be used to decide whether the game should be paused or not.
params.name: event

name: setBackgroundColor
description:
Sets the background color for the Stage.

The color can be given as a hex string (`'#RRGGBB'`), a CSS color string (`'rgb(r,g,b)'`), or a numeric value (`0xRRGGBB`).

An alpha channel is _not_ supported and will be ignored.

params.description: The color of the background.
params.name: backgroundColor

name: destroy
description: Destroys the Stage and removes event listeners.

name: add
description:
Adds an existing object as the top child in this group.

The child is automatically added to the top of the group and is displayed on top of every previous child.

If Group.enableBody is set then a physics body will be created on the object, so long as one does not already exist.

Use {@link #addAt} to control where a child is added. Use {@link #create} to create and add a new child.

params.description: The display object to add as a child.
params.name: child

params.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

name: addToHash
description:
Adds a child of this Group into the hash array.
This call will return false if the child is not a child of this Group, or is already in the hash.

params.description: The display object to add to this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group already and not present in the hash.
params.name: child

returns.description: True if the child was successfully added to the hash, otherwise false.

name: removeFromHash
description:
Removes a child of this Group from the hash array.
This call will return false if the child is not in the hash.

params.description: The display object to remove from this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group and in the hash.
params.name: child

returns.description: True if the child was successfully removed from the hash, otherwise false.

name: addMultiple
description:
Adds an array of existing Display Objects to this Group.

The Display Objects are automatically added to the top of this Group, and will render on-top of everything already in this Group.

As well as an array you can also pass another Group as the first argument. In this case all of the children from that
Group will be removed from it and added into this Group.

params.description: An array of display objects or a Phaser.Group. If a Group is given then *all* children will be moved from it.
params.name: children

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The array of children or Group of children that were added to this Group.

name: addAt
description:
Adds an existing object to this group.

The child is added to the group at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.

params.description: The display object to add as a child.
params.name: child

params.description: The index within the group to insert the child to.
params.name: index

params.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

name: getAt
description: Returns the child found at the given index within this group.

params.description: The index to return the child from.
params.name: index

returns.description: The child that was found at the given index, or -1 for an invalid index.

name: create
description:
Creates a new Phaser.Sprite object and adds it to the top of this group.

Use {@link #classType} to change the type of object creaded.

params.description: The x coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the group.x point.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the group.y point.
params.name: y

params.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.
params.name: key

params.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.
params.name: frame

params.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.
params.name: exists

returns.description: The child that was created: will be a {@link Phaser.Sprite} unless {@link #classType} has been changed.

name: createMultiple
description:
Creates multiple Phaser.Sprite objects and adds them to the top of this group.

Useful if you need to quickly generate a pool of identical sprites, such as bullets.

By default the sprites will be set to not exist and will be positioned at 0, 0 (relative to the group.x/y).
Use {@link #classType} to change the type of object created.

params.description: The number of Sprites to create.
params.name: quantity

params.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.
params.name: key

params.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.
params.name: frame

params.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.
params.name: exists

name: updateZ
description:
Internal method that re-applies all of the children's Z values.

This must be called whenever children ordering is altered so that their `z` indices are correctly updated.

name: resetCursor
description:
Sets the group cursor to the first child in the group.

If the optional index parameter is given it sets the cursor to the object at that index instead.

params.description: Set the cursor to point to a specific index.
params.name: index

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: next
description:
Advances the group cursor to the next (higher) object in the group.

If the cursor is at the end of the group (top child) it is moved the start of the group (bottom child).

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: previous
description:
Moves the group cursor to the previous (lower) child in the group.

If the cursor is at the start of the group (bottom child) it is moved to the end (top child).

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: swap
description:
Swaps the position of two children in this group.

Both children must be in this group, a child cannot be swapped with itself, and unparented children cannot be swapped.

params.description: The first child to swap.
params.name: child1

params.description: The second child to swap.
params.name: child2

name: bringToTop
description: Brings the given child to the top of this group so it renders above all other children.

params.description: The child to bring to the top of this group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: sendToBack
description: Sends the given child to the bottom of this group so it renders below all other children.

params.description: The child to send to the bottom of this group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: moveUp
description: Moves the given child up one place in this group unless it's already at the top.

params.description: The child to move up in the group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: moveDown
description: Moves the given child down one place in this group unless it's already at the bottom.

params.description: The child to move down in the group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: xy
description: Positions the child found at the given index within this group to the given x and y coordinates.

params.description: The index of the child in the group to set the position of.
params.name: index

params.description: The new x position of the child.
params.name: x

params.description: The new y position of the child.
params.name: y

name: reverse
description:
Reverses all children in this group.

This operaation applies only to immediate children and does not propagate to subgroups.

name: getIndex
description: Get the index position of the given child in this group, which should match the child's `z` property.

params.description: The child to get the index for.
params.name: child

returns.description: The index of the child or -1 if it's not a member of this group.

name: replace
description: Replaces a child of this group with the given newChild. The newChild cannot be a member of this group.

params.description: The child in this group that will be replaced.
params.name: oldChild

params.description: The child to be inserted into this group.
params.name: newChild

returns.description: Returns the oldChild that was replaced within this group.

name: hasProperty
description:
Checks if the child has the given property.

Will scan up to 4 levels deep only.

params.description: The child to check for the existance of the property on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the child has the property, otherwise false.

name: setProperty
description:
Sets a property to the given value on the child. The operation parameter controls how the value is set.

The operations are:
- 0: set the existing value to the given value; if force is `true` a new property will be created if needed
- 1: will add the given value to the value already present.
- 2: will subtract the given value from the value already present.
- 3: will multiply the value already present by the given value.
- 4: will divide the value already present by the given value.

params.description: The child to set the property value on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was set, false if not.

name: checkProperty
description: Checks a property for the given value on the child.

params.description: The child to check the property value on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be checked.
params.name: value

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was was equal to value, false if not.

name: set
description:
Quickly set a property on a single child of this group to a new value.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The child to set the property on.
params.name: child

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then the child will only be updated if alive=true.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then the child will only be updated if visible=true.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was set, false if not.

name: setAll
description:
Quickly set the same property across all children of this group to a new value.

This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be set on the group but not its children.
If you need that ability please see `Group.setAllChildren`.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

name: setAllChildren
description:
Quickly set the same property across all children of this group, and any child Groups, to a new value.

If this group contains other Groups then the same property is set across their children as well, iterating down until it reaches the bottom.
Unlike with `setAll` the property is NOT set on child Groups itself.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

name: checkAll
description:
Quickly check that the same property across all children of this group is equal to the given value.

This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be checked on the group but not its children.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be checked.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.
params.name: force

name: addAll
description:
Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this group.

`Group.addAll('x', 10)` will add 10 to the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: subAll
description:
Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this group.

`Group.subAll('x', 10)` will minus 10 from the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to decrement, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to subtract from the property. If child.x = 50 then subAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 10.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: multiplyAll
description:
Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this group.

`Group.multiplyAll('x', 2)` will x2 the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to multiply, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: divideAll
description:
Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this group.

`Group.divideAll('x', 2)` will half the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: callAllExists
description:
Calls a function, specified by name, on all children in the group who exist (or do not exist).

After the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

params.description: Name of the function on the children to call.
params.name: callback

params.description: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.
params.name: existsValue

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.
params.name: parameter

name: callbackFromArray
description: Returns a reference to a function that exists on a child of the group based on the given callback array.

params.description: The object to inspect.
params.name: child

params.description: The array of function names.
params.name: callback

params.description: The size of the array (pre-calculated in callAll).
params.name: length

name: callAll
description:
Calls a function, specified by name, on all on children.

The function is called for all children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists for different options).
After the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

params.description: Name of the function on the child to call. Deep property lookup is supported.
params.name: method

params.description: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.
params.name: context

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.
params.name: args

name: preUpdate
description: The core preUpdate - as called by World.

name: update
description: The core update - as called by World.

name: postUpdate
description: The core postUpdate - as called by World.

name: filter

params.description: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third
params.name: predicate

params.description: If true, only existing can be selected; otherwise all children can be selected and will be passed to the predicate.
params.name: checkExists

returns.description: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

name: forEach
description:
Call a function on each child in this group.

Additional arguments for the callback can be specified after the `checkExists` parameter. For example,

    Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)

would invoke `awardBonusGold` function with the parameters `(child, 100, 500)`.

Note: This check will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: If set only children matching for which `exists` is true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.
params.name: checkExists

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachExists
description:
Call a function on each existing child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachAlive
description:
Call a function on each alive child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachDead
description:
Call a function on each dead child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: sort
description:
Sort the children in the group according to a particular key and ordering.

Call this function to sort the group according to a particular key value and order.
For example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

params.description: The name of the property to sort on. Defaults to the objects z-depth value.
params.name: key

params.description: Order ascending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING SORT_ASCENDING}) or descending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING SORT_DESCENDING}).
params.name: order

name: customSort
description:
Sort the children in the group according to custom sort function.

The `sortHandler` is provided the two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b).
It should return -1 if `a > b`, 1 if `a < b` or 0 if `a === b`.

params.description: The custom sort function.
params.name: sortHandler

params.description: The context in which the sortHandler is called.
params.name: context

name: ascendingSortHandler
description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

params.description: The first object being sorted.
params.name: a

params.description: The second object being sorted.
params.name: b

name: descendingSortHandler
description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

params.description: The first object being sorted.
params.name: a

params.description: The second object being sorted.
params.name: b

name: iterate
description:
Iterates over the children of the group performing one of several actions for matched children.

A child is considered a match when it has a property, named `key`, whose value is equal to `value`
according to a strict equality comparison.

The result depends on the `returnType`:

- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL RETURN_TOTAL}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. The number of matched children is returned.
- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE RETURN_NONE}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. No value is returned.
- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD RETURN_CHILD}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to the *first* matching child and the *first* matched child is returned.
    If there is no matching child then null is returned.

If `args` is specified it must be an array. The matched child will be assigned to the first
element and the entire array will be applied to the callback function.

params.description: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'
params.name: key

params.description: A child matches if `child[key] === value` is true.
params.name: value

params.description: How to iterate the children and what to return.
params.name: returnType

params.description: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. The matched child is supplied as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: The arguments supplied to to the callback; the first array index (argument) will be replaced with the matched child.
params.name: args

returns.description: Returns either an integer (for RETURN_TOTAL), the first matched child (for RETURN_CHILD), or null.

name: getFirstExists
description: Get the first display object that exists, or doesn't exist.

params.description: If true, find the first existing child; otherwise find the first non-existing child.
params.name: exists

returns.description: The first child, or null if none found.

name: getFirstAlive
description:
Get the first child that is alive (`child.alive === true`).

This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first alive child, or null if none found.

name: getFirstDead
description:
Get the first child that is dead (`child.alive === false`).

This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first dead child, or null if none found.

name: getTop
description:
Return the child at the top of this group.

The top child is the child displayed (rendered) above every other child.

returns.description: The child at the top of the Group.

name: getBottom
description:
Returns the child at the bottom of this group.

The bottom child the child being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

returns.description: The child at the bottom of the Group.

name: countLiving
description: Get the number of living children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as alive.

name: countDead
description: Get the number of dead children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as dead.

name: getRandom
description: Returns a random child from the group.

params.description: Offset from the front of the front of the group (lowest child).
params.name: startIndex

params.description: Restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.
params.name: length

returns.description: A random child of this Group.

name: remove
description:
Removes the given child from this group.

This will dispatch an `onRemovedFromGroup` event from the child (if it has one), and optionally destroy the child.

If the group cursor was referring to the removed child it is updated to refer to the next child.

params.description: The child to remove.
params.name: child

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on the removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the the child will not dispatch the `onRemovedFromGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: true if the child was removed from this group, otherwise false.

name: moveAll
description: Moves all children from this Group to the Group given.

params.description: The new Group to which the children will be moved to.
params.name: group

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event for the new Group.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The Group to which all the children were moved.

name: removeAll
description: Removes all children from this group, but does not remove the group from its parent.

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.
params.name: silent

name: removeBetween
description: Removes all children from this group whose index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

params.description: The index to start removing children from.
params.name: startIndex

params.description: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the group.
params.name: endIndex

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.
params.name: silent

name: destroy
description:
Destroys this group.

Removes all children, then removes this group from its parent and nulls references.

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroyChildren

params.description: A 'soft destroy' (set to true) doesn't remove this group from its parent or null the game reference. Set to false and it does.
params.name: soft

name: boot
description: Initialises the game world.

name: stateChange
description:
Called whenever the State changes or resets.

It resets the world.x and world.y coordinates back to zero,
then resets the Camera.

name: setBounds
description:
Updates the size of this world and sets World.x/y to the given values
The Camera bounds and Physics bounds (if set) are also updated to match the new World bounds.

params.description: Top left most corner of the world.
params.name: x

params.description: Top left most corner of the world.
params.name: y

params.description: New width of the game world in pixels.
params.name: width

params.description: New height of the game world in pixels.
params.name: height

name: resize
description: Updates the size of this world. Note that this doesn't modify the world x/y coordinates, just the width and height.

params.description: New width of the game world in pixels.
params.name: width

params.description: New height of the game world in pixels.
params.name: height

name: shutdown
description: Destroyer of worlds.

name: wrap
description:
This will take the given game object and check if its x/y coordinates fall outside of the world bounds.
If they do it will reposition the object to the opposite side of the world, creating a wrap-around effect.
If sprite has a P2 body then the body (sprite.body) should be passed as first parameter to the function.

params.description: The object you wish to wrap around the world bounds.
params.name: sprite

params.description: Extra padding added equally to the sprite.x and y coordinates before checking if within the world bounds. Ignored if useBounds is true.
params.name: padding

params.description: If useBounds is false wrap checks the object.x/y coordinates. If true it does a more accurate bounds check, which is more expensive.
params.name: useBounds

params.description: If horizontal is false, wrap will not wrap the object.x coordinates horizontally.
params.name: horizontal

params.description: If vertical is false, wrap will not wrap the object.y coordinates vertically.
params.name: vertical

name: setSize
description: Sets the core game size. This resets the w/h parameters and bounds.

params.description: The new dimensions.
params.name: width

params.description: The new dimensions.
params.name: height

name: createCustomLayer
description: A custom layer is centered on the game and maintains its aspect ratio as it scales up and down.

params.description: Width of this layer in pixels.
params.name: width

params.description: Height of this layer in pixels.
params.name: height

params.description: An array of children that are used to populate the FlexLayer.
params.name: children

returns.description: The Layer object.

name: createFluidLayer
description: A fluid layer is centered on the game and maintains its aspect ratio as it scales up and down.

params.description: An array of children that are used to populate the FlexLayer.
params.name: children

returns.description: The Layer object.

name: createFullLayer
description: A full layer is placed at 0,0 and extends to the full size of the game. Children are scaled according to the fluid ratios.

params.description: An array of children that are used to populate the FlexLayer.
params.name: children

returns.description: The Layer object.

name: createFixedLayer
description: A fixed layer is centered on the game and is the size of the required dimensions and is never scaled.

params.description: An array of children that are used to populate the FlexLayer.
params.name: children

returns.description: The Layer object.

name: reset
description: Resets the layer children references

name: onResize
description: Called when the game container changes dimensions.

params.description: The new width of the game container.
params.name: width

params.description: The new height of the game container.
params.name: height

name: refresh
description: Updates all internal vars such as the bounds and scale values.

name: fitSprite
description: Fits a sprites width to the bounds.

params.description: The Sprite to fit.
params.name: sprite

name: debug
description: Call in the render function to output the bounds rects.

name: resize
description: Resize.

name: debug
description: Debug.

name: boot
description: Start the ScaleManager.

name: parseConfig
description: Load configuration settings.

params.description: The game configuration object.
params.name: config

name: setupScale
description:
Calculates and sets the game dimensions based on the given width and height.

This should _not_ be called when in fullscreen mode.

params.description: The width of the game.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the game.
params.name: height

name: setGameSize
description:
Set the actual Game size.
Use this instead of directly changing `game.width` or `game.height`.

The actual physical display (Canvas element size) depends on various settings including
- Scale mode
- Scaling factor
- Size of Canvas's parent element or CSS rules such as min-height/max-height;
- The size of the Window

params.description: _Game width_, in pixels.
params.name: width

params.description: _Game height_, in pixels.
params.name: height

name: setUserScale
description:
Set a User scaling factor used in the USER_SCALE scaling mode.

The target canvas size is computed by:

    canvas.width = (game.width * hScale) - hTrim
    canvas.height = (game.height * vScale) - vTrim

This method can be used in the {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#setResizeCallback resize callback}.

params.description: Horizontal scaling factor.
params.name: hScale

params.description: Vertical scaling factor.
params.name: vScale

params.description: Horizontal trim, applied after scaling.
params.name: hTrim

params.description: Vertical trim, applied after scaling.
params.name: vTrim

name: setResizeCallback
description:
Sets the callback that will be invoked before sizing calculations.

This is the appropriate place to call {@link #setUserScale} if needing custom dynamic scaling.

The callback is supplied with two arguments `scale` and `parentBounds` where `scale` is the ScaleManager
and `parentBounds`, a Phaser.Rectangle, is the size of the Parent element.

This callback
- May be invoked even though the parent container or canvas sizes have not changed
- Unlike {@link #onSizeChange}, it runs _before_ the canvas is guaranteed to be updated
- Will be invoked from `preUpdate`, _even when_ the game is paused

See {@link #onSizeChange} for a better way of reacting to layout updates.

params.description: The callback that will be called each time a window.resize event happens or if set, the parent container resizes.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the callback will be called.
params.name: context

name: setMinMax
description:
Set the min and max dimensions for the Display canvas.

_Note:_ The min/max dimensions are only applied in some cases
- When the device is not in an incorrect orientation; or
- The scale mode is EXACT_FIT when not in fullscreen

params.description: The minimum width the game is allowed to scale down to.
params.name: minWidth

params.description: The minimum height the game is allowed to scale down to.
params.name: minHeight

params.description: The maximum width the game is allowed to scale up to; only changed if specified.
params.name: maxWidth

params.description: The maximum height the game is allowed to scale up to; only changed if specified.
params.name: maxHeight

todoList.task: These values are only sometimes honored.

name: preUpdate
description: The ScaleManager.preUpdate is called automatically by the core Game loop.

name: forceOrientation
description:
Force the game to run in only one orientation.

This enables generation of incorrect orientation signals and affects resizing but does not otherwise rotate or lock the orientation.

Orientation checks are performed via the Screen Orientation API, if available in browser. This means it will check your monitor
orientation on desktop, or your device orientation on mobile, rather than comparing actual game dimensions. If you need to check the
viewport dimensions instead and bypass the Screen Orientation API then set: `ScaleManager.compatibility.orientationFallback = 'viewport'`

params.description: true if the game should run in landscape mode only.
params.name: forceLandscape

params.description: true if the game should run in portrait mode only.
params.name: forcePortrait

name: refresh
description:
The "refresh" methods informs the ScaleManager that a layout refresh is required.

The ScaleManager automatically queues a layout refresh (eg. updates the Game size or Display canvas layout)
when the browser is resized, the orientation changes, or when there is a detected change
of the Parent size. Refreshing is also done automatically when public properties,
such as {@link #scaleMode}, are updated or state-changing methods are invoked.

The "refresh" method _may_ need to be used in a few (rare) situtations when

- a device change event is not correctly detected; or
- the Parent size changes (and an immediate reflow is desired); or
- the ScaleManager state is updated by non-standard means; or
- certain {@link #compatibility} properties are manually changed.

The queued layout refresh is not immediate but will run promptly in an upcoming `preRender`.

name: getParentBounds
description:
Returns the computed Parent size/bounds that the Display canvas is allowed/expected to fill.

If in fullscreen mode or without parent (see {@link #parentIsWindow}),
this will be the bounds of the visual viewport itself.

This function takes the {@link #windowConstraints} into consideration - if the parent is partially outside
the viewport then this function may return a smaller than expected size.

Values are rounded to the nearest pixel.

params.description: The rectangle to update; a new one is created as needed.
params.name: target

returns.description: The established parent bounds.

name: createFullScreenTarget
description:
Creates a fullscreen target. This is called automatically as as needed when entering
fullscreen mode and the resulting element is supplied to {@link #onFullScreenInit}.

Use {@link #onFullScreenInit} to customize the created object.

name: startFullScreen
description:
Start the browsers fullscreen mode - this _must_ be called from a user input Pointer or Mouse event.

The Fullscreen API must be supported by the browser for this to work - it is not the same as setting
the game size to fill the browser window. See {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#compatibility compatibility.supportsFullScreen} to check if the current
device is reported to support fullscreen mode.

The {@link #fullScreenFailed} signal will be dispatched if the fullscreen change request failed or the game does not support the Fullscreen API.

params.description: Changes the anti-alias feature of the canvas before jumping in to fullscreen (false = retain pixel art, true = smooth art). If not specified then no change is made. Only works in CANVAS mode.
params.name: antialias

params.description: Internal argument. If `false` click trampolining is suppressed.
params.name: allowTrampoline

returns.description: Returns true if the device supports fullscreen mode and fullscreen mode was attempted to be started. (It might not actually start, wait for the signals.)

name: stopFullScreen
description: Stops / exits fullscreen mode, if active.

returns.description: Returns true if the browser supports fullscreen mode and fullscreen mode will be exited.

name: scaleSprite
description:
Takes a Sprite or Image object and scales it to fit the given dimensions.
Scaling happens proportionally without distortion to the sprites texture.
The letterBox parameter controls if scaling will produce a letter-box effect or zoom the
sprite until it fills the given values. Note that with letterBox set to false the scaled sprite may spill out over either
the horizontal or vertical sides of the target dimensions. If you wish to stop this you can crop the Sprite.

params.description: The sprite we want to scale.
params.name: sprite

params.description: The target width that we want to fit the sprite in to. If not given it defaults to ScaleManager.width.
params.name: width

params.description: The target height that we want to fit the sprite in to. If not given it defaults to ScaleManager.height.
params.name: height

params.description: True if we want the `fitted` mode. Otherwise, the function uses the `zoom` mode.
params.name: letterBox

returns.description: The scaled sprite.

name: destroy
description:
Destroys the ScaleManager and removes any event listeners.
This should probably only be called when the game is destroyed.

name: parseConfig
description: Parses a Game configuration object.

name: boot
description: Initialize engine sub modules and start the game.

name: showDebugHeader
description: Displays a Phaser version debug header in the console.

name: setUpRenderer
description: Checks if the device is capable of using the requested renderer and sets it up or an alternative if not.

name: update
description: The core game loop.

params.description: The current time as provided by RequestAnimationFrame.
params.name: time

name: updateLogic
description: Updates all logic subsystems in Phaser. Called automatically by Game.update.

params.description: The current timeStep value as determined by Game.update.
params.name: timeStep

name: updateRender
description:
Runs the Render cycle.
It starts by calling State.preRender. In here you can do any last minute adjustments of display objects as required.
It then calls the renderer, which renders the entire display list, starting from the Stage object and working down.
It then calls plugin.render on any loaded plugins, in the order in which they were enabled.
After this State.render is called. Any rendering that happens here will take place on-top of the display list.
Finally plugin.postRender is called on any loaded plugins, in the order in which they were enabled.
This method is called automatically by Game.update, you don't need to call it directly.
Should you wish to have fine-grained control over when Phaser renders then use the `Game.lockRender` boolean.
Phaser will only render when this boolean is `false`.

params.description: The time elapsed since the last update.
params.name: elapsedTime

name: enableStep
description:
Enable core game loop stepping. When enabled you must call game.step() directly (perhaps via a DOM button?)
Calling step will advance the game loop by one frame. This is extremely useful for hard to track down errors!

name: disableStep
description: Disables core game loop stepping.

name: step
description:
When stepping is enabled you must call this function directly (perhaps via a DOM button?) to advance the game loop by one frame.
This is extremely useful to hard to track down errors! Use the internal stepCount property to monitor progress.

name: destroy
description: Nukes the entire game from orbit.

description: Starts the Input Manager running.

name: destroy

name: addMoveCallback
description:
Adds a callback that is fired every time the activePointer receives a DOM move event such as a mousemove or touchmove.

The callback will be sent 4 parameters: The Pointer that moved, the x position of the pointer, the y position and the down state.

It will be called every time the activePointer moves, which in a multi-touch game can be a lot of times, so this is best
to only use if you've limited input to a single pointer (i.e. mouse or touch).

The callback is added to the Phaser.Input.moveCallbacks array and should be removed with Phaser.Input.deleteMoveCallback.

params.description: The callback that will be called each time the activePointer receives a DOM move event.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the callback will be called.
params.name: context

name: deleteMoveCallback
description: Removes the callback from the Phaser.Input.moveCallbacks array.

params.description: The callback to be removed.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the callback exists.
params.name: context

name: addPointer
description:
Add a new Pointer object to the Input Manager.
By default Input creates 3 pointer objects: `mousePointer` (not include in part of general pointer pool), `pointer1` and `pointer2`.
This method adds an additional pointer, up to a maximum of Phaser.Input.MAX_POINTERS (default of 10).

returns.description: The new Pointer object that was created; null if a new pointer could not be added.

name: update
description: Updates the Input Manager. Called by the core Game loop.

name: reset
description:
Reset all of the Pointers and Input states.

The optional `hard` parameter will reset any events or callbacks that may be bound.
Input.reset is called automatically during a State change or if a game loses focus / visibility.
To control control the reset manually set {@link Phaser.InputManager.resetLocked} to `true`.

params.description: A soft reset won't reset any events or callbacks that are bound. A hard reset will.
params.name: hard

name: getPointerFromIdentifier
description:
Get the Pointer object whos `identifier` property matches the given identifier value.

The identifier property is not set until the Pointer has been used at least once, as its populated by the DOM event.
Also it can change every time you press the pointer down, and is not fixed once set.
Note: Not all browsers set the identifier property and it's not part of the W3C spec, so you may need getPointerFromId instead.

params.description: The Pointer.identifier value to search for.
params.name: identifier

returns.description: A Pointer object or null if no Pointer object matches the requested identifier.

name: getPointerFromId
description:
Get the Pointer object whos `pointerId` property matches the given value.

The pointerId property is not set until the Pointer has been used at least once, as its populated by the DOM event.
Also it can change every time you press the pointer down if the browser recycles it.

params.description: The `pointerId` (not 'id') value to search for.
params.name: pointerId

returns.description: A Pointer object or null if no Pointer object matches the requested identifier.

name: requestPointerLock

If the browser supports it you can request that the pointer be locked to the browser window.
This is classically known as 'FPS controls', where the pointer can't leave the browser until the user presses an exit key.
If the browser successfully enters a locked state the event Phaser.Mouse.pointerLock will be dispatched and the first parameter will be 'true'.

name: justPressed
description:
The Pointer is considered justPressed if the time it was pressed onto the touchscreen or clicked is less than justPressedRate.
Note that calling justPressed doesn't reset the pressed status of the Pointer, it will return `true` for as long as the duration is valid.
If you wish to check if the Pointer was pressed down just once then see the Sprite.events.onInputDown event.

params.description: The time to check against. If none given it will use InputManager.justPressedRate.
params.name: duration

returns.description: true if the Pointer was pressed down within the duration given.

name: justReleased
description:
The Pointer is considered justReleased if the time it left the touchscreen is less than justReleasedRate.
Note that calling justReleased doesn't reset the pressed status of the Pointer, it will return `true` for as long as the duration is valid.
If you wish to check if the Pointer was released just once then see the Sprite.events.onInputUp event.

params.description: The time to check against. If none given it will use InputManager.justReleasedRate.
params.name: duration

returns.description: true if the Pointer was released within the duration given.

name: addClickTrampoline
description:
Add a click trampoline to this pointer.

A click trampoline is a callback that is run on the DOM 'click' event; this is primarily
needed with certain browsers (ie. IE11) which restrict some actions like requestFullscreen
to the DOM 'click' event and rejects it for 'pointer*' and 'mouse*' events.

This is used internally by the ScaleManager; click trampoline usage is uncommon.
Click trampolines can only be added to pointers that are currently down.

params.description: The name of the trampoline; must be unique among active trampolines in this pointer.
params.name: name

params.description: Callback to run/trampoline.
params.name: callback

params.description: Context of the callback.
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional callback args, if any. Supplied as an array.
params.name: callbackArgs

This is used internally to handle audio and video unlocking on mobile devices.

If the callback returns 'true' then the callback is automatically deleted once invoked.

The callback is added to the Phaser.Touch.touchLockCallbacks array and should be removed with Phaser.Touch.removeTouchLockCallback.

Checks if the given pointer is both down and over the Sprite this InputHandler belongs to.
Use the `fastTest` flag is to quickly check just the bounding hit area even if `InputHandler.pixelPerfectOver` is `true`.

Runs a pixel perfect check against the given x/y coordinates of the Sprite this InputHandler is bound to.

name: enableDrag
description:
Allow this Sprite to be dragged by any valid pointer.

When the drag begins the Sprite.events.onDragStart event will be dispatched.

When the drag completes by way of the user letting go of the pointer that was dragging the sprite, the Sprite.events.onDragStop event is dispatched.

For the duration of the drag the Sprite.events.onDragUpdate event is dispatched. This event is only dispatched when the pointer actually
changes position and moves. The event sends 5 parameters: `sprite`, `pointer`, `dragX`, `dragY` and `snapPoint`.

params.description: If false the Sprite will drag from where you click it minus the dragOffset. If true it will center itself to the tip of the mouse pointer.
params.name: lockCenter

params.description: If true the Sprite will be bought to the top of the rendering list in its current Group.
params.name: bringToTop

params.description: If true it will use a pixel perfect test to see if you clicked the Sprite. False uses the bounding box.
params.name: pixelPerfect

params.description: If using pixel perfect collision this specifies the alpha level from 0 to 255 above which a collision is processed.
params.name: alphaThreshold

params.description: If you want to restrict the drag of this sprite to a specific Rectangle, pass the Phaser.Rectangle here, otherwise it's free to drag anywhere.
params.name: boundsRect

params.description: If you want to restrict the drag of this sprite to within the bounding box of another sprite, pass it here.
params.name: boundsSprite

name: disableDrag
description: Stops this sprite from being able to be dragged. If it is currently the target of an active drag it will be stopped immediately. Also disables any set callbacks.

name: startDrag
description: Called by Pointer when drag starts on this Sprite. Should not usually be called directly.

name: globalToLocalX
description: Warning: EXPERIMENTAL

name: globalToLocalY

name: setDragLock
description: Restricts this sprite to drag movement only on the given axis. Note: If both are set to false the sprite will never move!

params.description: To enable the sprite to be dragged horizontally set to true, otherwise false.
params.name: allowHorizontal

params.description: To enable the sprite to be dragged vertically set to true, otherwise false.
params.name: allowVertical

name: enableSnap
description:
Make this Sprite snap to the given grid either during drag or when it's released.
For example 16x16 as the snapX and snapY would make the sprite snap to every 16 pixels.

params.description: The width of the grid cell to snap to.
params.name: snapX

params.description: The height of the grid cell to snap to.
params.name: snapY

params.description: If true the sprite will snap to the grid while being dragged.
params.name: onDrag

params.description: If true the sprite will snap to the grid when released.
params.name: onRelease

params.description: Used to offset the top-left starting point of the snap grid.
params.name: snapOffsetX

params.description: Used to offset the top-left starting point of the snap grid.
params.name: snapOffsetY
