params.description: The amplitude to apply to the sine table (default 1.0) if you need values between say -+ 125 then give 125 as the value

returns.description: Returns the table data.

name: distance

name: clamp

name: clampBottom

Clamp `x` to the range `[a, Infinity)`.

Returns a random integer between and including min and max.

name: reset
description: Resets the QuadTree.

name: populate
description: Populates this quadtree with the children of the given Group. In order to be added the child must exist and have a body property.

name: populateHandler
description: Handler for the populate method.

params.description: The Sprite to check.
params.name: sprite

name: split
description: Split the node into 4 subnodes

name: insert
description: Insert the object into the node. If the node exceeds the capacity, it will split and add all objects to their corresponding subnodes.

name: getIndex
description: Determine which node the object belongs to.

params.description: The bounds in which to check.

returns.description: index - Index of the subnode (0-3), or -1 if rect cannot completely fit within a subnode and is part of the parent node.

name: retrieve

returns.description: - Array with all detected objects.

description: Clear the quadtree.

name: getHostName
description: Returns the hostname given by the browser.

name: checkDomainName
description:
Compares the given domain name against the hostname of the browser containing the game.
If the domain name is found it returns true.
You can specify a part of a domain, for example 'google' would match 'google.com', 'google.co.uk', etc.
Do not include 'http://' at the start.

returns.description: true if the given domain fragment can be found in the window.location.hostname

name: updateQueryString
description:
Updates a value on the Query String and returns it in full.
If the value doesn't already exist it is set.
If the value exists it is replaced with the new value given. If you don't provide a new value it is removed from the query string.
Optionally you can redirect to the new url, or just return it as a string.

params.description: The querystring key to update.
params.name: key

params.description: The new value to be set. If it already exists it will be replaced.
params.name: value

params.description: If true the browser will issue a redirect to the url with the new querystring.
params.name: redirect

params.description: The URL to modify. If none is given it uses window.location.href.
params.name: url

returns.description: If redirect is false then the modified url and query string is returned.

name: getQueryString
description:
Returns the Query String as an object.
If you specify a parameter it will return just the value of that parameter, should it exist.

params.description: If specified this will return just the value for that key.
params.name: parameter

returns.description: An object containing the key value pairs found in the query string or just the value if a parameter was given.

name: decodeURI
description:
Returns the Query String as an object.
If you specify a parameter it will return just the value of that parameter, should it exist.

params.description: The URI component to be decoded.
params.name: value

returns.description: The decoded value.

name: getAll
description: Get all the tween objects in an array.

returns.description: Array with all tween objects.

name: removeAll
description: Remove all tweens running and in the queue. Doesn't call any of the tween onComplete events.

name: removeFrom
description: Remove all tweens from a specific object, array of objects or Group.

params.description: The object you want to remove the tweens from.
params.name: obj

params.description: If passing a group, setting this to true will remove the tweens from all of its children instead of the group itself.
params.name: children

name: add
description: Add a new tween into the TweenManager.

params.description: The tween object you want to add.
params.name: tween

returns.description: The tween object you added to the manager.

name: create
description: Create a tween object for a specific object. The object can be any JavaScript object or Phaser object such as Sprite.

params.description: Object the tween will be run on.
params.name: object

returns.description: The newly created tween object.

name: remove
description: Remove a tween from this manager.

params.description: The tween object you want to remove.
params.name: tween

name: update
description: Update all the tween objects you added to this manager.

returns.description: Return false if there's no tween to update, otherwise return true.

name: isTweening
description: Checks to see if a particular Sprite is currently being tweened.

params.description: The object to check for tweens against.
params.name: object

returns.description: Returns true if the object is currently being tweened, false if not.

name: pauseAll
description: Pauses all currently running tweens.

name: resumeAll
description: Resumes all currently paused tweens.

name: to
description:
Sets this tween to be a `to` tween on the properties given. A `to` tween starts at the current value and tweens to the destination value given.
For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened to `x` 200 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.
The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".
".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.

params.description: An object containing the properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.
params.name: properties

params.description: Duration of this tween in ms.
params.name: duration

params.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden.
params.name: ease

params.description: Set to `true` to allow this tween to start automatically. Otherwise call Tween.start().
params.name: autoStart

params.description: Delay before this tween will start in milliseconds. Defaults to 0, no delay.
params.name: delay

params.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This only effects this induvidual tween, not any chained tweens.
params.name: repeat

params.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.
params.name: yoyo

returns.description: This Tween object.

name: from
description:
Sets this tween to be a `from` tween on the properties given. A `from` tween sets the target to the destination value and tweens to its current value.
For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 tweened from `x` 500 would be set to `x` 500 and then tweened to `x` 100 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 500 }`.
The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".
".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.

params.description: An object containing the properties you want to tween., such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.
params.name: properties

params.description: Duration of this tween in ms.
params.name: duration

params.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden.
params.name: ease

params.description: Set to `true` to allow this tween to start automatically. Otherwise call Tween.start().
params.name: autoStart

params.description: Delay before this tween will start in milliseconds. Defaults to 0, no delay.
params.name: delay

params.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This only effects this induvidual tween, not any chained tweens.
params.name: repeat

params.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.
params.name: yoyo

returns.description: This Tween object.

name: start
description:
Starts the tween running. Can also be called by the autoStart parameter of `Tween.to` or `Tween.from`.
This sets the `Tween.isRunning` property to `true` and dispatches a `Tween.onStart` signal.
If the Tween has a delay set then nothing will start tweening until the delay has expired.

params.description: If this Tween contains child tweens you can specify which one to start from. The default is zero, i.e. the first tween created.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: stop
description:
Stops the tween if running and flags it for deletion from the TweenManager.
If called directly the `Tween.onComplete` signal is not dispatched and no chained tweens are started unless the complete parameter is set to `true`.
If you just wish to pause a tween then use Tween.pause instead.

params.description: Set to `true` to dispatch the Tween.onComplete signal.
params.name: complete

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: updateTweenData
description:
Updates either a single TweenData or all TweenData objects properties to the given value.
Used internally by methods like Tween.delay, Tween.yoyo, etc. but can also be called directly if you know which property you want to tweak.
The property is not checked, so if you pass an invalid one you'll generate a run-time error.

params.description: The property to update.
params.name: property

params.description: The value to set the property to.
params.name: value

params.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the delay on all the children.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: delay
description:
Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will start. If there are child tweens it sets the delay before the first child starts.
The delay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.
If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to delay.
If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the delay across all of them.

params.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it begins once started is called. Set to zero to remove any active delay.
params.name: duration

params.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the delay on all the children.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: repeat
description:
Sets the number of times this tween will repeat.
If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to repeat.
If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the number of times they'll repeat across all of them.
If you wish to define how many times this Tween and all children will repeat see Tween.repeatAll.

params.description: How many times a tween should repeat before completing. Set to zero to remove an active repeat. Set to -1 to repeat forever.
params.name: total

params.description: This is the amount of time to pause (in ms) before the repeat will start.
params.name: repeat

params.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the repeat value on all the children.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: repeatDelay
description:
Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will repeat itself.
The repeatDelay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.
If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to set repeatDelay on.
If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the repeatDelay across all of them.

params.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it repeats or yoyos once start is called. Set to zero to remove any active repeatDelay.
params.name: duration

params.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the repeatDelay on all the children.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: yoyo
description:
A Tween that has yoyo set to true will run through from its starting values to its end values and then play back in reverse from end to start.
Used in combination with repeat you can create endless loops.
If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to yoyo.
If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the yoyo property across all of them.
If you wish to yoyo this Tween and all of its children then see Tween.yoyoAll.

params.description: Set to true to yoyo this tween, or false to disable an already active yoyo.
params.name: enable

params.description: This is the amount of time to pause (in ms) before the yoyo will start.
params.name: yoyoDelay

params.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set yoyo on all the children.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: yoyoDelay
description:
Sets the delay in milliseconds before this tween will run a yoyo (only applies if yoyo is enabled).
The repeatDelay is invoked as soon as you call `Tween.start`. If the tween is already running this method doesn't do anything for the current active tween.
If you have not yet called `Tween.to` or `Tween.from` at least once then this method will do nothing, as there are no tweens to set repeatDelay on.
If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the repeatDelay across all of them.

params.description: The amount of time in ms that the Tween should wait until it repeats or yoyos once start is called. Set to zero to remove any active yoyoDelay.
params.name: duration

params.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the yoyoDelay on all the children.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: easing
description:
Set easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.
The ease function allows you define the rate of change. You can pass either a function such as Phaser.Easing.Circular.Out or a string such as "Circ".
".easeIn", ".easeOut" and "easeInOut" variants are all supported for all ease types.
If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value it sets the easing function defined here across all of them.

params.description: The easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.
params.name: ease

params.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the easing function on all children.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: interpolation
description:
Sets the interpolation function the tween will use. By default it uses Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation.
Also available: Phaser.Math.bezierInterpolation and Phaser.Math.catmullRomInterpolation.
The interpolation function is only used if the target properties is an array.
If you have child tweens and pass -1 as the index value and it will set the interpolation function across all of them.

params.description: The interpolation function to use (Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation by default)
params.name: interpolation

params.description: The context under which the interpolation function will be run.
params.name: context

params.description: If this tween has more than one child this allows you to target a specific child. If set to -1 it will set the interpolation function on all children.
params.name: index

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: repeat
description:
Set how many times this tween and all of its children will repeat.
A tween (A) with 3 children (B,C,D) with a `repeatAll` value of 2 would play as: ABCDABCD before completing.
When all child tweens have completed Tween.onLoop will be dispatched.

params.description: How many times this tween and all children should repeat before completing. Set to zero to remove an active repeat. Set to -1 to repeat forever.
params.name: total

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: chain
description:
This method allows you to chain tweens together. Any tween chained to this tween will have its `Tween.start` method called
as soon as this tween completes. If this tween never completes (i.e. repeatAll or loop is set) then the chain will never progress.
Note that `Tween.onComplete` will fire when *this* tween completes, not when the whole chain completes.
For that you should listen to `onComplete` on the final tween in your chain.

If you pass multiple tweens to this method they will be joined into a single long chain.
For example if this is Tween A and you pass in B, C and D then B will be chained to A, C will be chained to B and D will be chained to C.
Any previously chained tweens that may have been set will be overwritten.

params.description: One or more tweens that will be chained to this one.
params.name: tweens

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: loop
description:
Enables the looping of this tween and all child tweens. If this tween has no children this setting has no effect.
If `value` is `true` then this is the same as setting `Tween.repeatAll(-1)`.
If `value` is `false` it is the same as setting `Tween.repeatAll(0)` and will reset the `repeatCounter` to zero.

Usage:
game.add.tween(p).to({ x: 700 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None, true)
.to({ y: 300 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.to({ x: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.to({ y: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.loop();

params.description: If `true` this tween and any child tweens will loop once they reach the end. Set to `false` to remove an active loop.
params.name: value

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: onUpdateCallback
description: Sets a callback to be fired each time this tween updates.

params.description: The callback to invoke each time this tween is updated. Set to `null` to remove an already active callback.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which to call the onUpdate callback.
params.name: callbackContext

returns.description: This tween. Useful for method chaining.

name: pause
description: Pauses the tween. Resume playback with Tween.resume.

name: resume
description: Resumes a paused tween.

name: update
description: Core tween update function called by the TweenManager. Does not need to be invoked directly.

params.description: A timestamp passed in by the TweenManager.
params.name: time

returns.description: false if the tween and all child tweens have completed and should be deleted from the manager, otherwise true (still active).

name: generateData
description:
This will generate an array populated with the tweened object values from start to end.
It works by running the tween simulation at the given frame rate based on the values set-up in Tween.to and Tween.from.
It ignores delay and repeat counts and any chained tweens, but does include child tweens.
Just one play through of the tween data is returned, including yoyo if set.

params.description: The speed in frames per second that the data should be generated at. The higher the value, the larger the array it creates.
params.name: frameRate

params.description: If given the generated data will be appended to this array, otherwise a new array will be returned.
params.name: data

returns.description: An array of tweened values.

name: to
description:
Sets this tween to be a `to` tween on the properties given. A `to` tween starts at the current value and tweens to the destination value given.
For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened to `x` 200 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.

params.description: The properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.
params.name: properties

params.description: Duration of this tween in ms.
params.name: duration

params.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden at will.
params.name: ease

params.description: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.
params.name: delay

params.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This ignores any chained tweens.
params.name: repeat

params.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.
params.name: yoyo

returns.description: This Tween object.

name: from
description:
Sets this tween to be a `from` tween on the properties given. A `from` tween sets the target to the destination value and tweens to its current value.
For example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 tweened from `x` 500 would be set to `x` 500 and then tweened to `x` 100 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 500 }`.

params.description: The properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.
params.name: properties

params.description: Duration of this tween in ms.
params.name: duration

params.description: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden at will.
params.name: ease

params.description: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.
params.name: delay

params.description: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as -1. This ignores any chained tweens.
params.name: repeat

params.description: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.
params.name: yoyo

returns.description: This Tween object.

name: start
description: Starts the Tween running.

returns.description: This Tween object.

name: update
description: Updates this Tween. This is called automatically by Phaser.Tween.

params.description: A timestamp passed in by the Tween parent.
params.name: time

returns.description: The current status of this Tween. One of the Phaser.TweenData constants: PENDING, RUNNING, LOOPED or COMPLETE.

params.description: The speed in frames per second that the data should be generated at. The higher the value, the larger the array it creates.

name: boot
description: Called automatically by Phaser.Game after boot. Should not be called directly.

name: add
description: Adds an existing Phaser.Timer object to the Timer pool.

params.description: An existing Phaser.Timer object.
params.name: timer

returns.description: The given Phaser.Timer object.

name: create
description: Creates a new stand-alone Phaser.Timer object.

params.description: A Timer that is set to automatically destroy itself will do so after all of its events have been dispatched (assuming no looping events).
params.name: autoDestroy

returns.description: The Timer object that was created.

name: removeAll
description: Remove all Timer objects, regardless of their state and clears all Timers from the {@link Phaser.Time#events events} timer.

name: update
description: Updates the game clock and if enabled the advanced timing data. This is called automatically by Phaser.Game.

params.description: The current relative timestamp; see {@link Phaser.Time#now now}.
params.name: time

name: totalElapsedSeconds
description: The number of seconds that have elapsed since the game was started.

returns.description: The number of seconds that have elapsed since the game was started.

name: elapsedSince
description: How long has passed since the given time.

params.description: The time you want to measure against.
params.name: since

returns.description: The difference between the given time and now.

name: elapsedSecondsSince
description: How long has passed since the given time (in seconds).

params.description: The time you want to measure (in seconds).
params.name: since

returns.description: Duration between given time and now (in seconds).

name: reset
description: Resets the private _started value to now and removes all currently running Timers.

name: add
description:
Adds a new Event to this Timer.

The event will fire after the given amount of `delay` in milliseconds has passed, once the Timer has started running.
The delay is in relation to when the Timer starts, not the time it was added. If the Timer is already running the delay will be calculated based on the timers current time.

Make sure to call {@link Phaser.Timer#start start} after adding all of the Events you require for this Timer.

params.description: The number of milliseconds that should elapse before the callback is invoked.
params.name: delay

params.description: The callback that will be called when the Timer event occurs.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the callback will be called.
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments that will be supplied to the callback.
params.name: arguments

returns.description: The Phaser.TimerEvent object that was created.

name: repeat
description:
Adds a new TimerEvent that will always play through once and then repeat for the given number of iterations.

The event will fire after the given amount of `delay` in milliseconds has passed, once the Timer has started running.
The delay is in relation to when the Timer starts, not the time it was added. If the Timer is already running the delay will be calculated based on the timers current time.

Make sure to call {@link Phaser.Timer#start start} after adding all of the Events you require for this Timer.

params.description: The number of milliseconds that should elapse before the Timer will call the given callback.
params.name: delay

params.description: The number of times the event will repeat once is has finished playback. A repeatCount of 1 means it will repeat itself once, playing the event twice in total.
params.name: repeatCount

params.description: The callback that will be called when the Timer event occurs.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the callback will be called.
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments that will be supplied to the callback.
params.name: arguments

returns.description: The Phaser.TimerEvent object that was created.

name: loop
description:
Adds a new looped Event to this Timer that will repeat forever or until the Timer is stopped.

The event will fire after the given amount of `delay` in milliseconds has passed, once the Timer has started running.
The delay is in relation to when the Timer starts, not the time it was added. If the Timer is already running the delay will be calculated based on the timers current time.

Make sure to call {@link Phaser.Timer#start start} after adding all of the Events you require for this Timer.

params.description: The number of milliseconds that should elapse before the Timer will call the given callback.
params.name: delay

params.description: The callback that will be called when the Timer event occurs.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the callback will be called.
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments that will be supplied to the callback.
params.name: arguments

returns.description: The Phaser.TimerEvent object that was created.

name: start
description: Starts this Timer running.

params.description: The number of milliseconds that should elapse before the Timer will start.
params.name: delay

name: stop
description: Stops this Timer from running. Does not cause it to be destroyed if autoDestroy is set to true.

params.description: If true all the events in Timer will be cleared, otherwise they will remain.
params.name: clearEvents

name: remove
description: Removes a pending TimerEvent from the queue.

params.description: The event to remove from the queue.
params.name: event

name: order
description:
Orders the events on this Timer so they are in tick order.
This is called automatically when new events are created.

name: clearPendingEvents
description: Clears any events from the Timer which have pendingDelete set to true and then resets the private _len and _i values.

name: update
description: The main Timer update event, called automatically by Phaser.Time.update.

params.description: The time from the core game clock.
params.name: time

returns.description: True if there are still events waiting to be dispatched, otherwise false if this Timer can be destroyed.

name: pause
description: Pauses the Timer and all events in the queue.

name: adjustEvents
description: Adjusts the time of all pending events and the nextTick by the given baseTime.

name: resume
description: Resumes the Timer and updates all pending events.

name: removeAll
description:
Removes all Events from this Timer and all callbacks linked to onComplete, but leaves the Timer running.
The onComplete callbacks won't be called.

name: destroy
description:
Destroys this Timer. Any pending Events are not dispatched.
The onComplete callbacks won't be called.

name: add
description:
Adds a new animation under the given key. Optionally set the frames, frame rate and loop.
Animations added in this way are played back with the play function.

params.description: The unique (within this Sprite) name for the animation, i.e. "run", "fire", "walk".
params.name: name

params.description: An array of numbers/strings that correspond to the frames to add to this animation and in which order. e.g. [1, 2, 3] or ['run0', 'run1', run2]). If null then all frames will be used.
params.name: frames

params.description: The speed at which the animation should play. The speed is given in frames per second.
params.name: frameRate

params.description: Whether or not the animation is looped or just plays once.
params.name: loop

params.description: Are the given frames using numeric indexes (default) or strings?
params.name: useNumericIndex

returns.description: The Animation object that was created.

name: validateFrames
description: Check whether the frames in the given array are valid and exist.

params.description: An array of frames to be validated.
params.name: frames

params.description: Validate the frames based on their numeric index (true) or string index (false)
params.name: useNumericIndex

returns.description: True if all given Frames are valid, otherwise false.

name: play
description:
Play an animation based on the given key. The animation should previously have been added via `animations.add`

If the requested animation is already playing this request will be ignored.
If you need to reset an already running animation do so directly on the Animation object itself.

params.description: The name of the animation to be played, e.g. "fire", "walk", "jump".
params.name: name

params.description: The framerate to play the animation at. The speed is given in frames per second. If not provided the previously set frameRate of the Animation is used.
params.name: frameRate

params.description: Should the animation be looped after playback. If not provided the previously set loop value of the Animation is used.
params.name: loop

params.description: If set to true when the animation completes (only happens if loop=false) the parent Sprite will be killed.
params.name: killOnComplete

returns.description: A reference to playing Animation instance.

name: stop
description:
Stop playback of an animation. If a name is given that specific animation is stopped, otherwise the current animation is stopped.
The currentAnim property of the AnimationManager is automatically set to the animation given.

params.description: The name of the animation to be stopped, e.g. "fire". If none is given the currently running animation is stopped.
params.name: name

params.description: When the animation is stopped should the currentFrame be set to the first frame of the animation (true) or paused on the last frame displayed (false)
params.name: resetFrame

name: update
description: The main update function is called by the Sprites update loop. It's responsible for updating animation frames and firing related events.

returns.description: True if a new animation frame has been set, otherwise false.

name: next
description: Advances by the given number of frames in the current animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

params.description: The number of frames to advance.
params.name: quantity

name: previous
description: Moves backwards the given number of frames in the current animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

params.description: The number of frames to move back.
params.name: quantity

name: getAnimation
description: Returns an animation that was previously added by name.

params.description: The name of the animation to be returned, e.g. "fire".
params.name: name

returns.description: The Animation instance, if found, otherwise null.

name: refreshFrame
description: Refreshes the current frame data back to the parent Sprite and also resets the texture data.

name: destroy
description:
Destroys all references this AnimationManager contains.
Iterates through the list of animations stored in this manager and calls destroy on each of them.

name: play
description: Plays this animation.

params.description: The framerate to play the animation at. The speed is given in frames per second. If not provided the previously set frameRate of the Animation is used.
params.name: frameRate

params.description: Should the animation be looped after playback. If not provided the previously set loop value of the Animation is used.
params.name: loop

params.description: If set to true when the animation completes (only happens if loop=false) the parent Sprite will be killed.
params.name: killOnComplete

returns.description: - A reference to this Animation instance.

name: restart
description: Sets this animation back to the first frame and restarts the animation.

name: setFrame
description: Sets this animations playback to a given frame with the given ID.

params.description: The identifier of the frame to set. Can be the name of the frame, the sprite index of the frame, or the animation-local frame index.
params.name: frameId

params.description: If you provide a number for frameId, should it use the numeric indexes of the frameData, or the 0-indexed frame index local to the animation.
params.name: useLocalFrameIndex

name: stop
description:
Stops playback of this animation and set it to a finished state. If a resetFrame is provided it will stop playback and set frame to the first in the animation.
If `dispatchComplete` is true it will dispatch the complete events, otherwise they'll be ignored.

params.description: If true after the animation stops the currentFrame value will be set to the first frame in this animation.
params.name: resetFrame

params.description: Dispatch the Animation.onComplete and parent.onAnimationComplete events?
params.name: dispatchComplete

name: onPause
description: Called when the Game enters a paused state.

name: onResume
description: Called when the Game resumes from a paused state.

name: update
description: Updates this animation. Called automatically by the AnimationManager.

name: next
description: Advances by the given number of frames in the Animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

params.description: The number of frames to advance.
params.name: quantity

name: previous
description: Moves backwards the given number of frames in the Animation, taking the loop value into consideration.

params.description: The number of frames to move back.
params.name: quantity

name: updateFrameData
description: Changes the FrameData object this Animation is using.

params.description: The FrameData object that contains all frames used by this Animation.
params.name: frameData

name: destroy
description: Cleans up this animation ready for deletion. Nulls all values and references.

name: complete
description:
Called internally when the animation finishes playback.
Sets the isPlaying and isFinished states and dispatches the onAnimationComplete event if it exists on the parent and local onComplete event.

name: resize
description: Adjusts of all the Frame properties based on the given width and height values.

params.description: The new width of the Frame.
params.name: width

params.description: The new height of the Frame.
params.name: height

name: setTrim
description: If the frame was trimmed when added to the Texture Atlas this records the trim and source data.

params.description: If this frame was trimmed or not.
params.name: trimmed

params.description: The width of the frame before being trimmed.
params.name: actualWidth

params.description: The height of the frame before being trimmed.
params.name: actualHeight

params.description: The destination X position of the trimmed frame for display.
params.name: destX

params.description: The destination Y position of the trimmed frame for display.
params.name: destY

params.description: The destination width of the trimmed frame for display.
params.name: destWidth

params.description: The destination height of the trimmed frame for display.
params.name: destHeight

name: clone
description:
Clones this Frame into a new Phaser.Frame object and returns it.
Note that all properties are cloned, including the name, index and UUID.

returns.description: An exact copy of this Frame object.

name: getRect
description: Returns a Rectangle set to the dimensions of this Frame.

params.description: A rectangle to copy the frame dimensions to.
params.name: out

returns.description: A rectangle.

name: addFrame
description: Adds a new Frame to this FrameData collection. Typically called by the Animation.Parser and not directly.

params.description: The frame to add to this FrameData set.
params.name: frame

returns.description: The frame that was just added.

name: getFrame
description: Get a Frame by its numerical index.

params.description: The index of the frame you want to get.
params.name: index

returns.description: The frame, if found.

name: getFrameByName
description: Get a Frame by its frame name.

params.description: The name of the frame you want to get.
params.name: name

returns.description: The frame, if found.

name: checkFrameName
description: Check if there is a Frame with the given name.

params.description: The name of the frame you want to check.
params.name: name

returns.description: True if the frame is found, otherwise false.

name: clone
description: Makes a copy of this FrameData including copies (not references) to all of the Frames it contains.

returns.description: A clone of this object, including clones of the Frame objects it contains.

name: getFrameRange
description: Returns a range of frames based on the given start and end frame indexes and returns them in an Array.

params.description: The starting frame index.
params.name: start

params.description: The ending frame index.
params.name: end

params.description: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.
params.name: output

returns.description: An array of Frames between the start and end index values, or an empty array if none were found.

name: getFrames
description:
Returns all of the Frames in this FrameData set where the frame index is found in the input array.
The frames are returned in the output array, or if none is provided in a new Array object.

params.description: An Array containing the indexes of the frames to retrieve. If the array is empty or undefined then all frames in the FrameData are returned.
params.name: frames

params.description: Are the given frames using numeric indexes (default) or strings? (false)
params.name: useNumericIndex

params.description: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.
params.name: output

returns.description: An array of all Frames in this FrameData set matching the given names or IDs.

name: getFrameIndexes
description:
Returns all of the Frame indexes in this FrameData set.
The frames indexes are returned in the output array, or if none is provided in a new Array object.

params.description: An Array containing the indexes of the frames to retrieve. If undefined or the array is empty then all frames in the FrameData are returned.
params.name: frames

params.description: Are the given frames using numeric indexes (default) or strings? (false)
params.name: useNumericIndex

params.description: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.
params.name: output

returns.description: An array of all Frame indexes matching the given names or IDs.

name: addCanvas
description: Add a new canvas object in to the cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The Canvas DOM element.
params.name: canvas

params.description: The context of the canvas element. If not specified it will default go `getContext('2d')`.
params.name: context

name: addImage
description:
Adds an Image file into the Cache. The file must have already been loaded, typically via Phaser.Loader, but can also have been loaded into the DOM.
If an image already exists in the cache with the same key then it is removed and destroyed, and the new image inserted in its place.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra image data.
params.name: data

returns.description: The full image object that was added to the cache.

name: addDefaultImage
description:
Adds a default image to be used in special cases such as WebGL Filters.
It uses the special reserved key of `__default`.
This method is called automatically when the Cache is created.
This image is skipped when `Cache.destroy` is called due to its internal requirements.

name: addMissingImage
description:
Adds an image to be used when a key is wrong / missing.
It uses the special reserved key of `__missing`.
This method is called automatically when the Cache is created.
This image is skipped when `Cache.destroy` is called due to its internal requirements.

name: addSound
description: Adds a Sound file into the Cache. The file must have already been loaded, typically via Phaser.Loader.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra sound data.
params.name: data

params.description: True if the file is using web audio.
params.name: webAudio

params.description: True if the file is using legacy HTML audio.
params.name: audioTag

name: addText
description: Add a new text data.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra text data.
params.name: data

name: addPhysicsData
description: Add a new physics data object to the Cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: The physics data object (a JSON file).
params.name: JSONData

params.description: The format of the physics data.
params.name: format

name: addTilemap
description: Add a new tilemap to the Cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: The tilemap data object (either a CSV or JSON file).
params.name: mapData

params.description: The format of the tilemap data.
params.name: format

name: addBinary
description: Add a binary object in to the cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The binary object to be added to the cache.
params.name: binaryData

name: addBitmapData
description: Add a BitmapData object to the cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The BitmapData object to be addded to the cache.
params.name: bitmapData

params.description: Optional FrameData set associated with the given BitmapData. If not specified (or `undefined`) a new FrameData object is created containing the Bitmap's Frame. If `null` is supplied then no FrameData will be created.
params.name: frameData

returns.description: The BitmapData object to be addded to the cache.

name: addBitmapFont
description: Add a new Bitmap Font to the Cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra font data.
params.name: data

params.description: Texture atlas frames data.
params.name: atlasData

params.description: If you'd like to add additional horizontal spacing between the characters then set the pixel value here.
params.name: xSpacing

params.description: If you'd like to add additional vertical spacing between the lines then set the pixel value here.
params.name: ySpacing

name: addJSON
description: Add a new json object into the cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra json data.
params.name: data

name: addXML
description: Add a new xml object into the cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra text data.
params.name: data

name: addVideo
description: Adds a Video file into the Cache. The file must have already been loaded, typically via Phaser.Loader.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra video data.
params.name: data

params.description: True if the file was preloaded via xhr and the data parameter is a Blob. false if a Video tag was created instead.
params.name: isBlob

name: addShader
description: Adds a Fragment Shader in to the Cache. The file must have already been loaded, typically via Phaser.Loader.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra shader data.
params.name: data

name: addRenderTexture
description: Add a new Phaser.RenderTexture in to the cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The texture to use as the base of the RenderTexture.
params.name: texture

name: addSpriteSheet
description: Add a new sprite sheet in to the cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra sprite sheet data.
params.name: data

params.description: Width of the sprite sheet.
params.name: frameWidth

params.description: Height of the sprite sheet.
params.name: frameHeight

params.description: How many frames stored in the sprite sheet. If -1 then it divides the whole sheet evenly.
params.name: frameMax

params.description: If the frames have been drawn with a margin, specify the amount here.
params.name: margin

params.description: If the frames have been drawn with spacing between them, specify the amount here.
params.name: spacing

name: addTextureAtlas
description: Add a new texture atlas to the Cache.

params.description: The key that this asset will be stored in the cache under. This should be unique within this cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The URL the asset was loaded from. If the asset was not loaded externally set to `null`.
params.name: url

params.description: Extra texture atlas data.
params.name: data

params.description: Texture atlas frames data.
params.name: atlasData

params.description: The format of the texture atlas.
params.name: format

name: reloadSound
description: Reload a Sound file from the server.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

name: reloadSoundComplete
description: Fires the onSoundUnlock event when the sound has completed reloading.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

name: updateSound
description: Updates the sound object in the cache.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

name: decodedSound
description: Add a new decoded sound.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

params.description: Extra sound data.
params.name: data

name: isSoundDecoded
description: Check if the given sound has finished decoding.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The decoded state of the Sound object.

name: isSoundReady
description:
Check if the given sound is ready for playback.
A sound is considered ready when it has finished decoding and the device is no longer touch locked.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the sound is decoded and the device is not touch locked.

name: checkKey
description: Checks if a key for the given cache object type exists.

params.description: The cache to search. One of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE` or `Phaser.Cache.SOUND`.
params.name: cache

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the key exists, otherwise false.

name: checkURL
description:
Checks if the given URL has been loaded into the Cache.
This method will only work if Cache.autoResolveURL was set to `true` before any preloading took place.
The method will make a DOM src call to the URL given, so please be aware of this for certain file types, such as Sound files on Firefox
which may cause double-load instances.

params.description: The url to check for in the cache.
params.name: url

returns.description: True if the url exists, otherwise false.

name: checkCanvasKey
description: Checks if the given key exists in the Canvas Cache.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

name: checkImageKey
description: Checks if the given key exists in the Image Cache. Note that this also includes Texture Atlases, Sprite Sheets and Retro Fonts.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

name: checkTextureKey
description: Checks if the given key exists in the Texture Cache.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

name: checkSoundKey
description: Checks if the given key exists in the Sound Cache.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

description: Checks if the given key exists in the BitmapData Cache.

params.name: key

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

returns.description: True if the key exists in the cache, otherwise false.

name: getItem
description:
Get an item from a cache based on the given key and property.

This method is mostly used internally by other Cache methods such as `getImage` but is exposed
publicly for your own use as well.

params.description: The key of the asset within the cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The cache to search. One of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE` or `Phaser.Cache.SOUND`.
params.name: cache

params.description: The string name of the method calling getItem. Can be empty, in which case no console warning is output.
params.name: method

params.description: If you require a specific property from the cache item, specify it here.
params.name: property

returns.description: The cached item if found, otherwise `null`. If the key is invalid and `method` is set then a console.warn is output.

name: getCanvas
description:
Gets a Canvas object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The canvas object or `null` if no item could be found matching the given key.

name: getImage
description:
Gets a Image object from the cache. This returns a DOM Image object, not a Phaser.Image object.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

Only the Image cache is searched, which covers images loaded via Loader.image, Sprite Sheets and Texture Atlases.

If you need the image used by a bitmap font or similar then please use those respective 'get' methods.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache. If not given or null it will return a default image. If given but not found in the cache it will throw a warning and return the missing image.
params.name: key

params.description: If true the full image object will be returned, if false just the HTML Image object is returned.
params.name: full

returns.description: The Image object if found in the Cache, otherwise `null`. If `full` was true then a JavaScript object is returned.

name: getTextureFrame
description:
Get a single texture frame by key.

You'd only do this to get the default Frame created for a non-atlas / spritesheet image.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The frame data.

name: getSound
description:
Gets a Phaser.Sound object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The sound object.

name: getSoundData
description:
Gets a raw Sound data object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The sound data.

name: getText
description:
Gets a Text object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The text data.

name: getPhysicsData
description:
Gets a Physics Data object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

You can get either the entire data set, a single object or a single fixture of an object from it.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

params.description: If specified it will return just the physics object that is part of the given key, if null it will return them all.
params.name: object

params.description: Fixture key of fixture inside an object. This key can be set per fixture with the Phaser Exporter.
params.name: fixtureKey

returns.description: The requested physics object data if found.

name: getTilemapData
description:
Gets a raw Tilemap data object from the cache. This will be in either CSV or JSON format.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The raw tilemap data in CSV or JSON format.

name: getBinary
description:
Gets a binary object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The binary data object.

name: getBitmapData
description:
Gets a BitmapData object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The requested BitmapData object if found, or null if not.

name: getBitmapFont
description:
Gets a Bitmap Font object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The requested BitmapFont object if found, or null if not.

name: getJSON
description:
Gets a JSON object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

You can either return the object by reference (the default), or return a clone
of it by setting the `clone` argument to `true`.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

params.description: Return a clone of the original object (true) or a reference to it? (false)
params.name: clone

returns.description: The JSON object.

name: getXML
description:
Gets an XML object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The XML object.

name: getVideo
description:
Gets a Phaser.Video object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The video object.

name: getShader
description:
Gets a fragment shader object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The shader object.

name: getRenderTexture
description:
Gets a RenderTexture object from the cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: The key of the asset to retrieve from the cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The RenderTexture object.

name: getBaseTexture
description: Gets a PIXI.BaseTexture by key from the given Cache.

params.description: Asset key of the image for which you want the BaseTexture for.
params.name: key

params.description: The cache to search for the item in.
params.name: cache

returns.description: The BaseTexture object.

name: getFrame
description: Get a single frame by key. You'd only do this to get the default Frame created for a non-atlas/spritesheet image.

params.description: Asset key of the frame data to retrieve from the Cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The frame data.

name: getFrameCount
description: Get the total number of frames contained in the FrameData object specified by the given key.

params.description: Asset key of the FrameData you want.
params.name: key

returns.description: Then number of frames. 0 if the image is not found.

name: getFrameData
description:
Gets a Phaser.FrameData object from the Image Cache.

The object is looked-up based on the key given.

Note: If the object cannot be found a `console.warn` message is displayed.

params.description: Asset key of the frame data to retrieve from the Cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The frame data.

name: hasFrameData
description: Check if the FrameData for the given key exists in the Image Cache.

params.description: Asset key of the frame data to retrieve from the Cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the given key has frameData in the cache, otherwise false.

name: updateFrameData
description: Replaces a set of frameData with a new Phaser.FrameData object.

params.description: The unique key by which you will reference this object.
params.name: key

params.description: The new FrameData.
params.name: frameData

params.description: The cache to search. One of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE` or `Phaser.Cache.SOUND`.
params.name: cache

name: getFrameByIndex
description: Get a single frame out of a frameData set by key.

params.description: Asset key of the frame data to retrieve from the Cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The index of the frame you want to get.
params.name: index

returns.description: The frame object.

name: getFrameByName
description: Get a single frame out of a frameData set by key.

params.description: Asset key of the frame data to retrieve from the Cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The name of the frame you want to get.
params.name: name

returns.description: The frame object.

name: getPixiTexture
description:
Gets a PIXI.Texture by key from the PIXI.TextureCache.

If the texture isn't found in the cache, then it searches the Phaser Image Cache and
creates a new PIXI.Texture object which is then returned.

params.description: Asset key of the Texture to retrieve from the Cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The Texture object.

name: getPixiBaseTexture
description:
Gets a PIXI.BaseTexture by key from the PIXI.BaseTextureCache.

If the texture isn't found in the cache, then it searches the Phaser Image Cache.

params.description: Asset key of the BaseTexture to retrieve from the Cache.
params.name: key

returns.description: The BaseTexture object or null if not found.

name: getURL
description:
Get a cached object by the URL.
This only returns a value if you set Cache.autoResolveURL to `true` *before* starting the preload of any assets.
Be aware that every call to this function makes a DOM src query, so use carefully and double-check for implications in your target browsers/devices.

params.description: The url for the object loaded to get from the cache.
params.name: url

returns.description: The cached object.

name: getKeys
description: Gets all keys used in the requested Cache.

params.description: The Cache you wish to get the keys from. Can be any of the Cache consts such as `Phaser.Cache.IMAGE`, `Phaser.Cache.SOUND` etc.
params.name: cache

returns.description: The array of keys in the requested cache.

name: removeCanvas
description:
Removes a canvas from the cache.

Note that this only removes it from the Phaser.Cache. If you still have references to the data elsewhere
then it will persist in memory.

params.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.
params.name: key

name: removeImage
description:
Removes an image from the cache.

You can optionally elect to destroy it as well. This calls BaseTexture.destroy on it.

Note that this only removes it from the Phaser and PIXI Caches. If you still have references to the data elsewhere
then it will persist in memory.

params.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.
params.name: key

params.description: Should this image also be destroyed? Removing it from the PIXI.BaseTextureCache?
params.name: removeFromPixi

name: removeSound
description:
Removes a sound from the cache.

Note that this only removes it from the Phaser.Cache. If you still have references to the data elsewhere
then it will persist in memory.

params.description: Key of the asset you want to remove.
params.name: key

Removes a text file from the cache.
