Sets the acceleration.x/y property on the display object so it will move towards the x/y coordinates at the given speed (in pixels per second sq.)
You must give a maximum speed value, beyond which the display object won't go any faster.
Note: The display object does not continuously track the target. If the target changes location during transit the display object will not modify its course.
Note: The display object doesn't stop moving once it reaches the destination coordinates.

params.description: The display object to move.
params.name: displayObject

params.description: The x coordinate to accelerate towards.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate to accelerate towards.
params.name: y

params.description: The speed it will accelerate in pixels per second.
params.name: speed

params.description: The maximum x velocity the display object can reach.
params.name: xSpeedMax

params.description: The maximum y velocity the display object can reach.
params.name: ySpeedMax

returns.description: The angle (in radians) that the object should be visually set to in order to match its new trajectory.

name: distanceBetween
description: Find the distance between two display objects (like Sprites).

params.description: The Display Object to test from.
params.name: source

params.description: The Display Object to test to.
params.name: target

returns.description: The distance between the source and target objects.

name: distanceToXY
description:
Find the distance between a display object (like a Sprite) and the given x/y coordinates.
The calculation is made from the display objects x/y coordinate. This may be the top-left if its anchor hasn't been changed.
If you need to calculate from the center of a display object instead use the method distanceBetweenCenters()

params.description: The Display Object to test from.
params.name: displayObject

params.description: The x coordinate to move towards.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate to move towards.
params.name: y

returns.description: The distance between the object and the x/y coordinates.

name: distanceToPointer
description:
Find the distance between a display object (like a Sprite) and a Pointer. If no Pointer is given the Input.activePointer is used.
The calculation is made from the display objects x/y coordinate. This may be the top-left if its anchor hasn't been changed.
If you need to calculate from the center of a display object instead use the method distanceBetweenCenters()
The distance to the Pointer is returned in screen space, not world space.

params.description: The Display Object to test from.
params.name: displayObject

params.description: The Phaser.Pointer to test to. If none is given then Input.activePointer is used.
params.name: pointer

returns.description: The distance between the object and the Pointer.

name: angleBetween
description: Find the angle in radians between two display objects (like Sprites).

params.description: The Display Object to test from.
params.name: source

params.description: The Display Object to test to.
params.name: target

returns.description: The angle in radians between the source and target display objects.

name: angleToXY
description: Find the angle in radians between a display object (like a Sprite) and the given x/y coordinate.

params.description: The Display Object to test from.
params.name: displayObject

params.description: The x coordinate to get the angle to.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate to get the angle to.
params.name: y

returns.description: The angle in radians between displayObject.x/y to Pointer.x/y

name: angleToPointer
description: Find the angle in radians between a display object (like a Sprite) and a Pointer, taking their x/y and center into account.

params.description: The Display Object to test from.
params.name: displayObject

params.description: The Phaser.Pointer to test to. If none is given then Input.activePointer is used.
params.name: pointer

returns.description: The angle in radians between displayObject.x/y to Pointer.x/y

You can modify the size of the physics Body to be any dimension you need.
So it could be smaller or larger than the parent Sprite. You can also control the x and y offset, which

name: onWall
description: Returns true if either side of this Body is in contact with either the world bounds or a tile.

returns.description: True if in contact with either the world bounds or a tile.

name: deltaAbsX
description: Returns the absolute delta x value.

returns.description: The absolute delta value.

name: deltaAbsY
description: Returns the absolute delta y value.

returns.description: The absolute delta value.

name: deltaX
description: Returns the delta x value. The difference between Body.x now and in the previous step.

returns.description: The delta value. Positive if the motion was to the right, negative if to the left.

name: deltaY
description: Returns the delta y value. The difference between Body.y now and in the previous step.

returns.description: The delta value. Positive if the motion was downwards, negative if upwards.

name: deltaZ
description: Returns the delta z value. The difference between Body.rotation now and in the previous step.

returns.description: The delta value. Positive if the motion was clockwise, negative if anti-clockwise.

params.description: Y position of the debug info to be rendered.

name: removeBodyNextStep
description: This will add a P2 Physics body into the removal list for the next step.

params.description: The body to remove at the start of the next step.
params.name: body

name: preUpdate
description: Called at the start of the core update loop. Purges flagged bodies from the world.

name: enable
description:
This will create a P2 Physics body on the given game object or array of game objects.
A game object can only have 1 physics body active at any one time, and it can't be changed until the object is destroyed.
Note: When the game object is enabled for P2 physics it has its anchor x/y set to 0.5 so it becomes centered.

params.description: The game object to create the physics body on. Can also be an array or Group of objects, a body will be created on every child that has a `body` property.
params.name: object

params.description: Create a debug object to go with this body?
params.name: debug

params.description: Should a body be created on all children of this object? If true it will recurse down the display list as far as it can go.
params.name: children

name: enableBody
description:
Creates a P2 Physics body on the given game object.
A game object can only have 1 physics body active at any one time, and it can't be changed until the body is nulled.

params.description: The game object to create the physics body on. A body will only be created if this object has a null `body` property.
params.name: object

params.description: Create a debug object to go with this body?
params.name: debug

name: setImpactEvents
description:
Impact event handling is disabled by default. Enable it before any impact events will be dispatched.
In a busy world hundreds of impact events can be generated every step, so only enable this if you cannot do what you need via beginContact or collision masks.

params.description: Set to true to enable impact events, or false to disable.
params.name: state

name: setPostBroadphaseCallback
description:
Sets a callback to be fired after the Broadphase has collected collision pairs in the world.
Just because a pair exists it doesn't mean they *will* collide, just that they potentially could do.
If your calback returns `false` the pair will be removed from the narrowphase. This will stop them testing for collision this step.
Returning `true` from the callback will ensure they are checked in the narrowphase.

params.description: The callback that will receive the postBroadphase event data. It must return a boolean. Set to null to disable an existing callback.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context under which the callback will be fired.
params.name: context

name: beginContactHandler
description: Handles a p2 begin contact event.

params.description: The event data.
params.name: event

name: endContactHandler
description: Handles a p2 end contact event.

params.description: The event data.
params.name: event

name: setBoundsToWorld
description:
Sets the bounds of the Physics world to match the Game.World dimensions.
You can optionally set which 'walls' to create: left, right, top or bottom.

params.description: If true will create the left bounds wall.
params.name: left

params.description: If true will create the right bounds wall.
params.name: right

params.description: If true will create the top bounds wall.
params.name: top

params.description: If true will create the bottom bounds wall.
params.name: bottom

params.description: If true the Bounds will be set to use its own Collision Group.
params.name: setCollisionGroup

name: setWorldMaterial
description: Sets the given material against the 4 bounds of this World.

params.description: The material to set.
params.name: material

params.description: If true will set the material on the left bounds wall.
params.name: left

params.description: If true will set the material on the right bounds wall.
params.name: right

params.description: If true will set the material on the top bounds wall.
params.name: top

params.description: If true will set the material on the bottom bounds wall.
params.name: bottom

name: updateBoundsCollisionGroup
description:
By default the World will be set to collide everything with everything. The bounds of the world is a Body with 4 shapes, one for each face.
If you start to use your own collision groups then your objects will no longer collide with the bounds.
To fix this you need to adjust the bounds to use its own collision group first BEFORE changing your Sprites collision group.

params.description: If true the Bounds will be set to use its own Collision Group.
params.name: setCollisionGroup

name: setBounds
description:
Sets the bounds of the Physics world to match the given world pixel dimensions.
You can optionally set which 'walls' to create: left, right, top or bottom.
If none of the walls are given it will default to use the walls settings it had previously.
I.e. if you previously told it to not have the left or right walls, and you then adjust the world size
the newly created bounds will also not have the left and right walls.
Explicitly state them in the parameters to override this.

params.description: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the bounds.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the bounds.
params.name: y

params.description: The width of the bounds.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the bounds.
params.name: height

params.description: If true will create the left bounds wall.
params.name: left

params.description: If true will create the right bounds wall.
params.name: right

params.description: If true will create the top bounds wall.
params.name: top

params.description: If true will create the bottom bounds wall.
params.name: bottom

params.description: If true the Bounds will be set to use its own Collision Group.
params.name: setCollisionGroup

name: pause
description: Pauses the P2 World independent of the game pause state.

name: resume
description: Resumes a paused P2 World.

name: update
description: Internal P2 update loop.

name: reset
description:
Called by Phaser.Physics when a State swap occurs.
Starts the begin and end Contact listeners again.

name: clear
description:
Clears all bodies from the simulation, resets callbacks and resets the collision bitmask.

The P2 world is also cleared:

* Removes all solver equations
* Removes all constraints
* Removes all bodies
* Removes all springs
* Removes all contact materials

This is called automatically when you switch state.

name: destroy
description: Clears all bodies from the simulation and unlinks World from Game. Should only be called on game shutdown. Call `clear` on a State change.

name: addBody
description: Add a body to the world.

params.description: The Body to add to the World.
params.name: body

returns.description: True if the Body was added successfully, otherwise false.

name: removeBody
description: Removes a body from the world. This will silently fail if the body wasn't part of the world to begin with.

params.description: The Body to remove from the World.
params.name: body

returns.description: The Body that was removed.

name: addSpring
description: Adds a Spring to the world.

params.description: The Spring to add to the World.
params.name: spring

returns.description: The Spring that was added.

name: removeSpring
description: Removes a Spring from the world.

params.description: The Spring to remove from the World.
params.name: spring

returns.description: The Spring that was removed.

name: createDistanceConstraint
description: Creates a constraint that tries to keep the distance between two bodies constant.

params.description: First connected body.
params.name: bodyA

params.description: Second connected body.
params.name: bodyB

params.description: The distance to keep between the bodies.
params.name: distance

params.description: The anchor point for bodyA, defined locally in bodyA frame. Defaults to [0,0].
params.name: localAnchorA

params.description: The anchor point for bodyB, defined locally in bodyB frame. Defaults to [0,0].
params.name: localAnchorB

params.description: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.
params.name: maxForce

returns.description: The constraint

name: createGearConstraint
description: Creates a constraint that tries to keep the distance between two bodies constant.

params.description: First connected body.
params.name: bodyA

params.description: Second connected body.
params.name: bodyB

params.description: The relative angle
params.name: angle

params.description: The gear ratio.
params.name: ratio

returns.description: The constraint

name: createRevoluteConstraint
description:
Connects two bodies at given offset points, letting them rotate relative to each other around this point.
The pivot points are given in world (pixel) coordinates.

params.description: First connected body.
params.name: bodyA

params.description: The point relative to the center of mass of bodyA which bodyA is constrained to. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: pivotA

params.description: Second connected body.
params.name: bodyB

params.description: The point relative to the center of mass of bodyB which bodyB is constrained to. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: pivotB

params.description: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.
params.name: maxForce

params.description: A pivot point given in world coordinates. If specified, localPivotA and localPivotB are automatically computed from this value.
params.name: worldPivot

returns.description: The constraint

name: createLockConstraint
description: Locks the relative position between two bodies.

params.description: First connected body.
params.name: bodyA

params.description: Second connected body.
params.name: bodyB

params.description: The offset of bodyB in bodyA's frame. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: offset

params.description: The angle of bodyB in bodyA's frame.
params.name: angle

params.description: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.
params.name: maxForce

returns.description: The constraint

name: createPrismaticConstraint
description:
Constraint that only allows bodies to move along a line, relative to each other.
See http://www.iforce2d.net/b2dtut/joints-prismatic

params.description: First connected body.
params.name: bodyA

params.description: Second connected body.
params.name: bodyB

params.description: If set to false, bodyB will be free to rotate around its anchor point.
params.name: lockRotation

params.description: Body A's anchor point, defined in its own local frame. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: anchorA

params.description: Body A's anchor point, defined in its own local frame. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: anchorB

params.description: An axis, defined in body A frame, that body B's anchor point may slide along. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: axis

params.description: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.
params.name: maxForce

returns.description: The constraint

name: removeConstraint
description: Removes a Constraint from the world.

params.name: materialA

params.description: The second Material to search for.
params.name: materialB

returns.description: The Contact Material or false if none was found matching the Materials given.

name: setMaterial
description: Sets the given Material against all Shapes owned by all the Bodies in the given array.

params.description: The Material to be applied to the given Bodies.
params.name: material

params.description: An Array of Body objects that the given Material will be set on.
params.name: bodies

name: createMaterial
description:
Creates a Material. Materials are applied to Shapes owned by a Body and can be set with Body.setMaterial().
Materials are a way to control what happens when Shapes collide. Combine unique Materials together to create Contact Materials.
Contact Materials have properties such as friction and restitution that allow for fine-grained collision control between different Materials.

params.description: Optional name of the Material. Each Material has a unique ID but string names are handy for debugging.
params.name: name

params.description: Optional Body. If given it will assign the newly created Material to the Body shapes.
params.name: body

returns.description: The Material that was created. This is also stored in Phaser.Physics.P2.materials.

name: createContactMaterial
description: Creates a Contact Material from the two given Materials. You can then edit the properties of the Contact Material directly.

params.description: The first Material to create the ContactMaterial from. If undefined it will create a new Material object first.
params.name: materialA

params.description: The second Material to create the ContactMaterial from. If undefined it will create a new Material object first.
params.name: materialB

params.description: Material options object.
params.name: options

returns.description: The Contact Material that was created.

name: getBodies
description: Populates and returns an array with references to of all current Bodies in the world.

returns.description: An array containing all current Bodies in the world.

name: getBody
description: Checks the given object to see if it has a p2.Body and if so returns it.

params.description: The object to check for a p2.Body on.
params.name: object

returns.description: The p2.Body, or null if not found.

name: getSprings
description: Populates and returns an array of all current Springs in the world.

returns.description: An array containing all current Springs in the world.

name: getConstraints
description:
Populates and returns an array of all current Constraints in the world.
You will get an array of p2 constraints back. This can be of mixed types, for example the array may contain
PrismaticConstraints, RevoluteConstraints or any other valid p2 constraint type.

returns.description: An array containing all current Constraints in the world.

name: hitTest
description:
Test if a world point overlaps bodies. You will get an array of actual P2 bodies back. You can find out which Sprite a Body belongs to
(if any) by checking the Body.parent.sprite property. Body.parent is a Phaser.Physics.P2.Body property.

params.description: Point to use for intersection tests. The points values must be in world (pixel) coordinates.
params.name: worldPoint

params.description: A list of objects to check for intersection. If not given it will check Phaser.Physics.P2.world.bodies (i.e. all world bodies)
params.name: bodies

params.description: Used for matching against particles and lines. Adds some margin to these infinitesimal objects.
params.name: precision

params.description: If true all Static objects will be removed from the results array.
params.name: filterStatic

returns.description: Array of bodies that overlap the point.

name: toJSON
description: Converts the current world into a JSON object.

returns.description: A JSON representation of the world.

name: createCollisionGroup
description:
Creates a new Collision Group and optionally applies it to the given object.
Collision Groups are handled using bitmasks, therefore you have a fixed limit you can create before you need to re-use older groups.

params.description: An optional Sprite or Group to apply the Collision Group to. If a Group is given it will be applied to all top-level children.
params.name: object

name: setCollisionGroup
description:
Sets the given CollisionGroup to be the collision group for all shapes in this Body, unless a shape is specified.
Note that this resets the collisionMask and any previously set groups. See Body.collides() for appending them.

params.description: A Sprite or Group to apply the Collision Group to. If a Group is given it will be applied to all top-level children.
params.name: object

params.description: The Collision Group that this Bodies shapes will use.
params.name: group

params.description: Second connected body.

params.description: Where to hook the spring to body B in world coordinates. This value is an array by 2 elements, x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: worldB

params.description: Where to hook the spring to body A in local body coordinates. This value is an array by 2 elements, x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: localA

params.description: Where to hook the spring to body B in local body coordinates. This value is an array by 2 elements, x and y, i.e: [32, 32].
params.name: localB

params.description: Second connected body.
params.name: bodyB

params.description: Stiffness of the spring. A number >= 0.
params.name: stiffness

params.description: Damping of the spring. A number >= 0.
params.name: damping

name: convertCollisionObjects
description:
Converts all of the polylines objects inside a Tiled ObjectGroup into physics bodies that are added to the world.
Note that the polylines must be created in such a way that they can withstand polygon decomposition.

params.description: The Tilemap to get the map data from.
params.name: map

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to map.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

params.description: If true it will automatically add each body to the world.
params.name: addToWorld

returns.description: An array of the Phaser.Physics.Body objects that have been created.

name: clearTilemapLayerBodies
description: Clears all physics bodies from the given TilemapLayer that were created with `World.convertTilemap`.

params.description: The Tilemap to get the map data from.
params.name: map

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to map.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

name: convertTilemap
description:
Goes through all tiles in the given Tilemap and TilemapLayer and converts those set to collide into physics bodies.
Only call this *after* you have specified all of the tiles you wish to collide with calls like Tilemap.setCollisionBetween, etc.
Every time you call this method it will destroy any previously created bodies and remove them from the world.
Therefore understand it's a very expensive operation and not to be done in a core game update loop.

params.description: The Tilemap to get the map data from.
params.name: map

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to map.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

params.description: If true it will automatically add each body to the world, otherwise it's up to you to do so.
params.name: addToWorld

params.description: If true adjacent colliding tiles will be combined into a single body to save processing. However it means you cannot perform specific Tile to Body collision responses.
params.name: optimize

returns.description: An array of the Phaser.Physics.P2.Body objects that were created.

name: mpx
description:
Convert p2 physics value (meters) to pixel scale.
By default Phaser uses a scale of 20px per meter.
If you need to modify this you can over-ride these functions via the Physics Configuration object.

params.description: The value to convert.
params.name: v

returns.description: The scaled value.

name: pxm
description:
Convert pixel value to p2 physics scale (meters).
By default Phaser uses a scale of 20px per meter.
If you need to modify this you can over-ride these functions via the Physics Configuration object.

params.description: The value to convert.
params.name: v

returns.description: The scaled value.

name: mpxi
description:
Convert p2 physics value (meters) to pixel scale and inverses it.
By default Phaser uses a scale of 20px per meter.
If you need to modify this you can over-ride these functions via the Physics Configuration object.

params.description: The value to convert.
params.name: v

returns.description: The scaled value.

name: pxmi
description:
Convert pixel value to p2 physics scale (meters) and inverses it.
By default Phaser uses a scale of 20px per meter.
If you need to modify this you can over-ride these functions via the Physics Configuration object.

params.description: The value to convert.
params.name: v

returns.description: The scaled value.

name: parse
description: Parser for the output of Phaser.Physics.P2.Body#addPhaserPolygon

name: flatten
description: A helper to flatten arrays. This is very useful as the fixtures are nested from time to time due to the way P2 creates and splits polygons.

params.description: The array to flatten. Notice: This will happen recursive not shallow.
params.name: array

name: createBodyCallback
description:
Sets a callback to be fired any time a shape in this Body impacts with a shape in the given Body. The impact test is performed against body.id values.
The callback will be sent 4 parameters: This body, the body that impacted, the Shape in this body and the shape in the impacting body.
Note that the impact event happens after collision resolution, so it cannot be used to prevent a collision from happening.
It also happens mid-step. So do not destroy a Body during this callback, instead set safeDestroy to true so it will be killed on the next preUpdate.

params.description: The object to send impact events for.
params.name: object

params.description: The callback to fire on impact. Set to null to clear a previously set callback.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context under which the callback will fire.
params.name: callbackContext

name: createGroupCallback
description:
Sets a callback to be fired any time this Body impacts with the given Group. The impact test is performed against shape.collisionGroup values.
The callback will be sent 4 parameters: This body, the body that impacted, the Shape in this body and the shape in the impacting body.
This callback will only fire if this Body has been assigned a collision group.
Note that the impact event happens after collision resolution, so it cannot be used to prevent a collision from happening.
It also happens mid-step. So do not destroy a Body during this callback, instead set safeDestroy to true so it will be killed on the next preUpdate.

params.description: The Group to send impact events for.
params.name: group

params.description: The callback to fire on impact. Set to null to clear a previously set callback.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context under which the callback will fire.
params.name: callbackContext

name: getCollisionMask
description: Gets the collision bitmask from the groups this body collides with.

returns.description: The bitmask.

name: updateCollisionMask
description: Updates the collisionMask.

params.description: An optional Shape. If not provided the collision group will be added to all Shapes in this Body.
params.name: shape

name: setCollisionGroup
description:
Sets the given CollisionGroup to be the collision group for all shapes in this Body, unless a shape is specified.
This also resets the collisionMask.

params.description: The Collision Group that this Bodies shapes will use.
params.name: group

params.description: An optional Shape. If not provided the collision group will be added to all Shapes in this Body.
params.name: shape

name: clearCollision
description: Clears the collision data from the shapes in this Body. Optionally clears Group and/or Mask.

params.description: Clear the collisionGroup value from the shape/s?
params.name: clearGroup

params.description: Clear the collisionMask value from the shape/s?
params.name: clearMask

params.description: An optional Shape. If not provided the collision data will be cleared from all Shapes in this Body.
params.name: shape

name: collides
description: Adds the given CollisionGroup, or array of CollisionGroups, to the list of groups that this body will collide with and updates the collision masks.

params.description: The Collision Group or Array of Collision Groups that this Bodies shapes will collide with.
params.name: group

params.description: Optional callback that will be triggered when this Body impacts with the given Group.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context under which the callback will be called.
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: An optional Shape. If not provided the collision mask will be added to all Shapes in this Body.
params.name: shape

name: adjustCenterOfMass
description: Moves the shape offsets so their center of mass becomes the body center of mass.

name: getVelocityAtPoint
description: Gets the velocity of a point in the body.

params.description: A vector to store the result in.
params.name: result

params.description: A world oriented vector, indicating the position of the point to get the velocity from.
params.name: relativePoint

returns.description: The result vector.

name: applyDamping
description: Apply damping, see http://code.google.com/p/bullet/issues/detail?id=74 for details.

params.description: Current time step.
params.name: dt

name: applyImpulse
description:
Apply impulse to a point relative to the body.
This could for example be a point on the Body surface. An impulse is a force added to a body during a short
period of time (impulse = force * time). Impulses will be added to Body.velocity and Body.angularVelocity.

params.description: The impulse vector to add, oriented in world space.
params.name: impulse

params.description: A point relative to the body in world space. If not given, it is set to zero and all of the impulse will be exerted on the center of mass.
params.name: worldX

params.description: A point relative to the body in world space. If not given, it is set to zero and all of the impulse will be exerted on the center of mass.
params.name: worldY

name: applyImpulseLocal
description:
Apply impulse to a point local to the body.
This could for example be a point on the Body surface. An impulse is a force added to a body during a short
period of time (impulse = force * time). Impulses will be added to Body.velocity and Body.angularVelocity.

params.description: The impulse vector to add, oriented in world space.
params.name: impulse

params.description: A local point on the body.
params.name: localX

params.description: A local point on the body.
params.name: localY

name: applyForce
description: Apply force to a world point. This could for example be a point on the RigidBody surface. Applying force this way will add to Body.force and Body.angularForce.

params.description: The force vector to add.
params.name: force

params.description: The world x point to apply the force on.
params.name: worldX

params.description: The world y point to apply the force on.
params.name: worldY

name: setZeroForce
description: Sets the force on the body to zero.

name: setZeroRotation
description: If this Body is dynamic then this will zero its angular velocity.

name: setZeroVelocity
description: If this Body is dynamic then this will zero its velocity on both axis.

name: setZeroDamping
description: Sets the Body damping and angularDamping to zero.

name: toLocalFrame
description: Transform a world point to local body frame.

params.description: The vector to store the result in.
params.name: out

params.description: The input world vector.
params.name: worldPoint

name: toWorldFrame
description: Transform a local point to world frame.

params.description: The vector to store the result in.
params.name: out

params.description: The input local vector.
params.name: localPoint

name: rotateLeft
description: This will rotate the Body by the given speed to the left (counter-clockwise).

params.description: The speed at which it should rotate.
params.name: speed

name: rotateRight
description: This will rotate the Body by the given speed to the left (clockwise).

params.description: The speed at which it should rotate.
params.name: speed

name: moveForward
description:
Moves the Body forwards based on its current angle and the given speed.
The speed is represented in pixels per second. So a value of 100 would move 100 pixels in 1 second (1000ms).

params.description: The speed at which it should move forwards.
params.name: speed

name: moveBackward
description:
Moves the Body backwards based on its current angle and the given speed.
The speed is represented in pixels per second. So a value of 100 would move 100 pixels in 1 second (1000ms).

params.description: The speed at which it should move backwards.
params.name: speed

name: thrust
description:
Applies a force to the Body that causes it to 'thrust' forwards, based on its current angle and the given speed.
The speed is represented in pixels per second. So a value of 100 would move 100 pixels in 1 second (1000ms).

params.description: The speed at which it should thrust.
params.name: speed

name: reverse
description:
Applies a force to the Body that causes it to 'thrust' backwards (in reverse), based on its current angle and the given speed.
The speed is represented in pixels per second. So a value of 100 would move 100 pixels in 1 second (1000ms).

params.description: The speed at which it should reverse.
params.name: speed

name: moveLeft
description:
If this Body is dynamic then this will move it to the left by setting its x velocity to the given speed.
The speed is represented in pixels per second. So a value of 100 would move 100 pixels in 1 second (1000ms).

params.description: The speed at which it should move to the left, in pixels per second.
params.name: speed

name: moveRight
description:
If this Body is dynamic then this will move it to the right by setting its x velocity to the given speed.
The speed is represented in pixels per second. So a value of 100 would move 100 pixels in 1 second (1000ms).

params.description: The speed at which it should move to the right, in pixels per second.
params.name: speed

name: moveUp
description:
If this Body is dynamic then this will move it up by setting its y velocity to the given speed.
The speed is represented in pixels per second. So a value of 100 would move 100 pixels in 1 second (1000ms).

params.description: The speed at which it should move up, in pixels per second.
params.name: speed

name: moveDown
description:
If this Body is dynamic then this will move it down by setting its y velocity to the given speed.
The speed is represented in pixels per second. So a value of 100 would move 100 pixels in 1 second (1000ms).

params.description: The speed at which it should move down, in pixels per second.
params.name: speed

name: preUpdate
description: Internal method. This is called directly before the sprites are sent to the renderer and after the update function has finished.

name: postUpdate
description: Internal method. This is called directly before the sprites are sent to the renderer and after the update function has finished.

name: reset
description: Resets the Body force, velocity (linear and angular) and rotation. Optionally resets damping and mass.

params.description: The new x position of the Body.
params.name: x

params.description: The new x position of the Body.
params.name: y

params.description: Resets the linear and angular damping.
params.name: resetDamping

params.description: Sets the Body mass back to 1.
params.name: resetMass

name: addToWorld
description: Adds this physics body to the world.

name: removeFromWorld
description: Removes this physics body from the world.

name: destroy
description: Destroys this Body and all references it holds to other objects.

name: clearShapes
description: Removes all Shapes from this Body.

name: addShape
description:
Add a shape to the body. You can pass a local transform when adding a shape, so that the shape gets an offset and an angle relative to the body center of mass.
Will automatically update the mass properties and bounding radius.
If this Body had a previously set Collision Group you will need to re-apply it to the new Shape this creates.

params.description: The shape to add to the body.
params.name: shape

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The shape that was added to the body.

name: addCircle
description: Adds a Circle shape to this Body. You can control the offset from the center of the body and the rotation.

params.description: The radius of this circle (in pixels)
params.name: radius

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The Circle shape that was added to the Body.

name: addRectangle
description: Adds a Rectangle shape to this Body. You can control the offset from the center of the body and the rotation.

params.description: The width of the rectangle in pixels.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the rectangle in pixels.
params.name: height

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The shape that was added to the Body.

name: addPlane
description: Adds a Plane shape to this Body. The plane is facing in the Y direction. You can control the offset from the center of the body and the rotation.

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The Plane shape that was added to the Body.

name: addParticle
description: Adds a Particle shape to this Body. You can control the offset from the center of the body and the rotation.

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The Particle shape that was added to the Body.

name: addLine
description:
Adds a Line shape to this Body.
The line shape is along the x direction, and stretches from [-length/2, 0] to [length/2,0].
You can control the offset from the center of the body and the rotation.

params.description: The length of this line (in pixels)
params.name: length

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The Line shape that was added to the Body.

name: addCapsule
description:
Adds a Capsule shape to this Body.
You can control the offset from the center of the body and the rotation.

params.description: The distance between the end points in pixels.
params.name: length

params.description: Radius of the capsule in pixels.
params.name: radius

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The Capsule shape that was added to the Body.

name: addPolygon
description:
Reads a polygon shape path, and assembles convex shapes from that and puts them at proper offset points. The shape must be simple and without holes.
This function expects the x.y values to be given in pixels. If you want to provide them at p2 world scales then call Body.data.fromPolygon directly.

params.description: An object containing the build options:
params.name: options

params.description: Set to true if you need optimal decomposition. Warning: very slow for polygons with more than 10 vertices.
params.name: options.optimalDecomp

params.description: Set to true if you already know that the path is not intersecting itself.
params.name: options.skipSimpleCheck

params.description: Set to a number (angle threshold value) to remove collinear points, or false to keep all points.
params.name: options.removeCollinearPoints

params.description:
An array of 2d vectors that form the convex or concave polygon.
                                      Either [[0,0], [0,1],...] or a flat array of numbers that will be interpreted as [x,y, x,y, ...],
                                      or the arguments passed can be flat x,y values e.g. `setPolygon(options, x,y, x,y, x,y, ...)` where `x` and `y` are numbers.
params.name: points

returns.description: True on success, else false.

name: removeShape
description: Remove a shape from the body. Will automatically update the mass properties and bounding radius.

params.description: The shape to remove from the body.
params.name: shape

returns.description: True if the shape was found and removed, else false.

name: setCircle
description:
Clears any previously set shapes. Then creates a new Circle shape and adds it to this Body.
If this Body had a previously set Collision Group you will need to re-apply it to the new Shape this creates.

params.description: The radius of this circle (in pixels)
params.name: radius

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

name: setRectangle
description:
Clears any previously set shapes. The creates a new Rectangle shape at the given size and offset, and adds it to this Body.
If you wish to create a Rectangle to match the size of a Sprite or Image see Body.setRectangleFromSprite.
If this Body had a previously set Collision Group you will need to re-apply it to the new Shape this creates.

params.description: The width of the rectangle in pixels.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the rectangle in pixels.
params.name: height

params.description: Local horizontal offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetX

params.description: Local vertical offset of the shape relative to the body center of mass.
params.name: offsetY

params.description: Local rotation of the shape relative to the body center of mass, specified in radians.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The Rectangle shape that was added to the Body.

name: setRectangleFromSprite
description:
Clears any previously set shapes.
Then creates a Rectangle shape sized to match the dimensions and orientation of the Sprite given.
If no Sprite is given it defaults to using the parent of this Body.
If this Body had a previously set Collision Group you will need to re-apply it to the new Shape this creates.

params.description: The Sprite on which the Rectangle will get its dimensions.
params.name: sprite

returns.description: The Rectangle shape that was added to the Body.

name: setMaterial
description:
Adds the given Material to all Shapes that belong to this Body.
If you only wish to apply it to a specific Shape in this Body then provide that as the 2nd parameter.

params.description: The Material that will be applied.
params.name: material

params.description: An optional Shape. If not provided the Material will be added to all Shapes in this Body.
params.name: shape

name: shapeChanged
description: Updates the debug draw if any body shapes change.

name: addPhaserPolygon
description:
Reads the shape data from a physics data file stored in the Game.Cache and adds it as a polygon to this Body.
The shape data format is based on the custom phaser export in.

params.description: The key of the Physics Data file as stored in Game.Cache.
params.name: key

params.description: The key of the object within the Physics data file that you wish to load the shape data from.
params.name: object

name: addFixture
description: Add a polygon fixture. This is used during #loadPolygon.

params.description: The data for the fixture. It contains: isSensor, filter (collision) and the actual polygon shapes.
params.name: fixtureData

returns.description: An array containing the generated shapes for the given polygon.

name: loadPolygon
description:
Reads the shape data from a physics data file stored in the Game.Cache and adds it as a polygon to this Body.

As well as reading the data from the Cache you can also pass `null` as the first argument and a
physics data object as the second. When doing this you must ensure the structure of the object is correct in advance.

For more details see the format of the Lime / Corona Physics Editor export.

params.description:
The key of the Physics Data file as stored in Game.Cache. Alternatively set to `null` and pass the
    data as the 2nd argument.
params.name: key

params.description:
The key of the object within the Physics data file that you wish to load the shape data from,
    or if key is null pass the actual physics data object itself as this parameter.
params.name: object

returns.description: True on success, else false.

name: updateSpriteTransform
description: Core update.

name: draw
description: Draws the P2 shapes to the Graphics object.

name: containsImageIndex
description: Returns true if and only if this image collection contains the given image index.

params.description: The image index to search for.
params.name: imageIndex

returns.description: True if this Image Collection contains the given index.

name: addImage
description: Add an image to this Image Collection.

params.description: The gid of the image in the Image Collection.
params.name: gid

params.description: The the key of the image in the Image Collection and in the cache.
params.name: image

name: containsPoint
description: Check if the given x and y world coordinates are within this Tile.

params.description: The x coordinate to test.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate to test.
params.name: y

returns.description: True if the coordinates are within this Tile, otherwise false.

name: intersects
description: Check for intersection with this tile.

params.description: The x axis in pixels.
params.name: x

params.description: The y axis in pixels.
params.name: y

params.description: The right point.
params.name: right

params.description: The bottom point.
params.name: bottom

name: setCollisionCallback
description:
Set a callback to be called when this tile is hit by an object.
The callback must true true for collision processing to take place.

params.description: Callback function.
params.name: callback

params.description: Callback will be called within this context.
params.name: context

name: destroy
description: Clean up memory.

name: setCollision
description: Sets the collision flags for each side of this tile and updates the interesting faces list.

params.description: Indicating collide with any object on the left.
params.name: left

params.description: Indicating collide with any object on the right.
params.name: right

params.description: Indicating collide with any object on the top.
params.name: up

params.description: Indicating collide with any object on the bottom.
params.name: down

name: resetCollision
description: Reset collision status flags.

name: isInteresting
description: Is this tile interesting?

params.description: If true will check any collides value.
params.name: collides

params.description: If true will check any face value.
params.name: faces

returns.description: True if the Tile is interesting, otherwise false.

name: copy
description: Copies the tile data and properties from the given tile to this tile.

params.description: The tile to copy from.
params.name: tile

name: create
description: Creates an empty map of the given dimensions and one blank layer. If layers already exist they are erased.

params.description: The name of the default layer of the map.
params.name: name

params.description: The width of the map in tiles.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the map in tiles.
params.name: height

params.description: The width of the tiles the map uses for calculations.
params.name: tileWidth

params.description: The height of the tiles the map uses for calculations.
params.name: tileHeight

params.description: Optional Group to add the layer to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.
params.name: group

returns.description: The TilemapLayer object. This is an extension of Phaser.Image and can be moved around the display list accordingly.

name: setTileSize
description: Sets the base tile size for the map.

params.description: The width of the tiles the map uses for calculations.
params.name: tileWidth

params.description: The height of the tiles the map uses for calculations.
params.name: tileHeight

name: addTilesetImage
description:
Adds an image to the map to be used as a tileset. A single map may use multiple tilesets.
Note that the tileset name can be found in the JSON file exported from Tiled, or in the Tiled editor.

params.description: The name of the tileset as specified in the map data.
params.name: tileset

params.description:
The key of the Phaser.Cache image used for this tileset.
    If `undefined` or `null` it will look for an image with a key matching the tileset parameter.
    You can also pass in a BitmapData which can be used instead of an Image.
params.name: key

params.description: The width of the tiles in the Tileset Image. If not given it will default to the map.tileWidth value, if that isn't set then 32.
params.name: tileWidth

params.description: The height of the tiles in the Tileset Image. If not given it will default to the map.tileHeight value, if that isn't set then 32.
params.name: tileHeight

params.description: The width of the tiles in the Tileset Image. If not given it will default to the map.tileWidth value.
params.name: tileMargin

params.description: The height of the tiles in the Tileset Image. If not given it will default to the map.tileHeight value.
params.name: tileSpacing

params.description: If adding multiple tilesets to a blank/dynamic map, specify the starting GID the set will use here.
params.name: gid

returns.description: Returns the Tileset object that was created or updated, or null if it failed.

name: createFromObjects
description:
Creates a Sprite for every object matching the given gid in the map data. You can optionally specify the group that the Sprite will be created in. If none is
given it will be created in the World. All properties from the map data objectgroup are copied across to the Sprite, so you can use this as an easy way to
configure Sprite properties from within the map editor. For example giving an object a property of alpha: 0.5 in the map editor will duplicate that when the
Sprite is created. You could also give it a value like: body.velocity.x: 100 to set it moving automatically.

params.description: The name of the Object Group to create Sprites from.
params.name: name

params.description: The layer array index value, or if a string is given the layer name within the map data.
params.name: gid

params.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.
params.name: key

params.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.
params.name: frame

params.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.
params.name: exists

params.description: The default autoCull state of the Sprite. Sprites that are autoCulled are culled from the camera if out of its range.
params.name: autoCull

params.description: Group to add the Sprite to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.
params.name: group

params.description: If you wish to create your own class, rather than Phaser.Sprite, pass the class here. Your class must extend Phaser.Sprite and have the same constructor parameters.
params.name: CustomClass

params.description: By default the Tiled map editor uses a bottom-left coordinate system. Phaser uses top-left. So most objects will appear too low down. This parameter moves them up by their height.
params.name: adjustY

name: createFromTiles
description:
Creates a Sprite for every object matching the given tile indexes in the map data.
You can specify the group that the Sprite will be created in. If none is given it will be created in the World.
You can optional specify if the tile will be replaced with another after the Sprite is created. This is useful if you want to lay down special
tiles in a level that are converted to Sprites, but want to replace the tile itself with a floor tile or similar once converted.

params.description: The tile index, or array of indexes, to create Sprites from.
params.name: tiles

params.description: The tile index, or array of indexes, to change a converted tile to. Set to `null` to not change.
params.name: replacements

params.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.
params.name: key

params.description: The layer to operate on.
params.name: layer

params.description: Group to add the Sprite to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.
params.name: group

params.description: An object that contains the default properties for your newly created Sprite. This object will be iterated and any matching Sprite property will be set.
params.name: properties

returns.description: The number of Sprites that were created.

name: createLayer
description:
Creates a new TilemapLayer object. By default TilemapLayers are fixed to the camera.
The `layer` parameter is important. If you've created your map in Tiled then you can get this by looking in Tiled and looking at the Layer name.
Or you can open the JSON file it exports and look at the layers[].name value. Either way it must match.
If you wish to create a blank layer to put your own tiles on then see Tilemap.createBlankLayer.

params.description: The layer array index value, or if a string is given the layer name, within the map data that this TilemapLayer represents.
params.name: layer

params.description: The rendered width of the layer, should never be wider than Game.width. If not given it will be set to Game.width.
params.name: width

params.description: The rendered height of the layer, should never be wider than Game.height. If not given it will be set to Game.height.
params.name: height

params.description: Optional Group to add the object to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.
params.name: group

returns.description: The TilemapLayer object. This is an extension of Phaser.Sprite and can be moved around the display list accordingly.

name: createBlankLayer
description: Creates a new and empty layer on this Tilemap. By default TilemapLayers are fixed to the camera.

params.description: The name of this layer. Must be unique within the map.
params.name: name

params.description: The width of the layer in tiles.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the layer in tiles.
params.name: height

params.description: The width of the tiles the layer uses for calculations.
params.name: tileWidth

params.description: The height of the tiles the layer uses for calculations.
params.name: tileHeight

params.description: Optional Group to add the layer to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.
params.name: group

returns.description: The TilemapLayer object. This is an extension of Phaser.Image and can be moved around the display list accordingly.

name: getIndex
description: Gets the layer index based on the layers name.

params.description: The local array to search.
params.name: location

params.description: The name of the array element to get.
params.name: name

returns.description: The index of the element in the array, or null if not found.

name: getLayerIndex
description: Gets the layer index based on its name.

params.description: The name of the layer to get.
params.name: name

returns.description: The index of the layer in this tilemap, or null if not found.

name: getTilesetIndex
description: Gets the tileset index based on its name.

params.description: The name of the tileset to get.
params.name: name

returns.description: The index of the tileset in this tilemap, or null if not found.

name: getImageIndex
description: Gets the image index based on its name.

params.description: The name of the image to get.
params.name: name

returns.description: The index of the image in this tilemap, or null if not found.

name: getObjectIndex
description: Gets the object index based on its name.

params.description: The name of the object to get.
params.name: name

returns.description: The index of the object in this tilemap, or null if not found.

name: setTileIndexCallback
description:
Sets a global collision callback for the given tile index within the layer. This will affect all tiles on this layer that have the same index.
If a callback is already set for the tile index it will be replaced. Set the callback to null to remove it.
If you want to set a callback for a tile at a specific location on the map then see setTileLocationCallback.

params.description: Either a single tile index, or an array of tile indexes to have a collision callback set for.
params.name: indexes

params.description: The callback that will be invoked when the tile is collided with.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context under which the callback is called.
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

name: setTileLocationCallback
description:
Sets a global collision callback for the given map location within the layer. This will affect all tiles on this layer found in the given area.
If a callback is already set for the tile index it will be replaced. Set the callback to null to remove it.
If you want to set a callback for a tile at a specific location on the map then see setTileLocationCallback.

params.description: X position of the top left of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)
params.name: x

params.description: Y position of the top left of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)
params.name: y

params.description: The width of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)
params.name: height

params.description: The callback that will be invoked when the tile is collided with.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context under which the callback is called.
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

name: setCollision
description:
Sets collision the given tile or tiles. You can pass in either a single numeric index or an array of indexes: [ 2, 3, 15, 20].
The `collides` parameter controls if collision will be enabled (true) or disabled (false).

params.description: Either a single tile index, or an array of tile IDs to be checked for collision.
params.name: indexes

params.description: If true it will enable collision. If false it will clear collision.
params.name: collides

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

params.description: Recalculates the tile faces after the update.
params.name: recalculate

name: setCollisionBetween
description:
Sets collision on a range of tiles where the tile IDs increment sequentially.
Calling this with a start value of 10 and a stop value of 14 would set collision for tiles 10, 11, 12, 13 and 14.
The `collides` parameter controls if collision will be enabled (true) or disabled (false).

params.description: The first index of the tile to be set for collision.
params.name: start

params.description: The last index of the tile to be set for collision.
params.name: stop

params.description: If true it will enable collision. If false it will clear collision.
params.name: collides

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

params.description: Recalculates the tile faces after the update.
params.name: recalculate

name: setCollisionByExclusion
description:
Sets collision on all tiles in the given layer, except for the IDs of those in the given array.
The `collides` parameter controls if collision will be enabled (true) or disabled (false).

params.description: An array of the tile IDs to not be counted for collision.
params.name: indexes

params.description: If true it will enable collision. If false it will clear collision.
params.name: collides

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

params.description: Recalculates the tile faces after the update.
params.name: recalculate

name: setCollisionByIndex
description:
Sets collision values on a tile in the set.
You shouldn't usually call this method directly, instead use setCollision, setCollisionBetween or setCollisionByExclusion.

params.description: The index of the tile on the layer.
params.name: index

params.description: If true it will enable collision on the tile. If false it will clear collision values from the tile.
params.name: collides

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

params.description: Recalculates the tile faces after the update.
params.name: recalculate

name: getLayer
description: Gets the TilemapLayer index as used in the setCollision calls.

params.description: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.
params.name: layer

returns.description: The TilemapLayer index.

name: setPreventRecalculate
description:
Turn off/on the recalculation of faces for tile or collision updates.
`setPreventRecalculate(true)` puts recalculation on hold while `setPreventRecalculate(false)` recalculates all the changed layers.

params.description: If true it will put the recalculation on hold.
params.name: value

name: searchTileIndex
description:
Searches the entire map layer for the first tile matching the given index, then returns that Phaser.Tile object.
If no match is found it returns null.
The search starts from the top-left tile and continues horizontally until it hits the end of the row, then it drops down to the next column.
If the reverse boolean is true, it scans starting from the bottom-right corner traveling up to the top-left.

params.description: The tile index value to search for.
params.name: index

params.description: The number of times to skip a matching tile before returning.
params.name: skip

params.description: If true it will scan the layer in reverse, starting at the bottom-right. Otherwise it scans from the top-left.
params.name: reverse

params.description: The layer to get the tile from.
params.name: layer

returns.description: The first (or n skipped) tile with the matching index.

params.description: If true getTile won't return null for empty tiles, but a Tile object with an index of -1.
params.name: nonNull

returns.description: The tile at the given coordinates or null if no tile was found or the coordinates were invalid.

name: destroy

Removes all layer data from this tile map and nulls the game reference.
Note: You are responsible for destroying any TilemapLayer objects you generated yourself, as Tilemap doesn't keep a reference to them.

name: preUpdate
description: Automatically called by World.preUpdate.

name: postUpdate
description: Automatically called by World.postUpdate. Handles cache updates.

name: resize
description:
Resizes the internal canvas and texture frame used by this TilemapLayer.

This is an expensive call, so don't bind it to a window resize event! But instead call it at carefully
selected times.

Be aware that no validation of the new sizes takes place and the current map scroll coordinates are not
modified either. You will have to handle both of these things from your game code if required.

params.description: The new width of the TilemapLayer
params.name: width

params.description: The new height of the TilemapLayer
params.name: height

The TilemapLayer caches tileset look-ups.

Call this method of clear the cache if tilesets have been added or updated after the layer has been rendered.

name: add
description: Adds a new Particle Emitter to the Particle Manager.

params.description: The emitter to be added to the particle manager.
params.name: emitter

returns.description: The emitter that was added.

name: remove
description: Removes an existing Particle Emitter from the Particle Manager.

params.description: The emitter to remove.
params.name: emitter

name: update
description: Called by the core game loop. Updates all Emitters who have their exists value set to true.

name: update
description: Called automatically by the game loop, decides when to launch particles and when to "die".

name: makeParticles
description:
This function generates a new set of particles for use by this emitter.
The particles are stored internally waiting to be emitted via Emitter.start.

params.description: A string or an array of strings that the particle sprites will use as their texture. If an array one is picked at random.
params.name: keys

params.description: A frame number, or array of frames that the sprite will use. If an array one is picked at random.
params.name: frames

params.description: The number of particles to generate. If not given it will use the value of Emitter.maxParticles. If the value is greater than Emitter.maxParticles it will use Emitter.maxParticles as the quantity.
params.name: quantity

params.description: If you want the particles to be able to collide with other Arcade Physics bodies then set this to true.
params.name: collide

params.description: A particle can be set to collide against the World bounds automatically and rebound back into the World if this is set to true. Otherwise it will leave the World.
params.name: collideWorldBounds

returns.description: This Emitter instance.

name: kill
description: Call this function to turn off all the particles and the emitter.

name: revive
description: Handy for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true.

name: explode
description: Call this function to emit the given quantity of particles at all once (an explosion)

params.description: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.
params.name: lifespan

params.description: How many particles to launch.
params.name: quantity

name: flow
description:
Call this function to start emitting a flow of particles at the given frequency.
It will carry on going until the total given is reached.
Each time the flow is run the quantity number of particles will be emitted together.
If you set the total to be 20 and quantity to be 5 then flow will emit 4 times in total (4 x 5 = 20 total)
If you set the total to be -1 then no quantity cap is used and it will keep emitting.

params.description: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.
params.name: lifespan

params.description: Frequency is how often to emit the particles, given in ms.
params.name: frequency

params.description: How many particles to launch each time the frequency is met. Can never be > Emitter.maxParticles.
params.name: quantity

params.description: How many particles to launch in total. If -1 it will carry on indefinitely.
params.name: total

params.description: Should the flow start immediately (true) or wait until the first frequency event? (false)
params.name: immediate

name: start
description: Call this function to start emitting particles.

params.description: Whether the particles should all burst out at once (true) or at the frequency given (false).
params.name: explode

params.description: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.
params.name: lifespan

params.description: Ignored if Explode is set to true. Frequency is how often to emit 1 particle. Value given in ms.
params.name: frequency

params.description: How many particles to launch. 0 = "all of the particles" which will keep emitting until Emitter.maxParticles is reached.
params.name: quantity

params.description: If `true` and creating a particle flow, the quantity emitted will be forced to the be quantity given in this call. This can never exceed Emitter.maxParticles.
params.name: forceQuantity

name: emitParticle
description: This function can be used both internally and externally to emit the next particle in the queue.

returns.description: True if a particle was emitted, otherwise false.

name: destroy
description: Destroys this Emitter, all associated child Particles and then removes itself from the Particle Manager.

name: setSize
description: A more compact way of setting the width and height of the emitter.

params.description: The desired width of the emitter (particles are spawned randomly within these dimensions).
params.name: width

params.description: The desired height of the emitter.
params.name: height

name: setXSpeed
description: A more compact way of setting the X velocity range of the emitter.

params.description: The minimum value for this range.
params.name: min

params.description: The maximum value for this range.
params.name: max

name: setYSpeed
description: A more compact way of setting the Y velocity range of the emitter.

params.description: The minimum value for this range.
params.name: min

params.description: The maximum value for this range.
params.name: max

name: setRotation
description: A more compact way of setting the angular velocity constraints of the particles.

params.description: The minimum value for this range.
params.name: min

params.description: The maximum value for this range.
params.name: max

name: setAlpha
description:
A more compact way of setting the alpha constraints of the particles.
The rate parameter, if set to a value above zero, lets you set the speed at which the Particle change in alpha from min to max.
If rate is zero, which is the default, the particle won't change alpha - instead it will pick a random alpha between min and max on emit.

params.description: The minimum value for this range.
params.name: min

params.description: The maximum value for this range.
params.name: max

params.description: The rate (in ms) at which the particles will change in alpha from min to max, or set to zero to pick a random alpha between the two.
params.name: rate

params.description: If you've set a rate > 0 this is the easing formula applied between the min and max values.
params.name: ease

params.description: If you've set a rate > 0 you can set if the ease will yoyo or not (i.e. ease back to its original values)
params.name: yoyo

name: setScale
description:
A more compact way of setting the scale constraints of the particles.
The rate parameter, if set to a value above zero, lets you set the speed and ease which the Particle uses to change in scale from min to max across both axis.
If rate is zero, which is the default, the particle won't change scale during update, instead it will pick a random scale between min and max on emit.

params.description: The minimum value of Particle.scale.x.
params.name: minX

params.description: The maximum value of Particle.scale.x.
params.name: maxX

params.description: The minimum value of Particle.scale.y.
params.name: minY

params.description: The maximum value of Particle.scale.y.
params.name: maxY

params.description: The rate (in ms) at which the particles will change in scale from min to max, or set to zero to pick a random size between the two.
params.name: rate

params.description: If you've set a rate > 0 this is the easing formula applied between the min and max values.
params.name: ease

params.description: If you've set a rate > 0 you can set if the ease will yoyo or not (i.e. ease back to its original values)
params.name: yoyo

name: at
description:
Change the emitters center to match the center of any object with a `center` property, such as a Sprite.
If the object doesn't have a center property it will be set to object.x + object.width / 2

params.description: The object that you wish to match the center with.
params.name: object

name: connectToMediaStream
description: Connects to an external media stream for the webcam, rather than using a local one.

params.description: The HTML Video Element that the stream uses.
params.name: video

params.description: The Video Stream data.
params.name: stream

returns.description: This Video object for method chaining.

name: startMediaStream
description:
Instead of playing a video file this method allows you to stream video data from an attached webcam.

As soon as this method is called the user will be prompted by their browser to "Allow" access to the webcam.
If they allow it the webcam feed is directed to this Video. Call `Video.play` to start the stream.

If they block the webcam the onError signal will be dispatched containing the NavigatorUserMediaError
or MediaStreamError event.

You can optionally set a width and height for the stream. If set the input will be cropped to these dimensions.
If not given then as soon as the stream has enough data the video dimensions will be changed to match the webcam device.
You can listen for this with the onChangeSource signal.

params.description: Controls if audio should be captured along with video in the video stream.
params.name: captureAudio

params.description: The width is used to create the video stream. If not provided the video width will be set to the width of the webcam input source.
params.name: width

params.description: The height is used to create the video stream. If not provided the video height will be set to the height of the webcam input source.
params.name: height

returns.description: This Video object for method chaining or false if the device doesn't support getUserMedia.

name: createVideoFromBlob
description:
Creates a new Video element from the given Blob. The Blob must contain the video data in the correct encoded format.
This method is typically called by the Phaser.Loader and Phaser.Cache for you, but is exposed publicly for convenience.

params.description: The Blob containing the video data: `Blob([new Uint8Array(data)])`
params.name: blob

returns.description: This Video object for method chaining.

name: createVideoFromURL
description: Creates a new Video element from the given URL.

params.description: The URL of the video.
params.name: url

params.description: Automatically start the video?
params.name: autoplay

returns.description: This Video object for method chaining.

name: updateTexture
description:
Called automatically if the video source changes and updates the internal texture dimensions.
Then dispatches the onChangeSource signal.

params.description: The event which triggered the texture update.
params.name: event

params.description: The new width of the video. If undefined `video.videoWidth` is used.
params.name: width

params.description: The new height of the video. If undefined `video.videoHeight` is used.
params.name: height

name: complete
description:
Called when the video completes playback (reaches and ended state).
Dispatches the Video.onComplete signal.

name: play
description: Starts this video playing if it's not already doing so.

params.description: Should the video loop automatically when it reaches the end? Please note that at present some browsers (i.e. Chrome) do not support *seamless* video looping.
params.name: loop

params.description: The playback rate of the video. 1 is normal speed, 2 is x2 speed, and so on. You cannot set a negative playback rate.
params.name: playbackRate

returns.description: This Video object for method chaining.

name: stop
description:
Stops the video playing.

This removes all locally set signals.

If you only wish to pause playback of the video, to resume at a later time, use `Video.paused = true` instead.
If the video hasn't finished downloading calling `Video.stop` will not abort the download. To do that you need to
call `Video.destroy` instead.

If you are using a video stream from a webcam then calling Stop will disconnect the MediaStream session and disable the webcam.

returns.description: This Video object for method chaining.

name: add
description:
Updates the given Display Objects so they use this Video as their texture.
This will replace any texture they will currently have set.

params.description: Either a single Sprite/Image or an Array of Sprites/Images.
params.name: object

returns.description: This Video object for method chaining.

name: addToWorld
description: Creates a new Phaser.Image object, assigns this Video to be its texture, adds it to the world then returns it.

params.description: The x coordinate to place the Image at.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate to place the Image at.
params.name: y

params.description: Set the x anchor point of the Image. A value between 0 and 1, where 0 is the top-left and 1 is bottom-right.
params.name: anchorX
