params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.
params.name: force

name: addAll
description:
Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this group.

`Group.addAll('x', 10)` will add 10 to the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: subAll
description:
Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this group.

`Group.subAll('x', 10)` will minus 10 from the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to decrement, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to subtract from the property. If child.x = 50 then subAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 10.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: multiplyAll
description:
Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this group.

`Group.multiplyAll('x', 2)` will x2 the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to multiply, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: divideAll
description:
Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this group.

`Group.divideAll('x', 2)` will half the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: callAllExists
description:
Calls a function, specified by name, on all children in the group who exist (or do not exist).

After the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

params.description: Name of the function on the children to call.
params.name: callback

params.description: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.
params.name: existsValue

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.
params.name: parameter

name: callbackFromArray
description: Returns a reference to a function that exists on a child of the group based on the given callback array.

params.description: The object to inspect.
params.name: child

params.description: The array of function names.
params.name: callback

params.description: The size of the array (pre-calculated in callAll).
params.name: length

name: callAll
description:
Calls a function, specified by name, on all on children.

The function is called for all children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists for different options).
After the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

params.description: Name of the function on the child to call. Deep property lookup is supported.
params.name: method

params.description: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.
params.name: context

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.
params.name: args

name: preUpdate
description: The core preUpdate - as called by World.

name: update
description: The core update - as called by World.

name: postUpdate
description: The core postUpdate - as called by World.

name: filter

params.description: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third
params.name: predicate

params.description: If true, only existing can be selected; otherwise all children can be selected and will be passed to the predicate.
params.name: checkExists

returns.description: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

name: forEach
description:
Call a function on each child in this group.

Additional arguments for the callback can be specified after the `checkExists` parameter. For example,

    Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)

would invoke `awardBonusGold` function with the parameters `(child, 100, 500)`.

Note: This check will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: If set only children matching for which `exists` is true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.
params.name: checkExists

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachExists
description:
Call a function on each existing child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachAlive
description:
Call a function on each alive child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachDead
description:
Call a function on each dead child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: sort
description:
Sort the children in the group according to a particular key and ordering.

Call this function to sort the group according to a particular key value and order.
For example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

params.description: The name of the property to sort on. Defaults to the objects z-depth value.
params.name: key

params.description: Order ascending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING SORT_ASCENDING}) or descending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING SORT_DESCENDING}).
params.name: order

name: customSort
description:
Sort the children in the group according to custom sort function.

The `sortHandler` is provided the two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b).
It should return -1 if `a > b`, 1 if `a < b` or 0 if `a === b`.

params.description: The custom sort function.
params.name: sortHandler

params.description: The context in which the sortHandler is called.
params.name: context

name: ascendingSortHandler
description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

params.description: The first object being sorted.
params.name: a

params.description: The second object being sorted.
params.name: b

name: descendingSortHandler
description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

params.description: The first object being sorted.
params.name: a

params.description: The second object being sorted.
params.name: b

name: iterate
description:
Iterates over the children of the group performing one of several actions for matched children.

A child is considered a match when it has a property, named `key`, whose value is equal to `value`
according to a strict equality comparison.

The result depends on the `returnType`:

- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL RETURN_TOTAL}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. The number of matched children is returned.
- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE RETURN_NONE}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. No value is returned.
- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD RETURN_CHILD}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to the *first* matching child and the *first* matched child is returned.
    If there is no matching child then null is returned.

If `args` is specified it must be an array. The matched child will be assigned to the first
element and the entire array will be applied to the callback function.

params.description: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'
params.name: key

params.description: A child matches if `child[key] === value` is true.
params.name: value

params.description: How to iterate the children and what to return.
params.name: returnType

params.description: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. The matched child is supplied as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: The arguments supplied to to the callback; the first array index (argument) will be replaced with the matched child.
params.name: args

returns.description: Returns either an integer (for RETURN_TOTAL), the first matched child (for RETURN_CHILD), or null.

name: getFirstExists
description: Get the first display object that exists, or doesn't exist.

params.description: If true, find the first existing child; otherwise find the first non-existing child.
params.name: exists

returns.description: The first child, or null if none found.

name: getFirstAlive
description:
Get the first child that is alive (`child.alive === true`).

This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first alive child, or null if none found.

name: getFirstDead
description:
Get the first child that is dead (`child.alive === false`).

This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first dead child, or null if none found.

name: getTop
description:
Return the child at the top of this group.

The top child is the child displayed (rendered) above every other child.

returns.description: The child at the top of the Group.

name: getBottom
description:
Returns the child at the bottom of this group.

The bottom child the child being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

returns.description: The child at the bottom of the Group.

name: countLiving
description: Get the number of living children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as alive.

name: countDead
description: Get the number of dead children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as dead.

name: getRandom
description: Returns a random child from the group.

params.description: Offset from the front of the front of the group (lowest child).
params.name: startIndex

params.description: Restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.
params.name: length

returns.description: A random child of this Group.

name: remove
description:
Removes the given child from this group.

This will dispatch an `onRemovedFromGroup` event from the child (if it has one), and optionally destroy the child.

If the group cursor was referring to the removed child it is updated to refer to the next child.

params.description: The child to remove.
params.name: child

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on the removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the the child will not dispatch the `onRemovedFromGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: true if the child was removed from this group, otherwise false.

name: moveAll
description: Moves all children from this Group to the Group given.

params.description: The new Group to which the children will be moved to.
params.name: group

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event for the new Group.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The Group to which all the children were moved.

name: removeAll
description: Removes all children from this group, but does not remove the group from its parent.

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.
params.name: silent

name: removeBetween
description: Removes all children from this group whose index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

params.description: The index to start removing children from.
params.name: startIndex

params.description: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the group.
params.name: endIndex

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.
params.name: silent

name: destroy
description:
Destroys this group.

Removes all children, then removes this group from its parent and nulls references.

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroyChildren

params.description: A 'soft destroy' (set to true) doesn't remove this group from its parent or null the game reference. Set to false and it does.
params.name: soft

name: preUpdate
description: Automatically called by World.preUpdate.

returns.description: True if the Sprite was rendered, otherwise false.

name: renderXY
description:
This function will draw the display object to the RenderTexture at the given coordinates.

When the display object is drawn it takes into account scale and rotation.

If you don't want those then use RenderTexture.renderRawXY instead.

params.description: The display object to render to this texture.
params.name: displayObject

params.description: The x position to render the object at.
params.name: x

params.description: The y position to render the object at.
params.name: y

params.description: If true the texture will be cleared before the display object is drawn.
params.name: clear

name: renderRawXY
description:
This function will draw the display object to the RenderTexture at the given coordinates.

When the display object is drawn it doesn't take into account scale, rotation or translation.

If you need those then use RenderTexture.renderXY instead.

params.description: The display object to render to this texture.
params.name: displayObject

params.description: The x position to render the object at.
params.name: x

params.description: The y position to render the object at.
params.name: y

params.description: If true the texture will be cleared before the display object is drawn.
params.name: clear

name: render
description:
This function will draw the display object to the RenderTexture.

In versions of Phaser prior to 2.4.0 the second parameter was a Phaser.Point object.
This is now a Matrix allowing you much more control over how the Display Object is rendered.
If you need to replicate the earlier behavior please use Phaser.RenderTexture.renderXY instead.

If you wish for the displayObject to be rendered taking its current scale, rotation and translation into account then either
pass `null`, leave it undefined or pass `displayObject.worldTransform` as the matrix value.

params.description: The display object to render to this texture.
params.name: displayObject

params.description: Optional matrix to apply to the display object before rendering. If null or undefined it will use the worldTransform matrix of the given display object.
params.name: matrix

params.description: If true the texture will be cleared before the display object is drawn.
params.name: clear

name: add
description:
Adds an existing object as the top child in this group.

The child is automatically added to the top of the group and is displayed on top of every previous child.

If Group.enableBody is set then a physics body will be created on the object, so long as one does not already exist.

Use {@link #addAt} to control where a child is added. Use {@link #create} to create and add a new child.

params.description: The display object to add as a child.
params.name: child

params.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

name: addToHash
description:
Adds a child of this Group into the hash array.
This call will return false if the child is not a child of this Group, or is already in the hash.

params.description: The display object to add to this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group already and not present in the hash.
params.name: child

returns.description: True if the child was successfully added to the hash, otherwise false.

name: removeFromHash
description:
Removes a child of this Group from the hash array.
This call will return false if the child is not in the hash.

params.description: The display object to remove from this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group and in the hash.
params.name: child

returns.description: True if the child was successfully removed from the hash, otherwise false.

name: addMultiple
description:
Adds an array of existing Display Objects to this Group.

The Display Objects are automatically added to the top of this Group, and will render on-top of everything already in this Group.

As well as an array you can also pass another Group as the first argument. In this case all of the children from that
Group will be removed from it and added into this Group.

params.description: An array of display objects or a Phaser.Group. If a Group is given then *all* children will be moved from it.
params.name: children

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The array of children or Group of children that were added to this Group.

name: addAt
description:
Adds an existing object to this group.

The child is added to the group at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.

params.description: The display object to add as a child.
params.name: child

params.description: The index within the group to insert the child to.
params.name: index

params.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

name: getAt
description: Returns the child found at the given index within this group.

params.description: The index to return the child from.
params.name: index

returns.description: The child that was found at the given index, or -1 for an invalid index.

name: create
description:
Creates a new Phaser.Sprite object and adds it to the top of this group.

Use {@link #classType} to change the type of object creaded.

params.description: The x coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the group.x point.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the group.y point.
params.name: y

params.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.
params.name: key

params.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.
params.name: frame

params.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.
params.name: exists

returns.description: The child that was created: will be a {@link Phaser.Sprite} unless {@link #classType} has been changed.

name: createMultiple
description:
Creates multiple Phaser.Sprite objects and adds them to the top of this group.

Useful if you need to quickly generate a pool of identical sprites, such as bullets.

By default the sprites will be set to not exist and will be positioned at 0, 0 (relative to the group.x/y).
Use {@link #classType} to change the type of object created.

params.description: The number of Sprites to create.
params.name: quantity

params.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.
params.name: key

params.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.
params.name: frame

params.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.
params.name: exists

name: updateZ
description:
Internal method that re-applies all of the children's Z values.

This must be called whenever children ordering is altered so that their `z` indices are correctly updated.

name: resetCursor
description:
Sets the group cursor to the first child in the group.

If the optional index parameter is given it sets the cursor to the object at that index instead.

params.description: Set the cursor to point to a specific index.
params.name: index

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: next
description:
Advances the group cursor to the next (higher) object in the group.

If the cursor is at the end of the group (top child) it is moved the start of the group (bottom child).

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: previous
description:
Moves the group cursor to the previous (lower) child in the group.

If the cursor is at the start of the group (bottom child) it is moved to the end (top child).

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: swap
description:
Swaps the position of two children in this group.

Both children must be in this group, a child cannot be swapped with itself, and unparented children cannot be swapped.

params.description: The first child to swap.
params.name: child1

params.description: The second child to swap.
params.name: child2

name: bringToTop
description: Brings the given child to the top of this group so it renders above all other children.

params.description: The child to bring to the top of this group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: sendToBack
description: Sends the given child to the bottom of this group so it renders below all other children.

params.description: The child to send to the bottom of this group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: moveUp
description: Moves the given child up one place in this group unless it's already at the top.

params.description: The child to move up in the group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: moveDown
description: Moves the given child down one place in this group unless it's already at the bottom.

params.description: The child to move down in the group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: xy
description: Positions the child found at the given index within this group to the given x and y coordinates.

params.description: The index of the child in the group to set the position of.
params.name: index

params.description: The new x position of the child.
params.name: x

params.description: The new y position of the child.
params.name: y

name: reverse
description:
Reverses all children in this group.

This operaation applies only to immediate children and does not propagate to subgroups.

name: getIndex
description: Get the index position of the given child in this group, which should match the child's `z` property.

params.description: The child to get the index for.
params.name: child

returns.description: The index of the child or -1 if it's not a member of this group.

name: replace
description: Replaces a child of this group with the given newChild. The newChild cannot be a member of this group.

params.description: The child in this group that will be replaced.
params.name: oldChild

params.description: The child to be inserted into this group.
params.name: newChild

returns.description: Returns the oldChild that was replaced within this group.

name: hasProperty
description:
Checks if the child has the given property.

Will scan up to 4 levels deep only.

params.description: The child to check for the existance of the property on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the child has the property, otherwise false.

name: setProperty
description:
Sets a property to the given value on the child. The operation parameter controls how the value is set.

The operations are:
- 0: set the existing value to the given value; if force is `true` a new property will be created if needed
- 1: will add the given value to the value already present.
- 2: will subtract the given value from the value already present.
- 3: will multiply the value already present by the given value.
- 4: will divide the value already present by the given value.

params.description: The child to set the property value on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was set, false if not.

name: checkProperty
description: Checks a property for the given value on the child.

params.description: The child to check the property value on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be checked.
params.name: value

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was was equal to value, false if not.

name: set
description:
Quickly set a property on a single child of this group to a new value.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The child to set the property on.
params.name: child

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then the child will only be updated if alive=true.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then the child will only be updated if visible=true.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was set, false if not.

name: setAll
description:
Quickly set the same property across all children of this group to a new value.

This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be set on the group but not its children.
If you need that ability please see `Group.setAllChildren`.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

name: setAllChildren
description:
Quickly set the same property across all children of this group, and any child Groups, to a new value.

If this group contains other Groups then the same property is set across their children as well, iterating down until it reaches the bottom.
Unlike with `setAll` the property is NOT set on child Groups itself.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

name: checkAll
description:
Quickly check that the same property across all children of this group is equal to the given value.

This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be checked on the group but not its children.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be checked.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.
params.name: force

name: addAll
description:
Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this group.

`Group.addAll('x', 10)` will add 10 to the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: subAll
description:
Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this group.

`Group.subAll('x', 10)` will minus 10 from the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to decrement, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to subtract from the property. If child.x = 50 then subAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 10.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: multiplyAll
description:
Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this group.

`Group.multiplyAll('x', 2)` will x2 the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to multiply, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: divideAll
description:
Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this group.

`Group.divideAll('x', 2)` will half the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: callAllExists
description:
Calls a function, specified by name, on all children in the group who exist (or do not exist).

After the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

params.description: Name of the function on the children to call.
params.name: callback

params.description: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.
params.name: existsValue

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.
params.name: parameter

name: callbackFromArray
description: Returns a reference to a function that exists on a child of the group based on the given callback array.

params.description: The object to inspect.
params.name: child

params.description: The array of function names.
params.name: callback

params.description: The size of the array (pre-calculated in callAll).
params.name: length

name: callAll
description:
Calls a function, specified by name, on all on children.

The function is called for all children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists for different options).
After the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

params.description: Name of the function on the child to call. Deep property lookup is supported.
params.name: method

params.description: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.
params.name: context

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.
params.name: args

name: preUpdate
description: The core preUpdate - as called by World.

name: update
description: The core update - as called by World.

name: postUpdate
description: The core postUpdate - as called by World.

name: filter

params.description: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third
params.name: predicate

params.description: If true, only existing can be selected; otherwise all children can be selected and will be passed to the predicate.
params.name: checkExists

returns.description: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

name: forEach
description:
Call a function on each child in this group.

Additional arguments for the callback can be specified after the `checkExists` parameter. For example,

    Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)

would invoke `awardBonusGold` function with the parameters `(child, 100, 500)`.

Note: This check will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: If set only children matching for which `exists` is true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.
params.name: checkExists

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachExists
description:
Call a function on each existing child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachAlive
description:
Call a function on each alive child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachDead
description:
Call a function on each dead child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: sort
description:
Sort the children in the group according to a particular key and ordering.

Call this function to sort the group according to a particular key value and order.
For example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

params.description: The name of the property to sort on. Defaults to the objects z-depth value.
params.name: key

params.description: Order ascending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING SORT_ASCENDING}) or descending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING SORT_DESCENDING}).
params.name: order

name: customSort
description:
Sort the children in the group according to custom sort function.

The `sortHandler` is provided the two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b).
It should return -1 if `a > b`, 1 if `a < b` or 0 if `a === b`.

params.description: The custom sort function.
params.name: sortHandler

params.description: The context in which the sortHandler is called.
params.name: context

name: ascendingSortHandler
description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

params.description: The first object being sorted.
params.name: a

params.description: The second object being sorted.
params.name: b

name: descendingSortHandler
description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

params.description: The first object being sorted.
params.name: a

params.description: The second object being sorted.
params.name: b

name: iterate
description:
Iterates over the children of the group performing one of several actions for matched children.

A child is considered a match when it has a property, named `key`, whose value is equal to `value`
according to a strict equality comparison.

The result depends on the `returnType`:

- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL RETURN_TOTAL}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. The number of matched children is returned.
- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE RETURN_NONE}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. No value is returned.
- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD RETURN_CHILD}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to the *first* matching child and the *first* matched child is returned.
    If there is no matching child then null is returned.

If `args` is specified it must be an array. The matched child will be assigned to the first
element and the entire array will be applied to the callback function.

params.description: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'
params.name: key

params.description: A child matches if `child[key] === value` is true.
params.name: value

params.description: How to iterate the children and what to return.
params.name: returnType

params.description: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. The matched child is supplied as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: The arguments supplied to to the callback; the first array index (argument) will be replaced with the matched child.
params.name: args

returns.description: Returns either an integer (for RETURN_TOTAL), the first matched child (for RETURN_CHILD), or null.

name: getFirstExists
description: Get the first display object that exists, or doesn't exist.

params.description: If true, find the first existing child; otherwise find the first non-existing child.
params.name: exists

returns.description: The first child, or null if none found.

name: getFirstAlive
description:
Get the first child that is alive (`child.alive === true`).

This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first alive child, or null if none found.

name: getFirstDead
description:
Get the first child that is dead (`child.alive === false`).

This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first dead child, or null if none found.

name: getTop
description:
Return the child at the top of this group.

The top child is the child displayed (rendered) above every other child.

returns.description: The child at the top of the Group.

name: getBottom
description:
Returns the child at the bottom of this group.

The bottom child the child being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

returns.description: The child at the bottom of the Group.

name: countLiving
description: Get the number of living children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as alive.

name: countDead
description: Get the number of dead children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as dead.

name: getRandom
description: Returns a random child from the group.

params.description: Offset from the front of the front of the group (lowest child).
params.name: startIndex

params.description: Restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.
params.name: length

returns.description: A random child of this Group.

name: remove
description:
Removes the given child from this group.

This will dispatch an `onRemovedFromGroup` event from the child (if it has one), and optionally destroy the child.

If the group cursor was referring to the removed child it is updated to refer to the next child.

params.description: The child to remove.
params.name: child

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on the removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the the child will not dispatch the `onRemovedFromGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: true if the child was removed from this group, otherwise false.

name: moveAll
description: Moves all children from this Group to the Group given.

params.description: The new Group to which the children will be moved to.
params.name: group

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event for the new Group.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The Group to which all the children were moved.

name: removeAll
description: Removes all children from this group, but does not remove the group from its parent.

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.
params.name: silent

name: removeBetween
description: Removes all children from this group whose index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

params.description: The index to start removing children from.
params.name: startIndex

params.description: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the group.
params.name: endIndex

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.
params.name: silent

name: destroy
description:
Destroys this group.

Removes all children, then removes this group from its parent and nulls references.

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroyChildren

params.description: A 'soft destroy' (set to true) doesn't remove this group from its parent or null the game reference. Set to false and it does.
params.name: soft

name: preUpdate
description: Automatically called by World.preUpdate.

returns.description: True if the Sprite was rendered, otherwise false.

name: add
description:
Adds an existing object as the top child in this group.

The child is automatically added to the top of the group and is displayed on top of every previous child.

If Group.enableBody is set then a physics body will be created on the object, so long as one does not already exist.

Use {@link #addAt} to control where a child is added. Use {@link #create} to create and add a new child.

params.description: The display object to add as a child.
params.name: child

params.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

name: addToHash
description:
Adds a child of this Group into the hash array.
This call will return false if the child is not a child of this Group, or is already in the hash.

params.description: The display object to add to this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group already and not present in the hash.
params.name: child

returns.description: True if the child was successfully added to the hash, otherwise false.

name: removeFromHash
description:
Removes a child of this Group from the hash array.
This call will return false if the child is not in the hash.

params.description: The display object to remove from this Groups hash. Must be a member of this Group and in the hash.
params.name: child

returns.description: True if the child was successfully removed from the hash, otherwise false.

name: addMultiple
description:
Adds an array of existing Display Objects to this Group.

The Display Objects are automatically added to the top of this Group, and will render on-top of everything already in this Group.

As well as an array you can also pass another Group as the first argument. In this case all of the children from that
Group will be removed from it and added into this Group.

params.description: An array of display objects or a Phaser.Group. If a Group is given then *all* children will be moved from it.
params.name: children

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The array of children or Group of children that were added to this Group.

name: addAt
description:
Adds an existing object to this group.

The child is added to the group at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.

params.description: The display object to add as a child.
params.name: child

params.description: The index within the group to insert the child to.
params.name: index

params.description: If true the child will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The child that was added to the group.

name: getAt
description: Returns the child found at the given index within this group.

params.description: The index to return the child from.
params.name: index

returns.description: The child that was found at the given index, or -1 for an invalid index.

name: create
description:
Creates a new Phaser.Sprite object and adds it to the top of this group.

Use {@link #classType} to change the type of object creaded.

params.description: The x coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the group.x point.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the group.y point.
params.name: y

params.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.
params.name: key

params.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.
params.name: frame

params.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.
params.name: exists

returns.description: The child that was created: will be a {@link Phaser.Sprite} unless {@link #classType} has been changed.

name: createMultiple
description:
Creates multiple Phaser.Sprite objects and adds them to the top of this group.

Useful if you need to quickly generate a pool of identical sprites, such as bullets.

By default the sprites will be set to not exist and will be positioned at 0, 0 (relative to the group.x/y).
Use {@link #classType} to change the type of object created.

params.description: The number of Sprites to create.
params.name: quantity

params.description: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.
params.name: key

params.description: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.
params.name: frame

params.description: The default exists state of the Sprite.
params.name: exists

name: updateZ
description:
Internal method that re-applies all of the children's Z values.

This must be called whenever children ordering is altered so that their `z` indices are correctly updated.

name: resetCursor
description:
Sets the group cursor to the first child in the group.

If the optional index parameter is given it sets the cursor to the object at that index instead.

params.description: Set the cursor to point to a specific index.
params.name: index

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: next
description:
Advances the group cursor to the next (higher) object in the group.

If the cursor is at the end of the group (top child) it is moved the start of the group (bottom child).

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: previous
description:
Moves the group cursor to the previous (lower) child in the group.

If the cursor is at the start of the group (bottom child) it is moved to the end (top child).

returns.description: The child the cursor now points to.

name: swap
description:
Swaps the position of two children in this group.

Both children must be in this group, a child cannot be swapped with itself, and unparented children cannot be swapped.

params.description: The first child to swap.
params.name: child1

params.description: The second child to swap.
params.name: child2

name: bringToTop
description: Brings the given child to the top of this group so it renders above all other children.

params.description: The child to bring to the top of this group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: sendToBack
description: Sends the given child to the bottom of this group so it renders below all other children.

params.description: The child to send to the bottom of this group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: moveUp
description: Moves the given child up one place in this group unless it's already at the top.

params.description: The child to move up in the group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: moveDown
description: Moves the given child down one place in this group unless it's already at the bottom.

params.description: The child to move down in the group.
params.name: child

returns.description: The child that was moved.

name: xy
description: Positions the child found at the given index within this group to the given x and y coordinates.

params.description: The index of the child in the group to set the position of.
params.name: index

params.description: The new x position of the child.
params.name: x

params.description: The new y position of the child.
params.name: y

name: reverse
description:
Reverses all children in this group.

This operaation applies only to immediate children and does not propagate to subgroups.

name: getIndex
description: Get the index position of the given child in this group, which should match the child's `z` property.

params.description: The child to get the index for.
params.name: child

returns.description: The index of the child or -1 if it's not a member of this group.

name: replace
description: Replaces a child of this group with the given newChild. The newChild cannot be a member of this group.

params.description: The child in this group that will be replaced.
params.name: oldChild

params.description: The child to be inserted into this group.
params.name: newChild

returns.description: Returns the oldChild that was replaced within this group.

name: hasProperty
description:
Checks if the child has the given property.

Will scan up to 4 levels deep only.

params.description: The child to check for the existance of the property on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the child has the property, otherwise false.

name: setProperty
description:
Sets a property to the given value on the child. The operation parameter controls how the value is set.

The operations are:
- 0: set the existing value to the given value; if force is `true` a new property will be created if needed
- 1: will add the given value to the value already present.
- 2: will subtract the given value from the value already present.
- 3: will multiply the value already present by the given value.
- 4: will divide the value already present by the given value.

params.description: The child to set the property value on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was set, false if not.

name: checkProperty
description: Checks a property for the given value on the child.

params.description: The child to check the property value on.
params.name: child

params.description: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be checked.
params.name: value

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was was equal to value, false if not.

name: set
description:
Quickly set a property on a single child of this group to a new value.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The child to set the property on.
params.name: child

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then the child will only be updated if alive=true.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then the child will only be updated if visible=true.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

returns.description: True if the property was set, false if not.

name: setAll
description:
Quickly set the same property across all children of this group to a new value.

This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be set on the group but not its children.
If you need that ability please see `Group.setAllChildren`.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

name: setAllChildren
description:
Quickly set the same property across all children of this group, and any child Groups, to a new value.

If this group contains other Groups then the same property is set across their children as well, iterating down until it reaches the bottom.
Unlike with `setAll` the property is NOT set on child Groups itself.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be set.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.
params.name: operation

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.
params.name: force

name: checkAll
description:
Quickly check that the same property across all children of this group is equal to the given value.

This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this group, the property will be checked on the group but not its children.

params.description: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'
params.name: key

params.description: The value that will be checked.
params.name: value

params.description: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.
params.name: checkVisible

params.description: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.
params.name: force

name: addAll
description:
Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this group.

`Group.addAll('x', 10)` will add 10 to the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: subAll
description:
Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this group.

`Group.subAll('x', 10)` will minus 10 from the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to decrement, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to subtract from the property. If child.x = 50 then subAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 10.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: multiplyAll
description:
Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this group.

`Group.multiplyAll('x', 2)` will x2 the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to multiply, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: divideAll
description:
Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this group.

`Group.divideAll('x', 2)` will half the child.x value for each child.

params.description: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.
params.name: property

params.description: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.
params.name: amount

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.
params.name: checkAlive

params.description: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.
params.name: checkVisible

name: callAllExists
description:
Calls a function, specified by name, on all children in the group who exist (or do not exist).

After the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

params.description: Name of the function on the children to call.
params.name: callback

params.description: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.
params.name: existsValue

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.
params.name: parameter

name: callbackFromArray
description: Returns a reference to a function that exists on a child of the group based on the given callback array.

params.description: The object to inspect.
params.name: child

params.description: The array of function names.
params.name: callback

params.description: The size of the array (pre-calculated in callAll).
params.name: length

name: callAll
description:
Calls a function, specified by name, on all on children.

The function is called for all children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists for different options).
After the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

params.description: Name of the function on the child to call. Deep property lookup is supported.
params.name: method

params.description: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.
params.name: context

params.description: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.
params.name: args

name: preUpdate
description: The core preUpdate - as called by World.

name: postUpdate
description: The core postUpdate - as called by World.

name: filter

params.description: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third
params.name: predicate

params.description: If true, only existing can be selected; otherwise all children can be selected and will be passed to the predicate.
params.name: checkExists

returns.description: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

name: forEach
description:
Call a function on each child in this group.

Additional arguments for the callback can be specified after the `checkExists` parameter. For example,

    Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)

would invoke `awardBonusGold` function with the parameters `(child, 100, 500)`.

Note: This check will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: If set only children matching for which `exists` is true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.
params.name: checkExists

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachExists
description:
Call a function on each existing child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachAlive
description:
Call a function on each alive child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: forEachDead
description:
Call a function on each dead child in this group.

See {@link Phaser.Group#forEach forEach} for details.

params.description: The function that will be called for each applicable child. The child will be passed as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the callback function, after the child item.
params.name: args

name: sort
description:
Sort the children in the group according to a particular key and ordering.

Call this function to sort the group according to a particular key value and order.
For example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

params.description: The name of the property to sort on. Defaults to the objects z-depth value.
params.name: key

params.description: Order ascending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING SORT_ASCENDING}) or descending ({@link Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING SORT_DESCENDING}).
params.name: order

name: customSort
description:
Sort the children in the group according to custom sort function.

The `sortHandler` is provided the two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b).
It should return -1 if `a > b`, 1 if `a < b` or 0 if `a === b`.

params.description: The custom sort function.
params.name: sortHandler

params.description: The context in which the sortHandler is called.
params.name: context

name: ascendingSortHandler
description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

params.description: The first object being sorted.
params.name: a

params.description: The second object being sorted.
params.name: b

name: descendingSortHandler
description: An internal helper function for the sort process.

params.description: The first object being sorted.
params.name: a

params.description: The second object being sorted.
params.name: b

name: iterate
description:
Iterates over the children of the group performing one of several actions for matched children.

A child is considered a match when it has a property, named `key`, whose value is equal to `value`
according to a strict equality comparison.

The result depends on the `returnType`:

- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL RETURN_TOTAL}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. The number of matched children is returned.
- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE RETURN_NONE}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to all matching children. No value is returned.
- {@link Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD RETURN_CHILD}:
    The callback, if any, is applied to the *first* matching child and the *first* matched child is returned.
    If there is no matching child then null is returned.

If `args` is specified it must be an array. The matched child will be assigned to the first
element and the entire array will be applied to the callback function.

params.description: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'
params.name: key

params.description: A child matches if `child[key] === value` is true.
params.name: value

params.description: How to iterate the children and what to return.
params.name: returnType

params.description: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. The matched child is supplied as the first argument.
params.name: callback

params.description: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').
params.name: callbackContext

params.description: The arguments supplied to to the callback; the first array index (argument) will be replaced with the matched child.
params.name: args

returns.description: Returns either an integer (for RETURN_TOTAL), the first matched child (for RETURN_CHILD), or null.

name: getFirstExists
description: Get the first display object that exists, or doesn't exist.

params.description: If true, find the first existing child; otherwise find the first non-existing child.
params.name: exists

returns.description: The first child, or null if none found.

name: getFirstAlive
description:
Get the first child that is alive (`child.alive === true`).

This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first alive child, or null if none found.

name: getFirstDead
description:
Get the first child that is dead (`child.alive === false`).

This is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

returns.description: The first dead child, or null if none found.

name: getTop
description:
Return the child at the top of this group.

The top child is the child displayed (rendered) above every other child.

returns.description: The child at the top of the Group.

name: getBottom
description:
Returns the child at the bottom of this group.

The bottom child the child being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

returns.description: The child at the bottom of the Group.

name: countLiving
description: Get the number of living children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as alive.

name: countDead
description: Get the number of dead children in this group.

returns.description: The number of children flagged as dead.

name: getRandom
description: Returns a random child from the group.

params.description: Offset from the front of the front of the group (lowest child).
params.name: startIndex

params.description: Restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.
params.name: length

returns.description: A random child of this Group.

name: remove
description:
Removes the given child from this group.

This will dispatch an `onRemovedFromGroup` event from the child (if it has one), and optionally destroy the child.

If the group cursor was referring to the removed child it is updated to refer to the next child.

params.description: The child to remove.
params.name: child

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on the removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the the child will not dispatch the `onRemovedFromGroup` event.
params.name: silent

returns.description: true if the child was removed from this group, otherwise false.

name: moveAll
description: Moves all children from this Group to the Group given.

params.description: The new Group to which the children will be moved to.
params.name: group

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch the `onAddedToGroup` event for the new Group.
params.name: silent

returns.description: The Group to which all the children were moved.

name: removeAll
description: Removes all children from this group, but does not remove the group from its parent.

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.
params.name: silent

name: removeBetween
description: Removes all children from this group whose index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

params.description: The index to start removing children from.
params.name: startIndex

params.description: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the group.
params.name: endIndex

params.description: If true `destroy` will be invoked on each removed child.
params.name: destroy

params.description: If true the children will not dispatch their `onRemovedFromGroup` events.
params.name: silent

name: ScaleManager
description:
The ScaleManager object handles the the scaling, resizing, and alignment of the
Game size and the game Display canvas.

The Game size is the logical size of the game; the Display canvas has size as an HTML element.

The calculations of these are heavily influenced by the bounding Parent size which is the computed
dimensions of the Display canvas's Parent container/element - the _effective CSS rules of the
canvas's Parent element play an important role_ in the operation of the ScaleManager.

The Display canvas - or Game size, depending {@link #scaleMode} - is updated to best utilize the Parent size.
When in Fullscreen mode or with {@link #parentIsWindow} the Parent size is that of the visual viewport (see {@link Phaser.ScaleManager#getParentBounds getParentBounds}).

Parent and Display canvas containment guidelines:

- Style the Parent element (of the game canvas) to control the Parent size and
  thus the Display canvas's size and layout.

- The Parent element's CSS styles should _effectively_ apply maximum (and minimum) bounding behavior.

- The Parent element should _not_ apply a padding as this is not accounted for.
  If a padding is required apply it to the Parent's parent or apply a margin to the Parent.
  If you need to add a border, margin or any other CSS around your game container, then use a parent element and
  apply the CSS to this instead, otherwise you'll be constantly resizing the shape of the game container.

- The Display canvas layout CSS styles (i.e. margins, size) should not be altered/specified as
  they may be updated by the ScaleManager.

name: Device
description:
Detects device support capabilities and is responsible for device intialization - see {@link Phaser.Device.whenReady whenReady}.

This class represents a singleton object that can be accessed directly as `game.device`
(or, as a fallback, `Phaser.Device` when a game instance is not available) without the need to instantiate it.

Unless otherwise noted the device capabilities are only guaranteed after initialization. Initialization
