occurs automatically and is guaranteed complete before {@link Phaser.Game} begins its "boot" phase.
Feature detection can be modified in the {@link Phaser.Device.onInitialized onInitialized} signal.

When checking features using the exposed properties only the *truth-iness* of the value should be relied upon
unless the documentation states otherwise: properties may return `false`, `''`, `null`, or even `undefined`
when indicating the lack of a feature.

Uses elements from System.js by MrDoob and Modernizr

name: AABB
description: Axis aligned bounding box type.

name: BOUNDING_CIRCLE
description: Bounding circle type.

name: CLOSEST
description: This raycasting mode will make the Ray traverse through all intersection points and only return the closest one.

name: ANY
description: This raycasting mode will make the Ray stop when it finds the first intersection point.

name: ALL
description: This raycasting mode will traverse all intersection points and executes a callback for each one.

name: DEFAULT_RELAXATION

name: NO_SLEEPING

name: BODY_SLEEPING

name: ISLAND_SLEEPING
description: Deactivates bodies that are in contact, if all of them are sleepy. Note that you must enable {{#crossLink "World/islandSplit:property"}}.islandSplit{{/crossLink}} for this to work.

description:
If the browser isn't capable of handling tinting with alpha this will be false.
This property is only applicable if using tintWithPerPixel.

name: canUseMultiply
description: Whether or not the Canvas BlendModes are supported, consequently the ability to tint using the multiply method.

name: roundPixels
description:
If true Pixi will Math.floor() x/y values when rendering, stopping pixel interpolation.
Handy for crisp pixel art and speed on legacy devices.

name: TextureSilentFail
description:
TextureSilentFail is a boolean that defaults to `false`.
If `true` then `PIXI.Texture.setFrame` will no longer throw an error if the texture dimensions are incorrect.
Instead `Texture.valid` will be set to `false` (#1556)

name: onInitialized
description:
This signal is dispatched after device initialization occurs but before any of the ready
callbacks (see {@link Phaser.Device.whenReady whenReady}) have been invoked.

Local "patching" for a particular device can/should be done in this event.

_Note_: This signal is removed after the device has been readied; if a handler has not been
added _before_ `new Phaser.Game(..)` it is probably too late.

name: visualBounds
description:
The bounds of the Visual viewport, as discussed in
{@link http://www.quirksmode.org/mobile/viewports.html A tale of two viewports — part one}
with one difference: the viewport size _excludes_ scrollbars, as found on some desktop browsers.

Supported mobile:
  iOS/Safari, Android 4, IE10, Firefox OS (maybe not Firefox Android), Opera Mobile 16

The properties change dynamically.

properties.description: Scroll, left offset - eg. "scrollX"
properties.name: x

properties.description: Scroll, top offset - eg. "scrollY"
properties.name: y

properties.description: Viewport width in pixels.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Viewport height in pixels.
properties.name: height

name: layoutBounds
description:
The bounds of the Layout viewport, as discussed in
{@link http://www.quirksmode.org/mobile/viewports2.html A tale of two viewports — part two};
but honoring the constraints as specified applicable viewport meta-tag.

The bounds returned are not guaranteed to be fully aligned with CSS media queries (see
{@link http://www.matanich.com/2013/01/07/viewport-size/ What size is my viewport?}).

This is _not_ representative of the Visual bounds: in particular the non-primary axis will
generally be significantly larger than the screen height on mobile devices when running with a
constrained viewport.

The properties change dynamically.

properties.description: Viewport width in pixels.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Viewport height in pixels.
properties.name: height

name: documentBounds
description:
The size of the document / Layout viewport.

This incorrectly reports the dimensions in IE.

The properties change dynamically.

properties.description: Document width in pixels.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Document height in pixels.
properties.name: height

The DEFAULT scale mode affects the default scaling mode of future operations.
It can be re-assigned to either LINEAR or NEAREST, depending upon suitability.

name: Component.BringToTop#bringToTop
description:
Brings this Game Object to the top of its parents display list.
Visually this means it will render over the top of any old child in the same Group.

If this Game Object hasn't been added to a custom Group then this method will bring it to the top of the Game World,
because the World is the root Group from which all Game Objects descend.

returns.description: This instance.

name: Component.BringToTop#sendToBack
description:
Sends this Game Object to the bottom of its parents display list.
Visually this means it will render below all other children in the same Group.

If this Game Object hasn't been added to a custom Group then this method will send it to the bottom of the Game World,
because the World is the root Group from which all Game Objects descend.

returns.description: This instance.

name: Component.BringToTop#moveUp
description:
Moves this Game Object up one place in its parents display list.
This call has no effect if the Game Object is already at the top of the display list.

If this Game Object hasn't been added to a custom Group then this method will move it one object up within the Game World,
because the World is the root Group from which all Game Objects descend.

returns.description: This instance.

name: Component.BringToTop#moveDown
description:
Moves this Game Object down one place in its parents display list.
This call has no effect if the Game Object is already at the bottom of the display list.

If this Game Object hasn't been added to a custom Group then this method will move it one object down within the Game World,
because the World is the root Group from which all Game Objects descend.

returns.description: This instance.

description:
Installs / registers mixin components.

The `this` context should be that of the applicable object instance or prototype.

name: Component.Core.init
description:
Initializes the mixin components.

The `this` context should be an instance of the component mixin target.

name: Component.Reset#reset
description:
Resets the Game Object.

This moves the Game Object to the given x/y world coordinates and sets `fresh`, `exists`,
`visible` and `renderable` to true.

If this Game Object has the LifeSpan component it will also set `alive` to true and `health` to the given value.

If this Game Object has a Physics Body it will reset the Body.

params.description: The x coordinate (in world space) to position the Game Object at.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate (in world space) to position the Game Object at.
params.name: y

params.description: The health to give the Game Object if it has the Health component.
params.name: health

returns.description: This instance.

params.description: The skew y value.
params.name: skewY

returns.description: A JavaScript object containing all of the properties BitmapData needs for transforms.

name: Device.whenReady
description:
Add a device-ready handler and ensure the device ready sequence is started.

Phaser.Device will _not_ activate or initialize until at least one `whenReady` handler is added,
which is normally done automatically be calling `new Phaser.Game(..)`.

The handler is invoked when the device is considered "ready", which may be immediately
if the device is already "ready". See {@link Phaser.Device#deviceReadyAt deviceReadyAt}.

params.description: Callback to invoke when the device is ready. It is invoked with the given context the Phaser.Device object is supplied as the first argument.
params.name: handler

params.description: Context in which to invoke the handler
params.name: context

params.description: If true the device ready check will not be started.
params.name: nonPrimer

name: getOffset
description:
Get the [absolute] position of the element relative to the Document.

The value may vary slightly as the page is scrolled due to rounding errors.

params.description: The targeted element that we want to retrieve the offset.
params.name: element

params.description: The point we want to take the x/y values of the offset.
params.name: point

returns.description: - A point objet with the offsetX and Y as its properties.

name: getBounds
description:
A cross-browser element.getBoundingClientRect method with optional cushion.

Returns a plain object containing the properties `top/bottom/left/right/width/height` with respect to the top-left corner of the current viewport.
Its properties match the native rectangle.
The cushion parameter is an amount of pixels (+/-) to cushion the element.
It adjusts the measurements such that it is possible to detect when an element is near the viewport.

params.description: The element or stack (uses first item) to get the bounds for.
params.name: element

params.description: A +/- pixel adjustment amount.
params.name: cushion

returns.description: A plain object containing the properties `top/bottom/left/right/width/height` or `false` if a non-valid element is given.

name: getAspectRatio
description: Get the Visual viewport aspect ratio (or the aspect ratio of an object or element)

params.description: The object to determine the aspect ratio for. Must have public `width` and `height` properties or methods.
params.name: object

returns.description: The aspect ratio.

name: inLayoutViewport
description:
Tests if the given DOM element is within the Layout viewport.

The optional cushion parameter allows you to specify a distance.

inLayoutViewport(element, 100) is `true` if the element is in the viewport or 100px near it.
inLayoutViewport(element, -100) is `true` if the element is in the viewport or at least 100px near it.

params.description: The DOM element to check. If no element is given it defaults to the Phaser game canvas.
params.name: element

params.description: The cushion allows you to specify a distance within which the element must be within the viewport.
params.name: cushion

returns.description: True if the element is within the viewport, or within `cushion` distance from it.

name: getScreenOrientation
description:
Returns the device screen orientation.

Orientation values: 'portrait-primary', 'landscape-primary', 'portrait-secondary', 'landscape-secondary'.

Order of resolving:
- Screen Orientation API, or variation of - Future track. Most desktop and mobile browsers.
- Screen size ratio check - If fallback is 'screen', suited for desktops.
- Viewport size ratio check - If fallback is 'viewport', suited for mobile.
- window.orientation - If fallback is 'window.orientation', works iOS and probably most Android; non-recommended track.
- Media query
- Viewport size ratio check (probably only IE9 and legacy mobile gets here..)

See
- https://w3c.github.io/screen-orientation/ (conflicts with mozOrientation/msOrientation)
- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen.orientation (mozOrientation)
- http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/dn342934(v=vs.85).aspx
- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/CSS/Testing_media_queries
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4917664/detect-viewport-orientation
- http://www.matthewgifford.com/blog/2011/12/22/a-misconception-about-window-orientation

params.description: Specify 'screen', 'viewport', or 'window.orientation'.
params.name: primaryFallback

name: create
description: Creates a `canvas` DOM element. The element is not automatically added to the document.

params.description: The width of the canvas element.
params.name: width

params.description: The height of the canvas element..
params.name: height

params.description: If specified, and not the empty string, this will be set as the ID of the canvas element. Otherwise no ID will be set.
params.name: id

returns.description: The newly created canvas element.

name: setBackgroundColor
description: Sets the background color behind the canvas. This changes the canvas style property.

params.description: The canvas to set the background color on.
params.name: canvas

params.description: The color to set. Can be in the format 'rgb(r,g,b)', or '#RRGGBB' or any valid CSS color.
params.name: color

returns.description: Returns the source canvas.

name: setTouchAction
description: Sets the touch-action property on the canvas style. Can be used to disable default browser touch actions.

params.description: The canvas to set the touch action on.
params.name: canvas

params.description: The touch action to set. Defaults to 'none'.
params.name: value

returns.description: The source canvas.

name: setUserSelect
description: Sets the user-select property on the canvas style. Can be used to disable default browser selection actions.

params.description: The canvas to set the touch action on.
params.name: canvas

params.description: The touch action to set. Defaults to 'none'.
params.name: value

returns.description: The source canvas.

name: addToDOM
description:
Adds the given canvas element to the DOM. The canvas will be added as a child of the given parent.
If no parent is given it will be added as a child of the document.body.

params.description: The canvas to be added to the DOM.
params.name: canvas

params.description: The DOM element to add the canvas to.
params.name: parent

params.description: If set to true it will add the overflow='hidden' style to the parent DOM element.
params.name: overflowHidden

returns.description: Returns the source canvas.

name: removeFromDOM
description: Removes the given canvas element from the DOM.

params.description: The canvas to be removed from the DOM.
params.name: canvas

name: setTransform
description: Sets the transform of the given canvas to the matrix values provided.

params.description: The context to set the transform on.
params.name: context

params.description: The value to translate horizontally by.
params.name: translateX

params.description: The value to translate vertically by.
params.name: translateY

params.description: The value to scale horizontally by.
params.name: scaleX

params.description: The value to scale vertically by.
params.name: scaleY

params.description: The value to skew horizontaly by.
params.name: skewX

params.description: The value to skew vertically by.
params.name: skewY

returns.description: Returns the source context.

name: setSmoothingEnabled
description:
Sets the Image Smoothing property on the given context. Set to false to disable image smoothing.
By default browsers have image smoothing enabled, which isn't always what you visually want, especially
when using pixel art in a game. Note that this sets the property on the context itself, so that any image
drawn to the context will be affected. This sets the property across all current browsers but support is
patchy on earlier browsers, especially on mobile.

params.description: The context to enable or disable the image smoothing on.
params.name: context

params.description: If set to true it will enable image smoothing, false will disable it.
params.name: value

returns.description: Returns the source context.

name: getSmoothingEnabled
description: Returns `true` if the given context has image smoothing enabled, otherwise returns `false`.

params.description: The context to check for smoothing on.
params.name: context

returns.description: True if the given context has image smoothing enabled, otherwise false.

name: setImageRenderingCrisp
description:
Sets the CSS image-rendering property on the given canvas to be 'crisp' (aka 'optimize contrast' on webkit).
Note that if this doesn't given the desired result then see the setSmoothingEnabled.

params.description: The canvas to set image-rendering crisp on.
params.name: canvas

returns.description: Returns the source canvas.

name: setImageRenderingBicubic
description:
Sets the CSS image-rendering property on the given canvas to be 'bicubic' (aka 'auto').
Note that if this doesn't given the desired result then see the CanvasUtils.setSmoothingEnabled method.

params.description: The canvas to set image-rendering bicubic on.
params.name: canvas

returns.description: Returns the source canvas.

name: generateFrameNames

params.description: The start of the filename. If the filename was 'explosion_0001-large' the prefix would be 'explosion_'.
params.name: prefix

params.description: The number to start sequentially counting from. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' the start is 1.
params.name: start

params.description: The number to count to. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' the stop value is 34.
params.name: stop

params.description: The end of the filename. If the filename was 'explosion_0001-large' the prefix would be '-large'.
params.name: suffix

params.description: The number of zeroes to pad the min and max values with. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' then the zeroPad is 4.
params.name: zeroPad

returns.description: An array of framenames.

name: spriteSheet
description: Parse a Sprite Sheet and extract the animation frame data from it.

params.description: A reference to the currently running game.

params.description: The Game.Cache asset key of the Sprite Sheet image or an actual HTML Image element.
params.name: key

params.name: frameWidth

params.description: The fixed height of each frame of the animation.
params.name: frameHeight

params.description: The total number of animation frames to extract from the Sprite Sheet. The default value of -1 means "extract all frames".
params.name: frameMax

params.description: If the frames have been drawn with a margin, specify the amount here.
params.name: margin

params.description: If the frames have been drawn with spacing between them, specify the amount here.
params.name: spacing

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

name: JSONData
description: Parse the JSON data and extract the animation frame data from it.

params.description: A reference to the currently running game.
params.name: game

params.description: The JSON data from the Texture Atlas. Must be in Array format.
params.name: json

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

name: JSONDataHash
description: Parse the JSON data and extract the animation frame data from it.

params.description: A reference to the currently running game.
params.name: game

params.description: The JSON data from the Texture Atlas. Must be in JSON Hash format.
params.name: json

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

name: XMLData
description: Parse the XML data and extract the animation frame data from it.

params.description: A reference to the currently running game.
params.name: game

params.description: The XML data from the Texture Atlas. Must be in Starling XML format.
params.name: xml

returns.description: A FrameData object containing the parsed frames.

name: bitmapFont
description: Alias for xmlBitmapFont, for backwards compatibility.

params.name: xml

params.description: The BaseTexture this font uses.
params.name: baseTexture

params.description: Additional horizontal spacing between the characters.
params.name: xSpacing

params.description: Additional vertical spacing between the characters.

description: Parse a Bitmap Font from an XML file.

name: getRandomItem
description:
Fetch a random entry from the given array.

Will return null if there are no array items that fall within the specified range
or if there is no item for the randomly choosen index.

params.description: An array of objects.
params.name: objects

params.description: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.
params.name: startIndex

params.description: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.
params.name: length

returns.description: The random object that was selected.

name: removeRandomItem
description:
Removes a random object from the given array and returns it.

Will return null if there are no array items that fall within the specified range
or if there is no item for the randomly choosen index.

params.description: An array of objects.
params.name: objects

params.description: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.
params.name: startIndex

params.description: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.
params.name: length

returns.description: The random object that was removed.

name: shuffle
description: A standard Fisher-Yates Array shuffle implementation which modifies the array in place.

params.description: The array to shuffle.
params.name: array

returns.description: The original array, now shuffled.

name: transposeMatrix
description: Transposes the elements of the given matrix (array of arrays).

params.description: The matrix to transpose.
params.name: array

returns.description: A new transposed matrix

name: rotateMatrix
description:
Rotates the given matrix (array of arrays).

Based on the routine from {@link http://jsfiddle.net/MrPolywhirl/NH42z/}.

params.description: The array to rotate; this matrix _may_ be altered.
params.name: matrix

params.description: The amount to rotate: the roation in degrees (90, -90, 270, -270, 180) or a string command ('rotateLeft', 'rotateRight' or 'rotate180').
params.name: direction

returns.description: The rotated matrix. The source matrix should be discarded for the returned matrix.

name: findClosest
description:
Snaps a value to the nearest value in an array.
The result will always be in the range `[first_value, last_value]`.

params.description: The search value
params.name: value

params.description: The input array which _must_ be sorted.
params.name: arr

returns.description: The nearest value found.

name: rotate
description:
Moves the element from the start of the array to the end, shifting all items in the process.
The "rotation" happens to the left.

params.description: The array to shift/rotate. The array is modified.
params.name: array

returns.description: The shifted value.

name: packPixel
description:
Packs the r, g, b, a components into a single integer, for use with Int32Array.
If device is little endian then ABGR order is used. Otherwise RGBA order is used.

params.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: r

params.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: g

params.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: b

params.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: a

returns.description: The packed color as uint32

author: Matt DesLauriers (@mattdesl)

name: unpackPixel
description:
Unpacks the r, g, b, a components into the specified color object, or a new
object, for use with Int32Array. If little endian, then ABGR order is used when
unpacking, otherwise, RGBA order is used. The resulting color object has the
`r, g, b, a` properties which are unrelated to endianness.

Note that the integer is assumed to be packed in the correct endianness. On little-endian
the format is 0xAABBGGRR and on big-endian the format is 0xRRGGBBAA. If you want a
endian-independent method, use fromRGBA(rgba) and toRGBA(r, g, b, a).

params.description: The integer, packed in endian order by packPixel.
params.name: rgba

params.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.
params.name: out

params.description: Also convert the rgb values into hsl?
params.name: hsl

params.description: Also convert the rgb values into hsv?
params.name: hsv

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

author: Matt DesLauriers (@mattdesl)

name: fromRGBA
description:
A utility to convert an integer in 0xRRGGBBAA format to a color object.
This does not rely on endianness.

params.description: An RGBA hex
params.name: rgba

params.description: The object to use, optional.
params.name: out

returns.description: A color object.

author: Matt DesLauriers (@mattdesl)

name: toRGBA
description: A utility to convert RGBA components to a 32 bit integer in RRGGBBAA format.

params.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: r

params.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: g

params.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: b

params.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: a

returns.description: A RGBA-packed 32 bit integer

author: Matt DesLauriers (@mattdesl)

name: RGBtoHSL
description:
Converts an RGB color value to HSL (hue, saturation and lightness).
Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.
Assumes RGB values are contained in the set [0, 255] and returns h, s and l in the set [0, 1].
Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

params.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: r

params.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: g

params.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: b

params.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created, h, s and l. If not provided a new object will be created.
params.name: out

returns.description: An object with the hue, saturation and lightness values set in the h, s and l properties.

name: HSLtoRGB
description:
Converts an HSL (hue, saturation and lightness) color value to RGB.
Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.
Assumes HSL values are contained in the set [0, 1] and returns r, g and b values in the set [0, 255].
Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

params.description: The hue, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: h

params.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: s

params.description: The lightness, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: l

params.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.
params.name: out

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

name: RGBtoHSV
description:
Converts an RGB color value to HSV (hue, saturation and value).
Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.
Assumes RGB values are contained in the set [0, 255] and returns h, s and v in the set [0, 1].
Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

params.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: r

params.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: g

params.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: b

params.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created, h, s and v. If not provided a new object will be created.
params.name: out

returns.description: An object with the hue, saturation and value set in the h, s and v properties.

name: HSVtoRGB
description:
Converts an HSV (hue, saturation and value) color value to RGB.
Conversion forumla from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_color_space.
Assumes HSV values are contained in the set [0, 1] and returns r, g and b values in the set [0, 255].
Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

params.description: The hue, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: h

params.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: s

params.description: The value, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: v

params.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.
params.name: out

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

name: hueToColor
description:
Converts a hue to an RGB color.
Based on code by Michael Jackson (https://github.com/mjijackson)

returns.description: The color component value.

name: createColor
description:
A utility function to create a lightweight 'color' object with the default components.
Any components that are not specified will default to zero.

This is useful when you want to use a shared color object for the getPixel and getPixelAt methods.

params.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: r

params.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: g

params.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: b

params.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: a

params.description: The hue, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: h

params.description: The saturation, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: s

params.description: The lightness, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: l

params.description: The value, in the range 0 - 1.
params.name: v

returns.description: The resulting object with r, g, b, a properties and h, s, l and v.

author: Matt DesLauriers (@mattdesl)

name: updateColor
description: Takes a color object and updates the rgba property.

params.description: The color object to update.
params.name: out

returns.description: A native color value integer (format: 0xAARRGGBB).

name: getColor32
description: Given an alpha and 3 color values this will return an integer representation of it.

params.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: r

params.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: g

params.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: A native color value integer (format: 0xAARRGGBB).

name: getColor
description: Given 3 color values this will return an integer representation of it.

params.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: r

params.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: g

params.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: A native color value integer (format: 0xRRGGBB).

name: RGBtoString
description:
Converts the given color values into a string.
If prefix was '#' it will be in the format `#RRGGBB` otherwise `0xAARRGGBB`.

params.description: The red color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: r

params.description: The green color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: g

params.description: The blue color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: b

params.description: The alpha color component, in the range 0 - 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The prefix used in the return string. If '#' it will return `#RRGGBB`, else `0xAARRGGBB`.
params.name: prefix

returns.description: A string containing the color values. If prefix was '#' it will be in the format `#RRGGBB` otherwise `0xAARRGGBB`.

name: hexToRGB
description: Converts a hex string into an integer color value.

params.description: The hex string to convert. Can be in the short-hand format `#03f` or `#0033ff`.
params.name: hex

returns.description: The rgb color value in the format 0xAARRGGBB.

name: hexToColor
description:
Converts a hex string into a Phaser Color object.

The hex string can supplied as `'#0033ff'` or the short-hand format of `'#03f'`; it can begin with an optional "#" or "0x", or be unprefixed.

An alpha channel is _not_ supported.

params.description: The color string in a hex format.
params.name: hex

params.description: An object into which 3 properties will be created or set: r, g and b. If not provided a new object will be created.
params.name: out

returns.description: An object with the red, green and blue values set in the r, g and b properties.

name: webToColor
description:
Converts a CSS 'web' string into a Phaser Color object.

The web string can be in the format `'rgb(r,g,b)'` or `'rgba(r,g,b,a)'` where r/g/b are in the range [0..255] and a is in the range [0..1].

params.description: The color string in CSS 'web' format.
params.name: web

params.description: An object into which 4 properties will be created: r, g, b and a. If not provided a new object will be created.
params.name: out

returns.description: An object with the red, green, blue and alpha values set in the r, g, b and a properties.

name: valueToColor
description:
Converts a value - a "hex" string, a "CSS 'web' string", or a number - into red, green, blue, and alpha components.

The value can be a string (see `hexToColor` and `webToColor` for the supported formats) or a packed integer (see `getRGB`).

An alpha channel is _not_ supported when specifying a hex string.

params.description: The color expressed as a recognized string format or a packed integer.
params.name: value

params.description: The object to use for the output. If not provided a new object will be created.
params.name: out

returns.description: The (`out`) object with the red, green, blue, and alpha values set as the r/g/b/a properties.

name: componentToHex
description: Return a string containing a hex representation of the given color component.

params.description: The color channel to get the hex value for, must be a value between 0 and 255.
params.name: color

returns.description: A string of length 2 characters, i.e. 255 = ff, 100 = 64.

name: getRandomColor
description:
Returns a random color value between black and white
Set the min value to start each channel from the given offset.
Set the max value to restrict the maximum color used per channel.

params.description: The lowest value to use for the color.
params.name: min

params.description: The highest value to use for the color.
params.name: max

params.description: The alpha value of the returning color (default 255 = fully opaque).
params.name: alpha

returns.description: 32-bit color value with alpha.

name: getRGB
description:
Return the component parts of a color as an Object with the properties alpha, red, green, blue.

Alpha will only be set if it exist in the given color (0xAARRGGBB)

params.description: Color in RGB (0xRRGGBB) or ARGB format (0xAARRGGBB).
params.name: color

returns.description: An Object with properties: alpha, red, green, blue (also r, g, b and a). Alpha will only be present if a color value > 16777215 was given.

name: getWebRGB
description: Returns a CSS friendly string value from the given color.

params.description: Color in RGB (0xRRGGBB), ARGB format (0xAARRGGBB) or an Object with r, g, b, a properties.
params.name: color

returns.description: A string in the format: 'rgba(r,g,b,a)'

name: getAlpha
description: Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Alpha component, as a value between 0 and 255.

params.description: In the format 0xAARRGGBB.
params.name: color

returns.description: The Alpha component of the color, will be between 0 and 1 (0 being no Alpha (opaque), 1 full Alpha (transparent)).

name: getAlphaFloat
description: Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Alpha component as a value between 0 and 1.

params.description: In the format 0xAARRGGBB.
params.name: color

returns.description: The Alpha component of the color, will be between 0 and 1 (0 being no Alpha (opaque), 1 full Alpha (transparent)).

name: getRed

name: getGreen

params.description: In the format 0xAARRGGBB.
params.name: color

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendLighten
description: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendDarken
description: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendMultiply
description:
Multiplies the backdrop and source color values.
The result color is always at least as dark as either of the two constituent
colors. Multiplying any color with black produces black;
multiplying with white leaves the original color unchanged.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendAverage
description: Takes the average of the source and backdrop colors.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendAdd
description: Adds the source and backdrop colors together and returns the value, up to a maximum of 255.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendSubtract
description: Combines the source and backdrop colors and returns their value minus 255.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendDifference
description:
Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter.

Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendNegation
description: Negation blend mode.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendScreen
description:
Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.
The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors.
Screening any color with white produces white; screening with black leaves the original color unchanged.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendExclusion
description:
Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode, but lower in contrast.
Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendOverlay
description:
Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color.
Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows.
The backdrop color is not replaced, but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendSoftLight
description:
Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.

If the source color is lighter than 0.5, the backdrop is lightened, as if it were dodged;
this is useful for adding highlights to a scene.

If the source color is darker than 0.5, the backdrop is darkened, as if it were burned in.
The degree of lightening or darkening is proportional to the difference between the source color and 0.5;
if it is equal to 0.5, the backdrop is unchanged.

Painting with pure black or white produces a distinctly darker or lighter area, but does not result in pure black or white.
The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendHardLight

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendColorDodge
description:
Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.
Painting with black produces no change.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendColorBurn
description:
Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.
Painting with white produces no change.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendLinearDodge
description: An alias for blendAdd, it simply sums the values of the two colors.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendLinearBurn
description: An alias for blendSubtract, it simply sums the values of the two colors and subtracts 255.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendLinearLight
description:
This blend mode combines Linear Dodge and Linear Burn (rescaled so that neutral colors become middle gray).
Dodge applies to values of top layer lighter than middle gray, and burn to darker values.
The calculation simplifies to the sum of bottom layer and twice the top layer, subtract 128. The contrast decreases.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendVividLight
description:
This blend mode combines Color Dodge and Color Burn (rescaled so that neutral colors become middle gray).
Dodge applies when values in the top layer are lighter than middle gray, and burn to darker values.
The middle gray is the neutral color. When color is lighter than this, this effectively moves the white point of the bottom
layer down by twice the difference; when it is darker, the black point is moved up by twice the difference. The perceived contrast increases.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendPinLight
description:
If the backdrop color (light source) is lighter than 50%, the blendDarken mode is used, and colors lighter than the backdrop color do not change.
If the backdrop color is darker than 50% gray, colors lighter than the blend color are replaced, and colors darker than the blend color do not change.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendHardMix
description:
Runs blendVividLight on the source and backdrop colors.
If the resulting color is 128 or more, it receives a value of 255; if less than 128, a value of 0.
Therefore, all blended pixels have red, green, and blue channel values of either 0 or 255.
This changes all pixels to primary additive colors (red, green, or blue), white, or black.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendReflect
description: Reflect blend mode. This mode is useful when adding shining objects or light zones to images.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendGlow
description: Glow blend mode. This mode is a variation of reflect mode with the source and backdrop colors swapped.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

name: blendPhoenix
description: Phoenix blend mode. This subtracts the lighter color from the darker color, and adds 255, giving a bright result.

params.description: The source color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: a

params.description: The backdrop color to blend, in the range 1 to 255.
params.name: b

returns.description: The blended color value, in the range 1 to 255.

Draws a line using the current line style from the current drawing position to (x, y);

name: clear
description: Clears the graphics that were drawn to this Graphics object, and resets fill and line style settings.

name: generateTexture
description:
Useful function that returns a texture of the graphics object that can then be used to create sprites
This can be quite useful if your geometry is complicated and needs to be reused multiple times.

name: DisplayObject
description:
A display object is any object that can be rendered in the Phaser/pixi.js scene graph.

This includes {@link Phaser.Group} (groups are display objects!),
{@link Phaser.Sprite}, {@link Phaser.Button}, {@link Phaser.Text}
as well as {@link PIXI.DisplayObject} and all derived types.
